column8: The new Kedai Makan has been disappointing throughout. Today's experience was the icing on the cake where they denied us service at 10.05pm for a 10pm reservation because their "kitchen was closed". I cant understand how a restaurant would accept a 10pm reservation but deny entry 5 mins later. And this is when they were accepting reservations till 10.15pm. Thanks for a great friday night - I will never come back again.
Horrible horrible horrible service. They want you in and out and that's it, not worth it. Ruined our whole night
Had a very bad experience. Very long wait. Didn't like the food. Not at all worth the wait.

While the lack of takeout was infuriating at the old Kedai, I have gotta say the new one skimps on portion sizes and the out-of-this-galaxy flavor. You literally bought the recipes from the owners, why not stick to them? Take the flavors and portions they pushed out and add takeout - you will see a healthy profit AND a loyal fan base. For now, I'm holding off on this place again until they find the essence of their food, again.
What was wrong with the old menu that we all knew and loved? Add drinks and seating, then it would have been perfect. But the new menu is nothing special, unfortunately.

What we took away - I wasn't impressed. None of the dishes stood out. Kerabu Mangga - the mix of ripe and semi ripe mangoes in the salad didn't work, i was so excited to order it. The fried rice was too salty to taste on its own. It came with a sweet chilli sauce which was helpful. The pork ribs were good, but they were dry. I had heard good things about this place but maybe we caught them on a bad day.

The original Kedai Makan was one of my favorite restaurants in Seattle, but the new version is a bit of a disappointment. The new location has its pros (much bigger, almost no wait times, nice ambience) but seems to be missing what the original was known for--fantastic food. While the menu is similar, the quality of the food has gone downhill at the new location and the prices have gone up. The texture of the roti net bread was off, the dhal was super oily and missing the depth of flavor it once had, and the nasi goreng could best be described as "okay". The new location might be worth trying for an introduction to Malaysian food, but if you've visited the old, I'm not sure it'll live up to expectations. I was really looking forward to seeing this place come back to life, but I will not be returning.

kedai makan would rate 3.5/5 stars. I really wanted to try this place before they close. Overall, the food was good but just not sure it was worth the hype. I waited in line since 10:30am to put my name down and got a table for 5pm. Their jala was delicious but other vegetarian options were ok. The pudding with longan berries was great!

They had a variety of dishes but I believe they could cook better. I guess they have to serve a crowd so they do it fast and some out of it remains uncooked. And some part of it was a little burnt assuming it got overcooked a little. They are good on the quantity , have to match up on the quality.

A recipe has no soul. The cook must bring soul to recipe. I would say this place partially succeeded in doing the job. I think it's a 3.5*, here is why -Ordered -Kerabu Timun Nanas : cold salad heavily loaded with peanuts and some curry powder I guess. Pineapple and cucumber are my favorite things on this world and this salad ruined it for me.Cocolife : rum, coconut cream and curry powder? Looks interesting right? Tasted like 2/5. Highly not recommended.Roti Jala: sounds like an Indian origin. Best of all the dishes I ordered. If you have tried rice crepes before, roti just tastes like that. Side of dal tasted delicious though.Malay fried peanuts: flavored peanuts that are crispy and tasty.Wait times are crazy, waited close to 1.5hrs. You see more than 4.5*, but honestly I'm not impressed.
the food was good...and we would go there again.

They make me wait for an extra hour. They could be more honest about it. In California restaurants will give you a complimentary drink or something. Last time here. There are plenty of good places in Seattle.
The food was absolutely delicious--big portions and full of flavor. The staff was incredibly friendly and seemed to genuinely love the food they were serving.

Oysters tasted great and fresh! They were the highlight. Tikka masala chicken katsu was an interesting fusion dish. It was good but not something I feel like i need to get again. I think I like the loco moco with scotch egg more. Seems like their menu rotates though since I didn't see some of the items I saw on yelp on their menu. Food was definitely on the pricier side but maybe thats expected from this being more of a bar? 3.5/5

The menu items here were what drew me in to this spot and they did not disappoint. For a party of two, we definitely ordered more with our eyes, but everything just sounded so good that it was hard not to! We had the oysters, Seattle dog musubi, and loco moco scotch egg. The loco moco scotch egg was actually so filling that I had a good amount of leftovers. Looking forward to returning soon since service was friendly and attentive, and the food was tasty. I still need to try the oxtail risotto and tikka tonkatsu don!Highly recommend making reservations in advance, as the restaurant tends to get full pretty often.

I visited this restaurant with my Malaysian boyfriend based on glowing online reviews. Finding truly authentic Malay food in America can be a challenge, so our expectations were high.Roti Jala: This dish surprised me because I had never tried net bread before. I found the chewy texture to be delightful, and it ended up being my favorite from the meal.Nasi Lemak: The dish was good, and the flavors were quite authentic. However, the sambal didn't quite hit the mark.Rusuk Babi: The ribs were fantastic, tender, but the dish overall was very spicy!In summary, the food was good and reasonably authentic. However, we might think twice about bringing his parents here.

I visited this restaurant with my Malaysian boyfriend after reading excellent reviews online. We were excited to find authentic Malay food in the United States.Roti Jala: This dish surprised me because I had never tasted roti net bread before. Nevertheless, I enjoyed its chewy texture, and it turned out to be my favorite from the meal.Nasi Lemak: The flavor was pretty authentic, but the sambal didn't quite hit the mark.Rusuk Babi: The ribs were tender and delicious, but the overall dish was very spicy!In summary, the food was good and reasonably authentic. However, we might not bring his parents here.

My recent visit to Kedai Makan left me with a delightful array of Malaysian flavors and culinary experiences. While there were some remarkable highlights, a few minor areas held back what could have been a perfect dining experience.First and foremost, the Nasi Lemak was a delightful choice, and opting for the tofu option turned out to be a great decision. The dish was flavorful and authentically prepared, showcasing the kitchen's skill in crafting this Malaysian classic.The Roti Jala with chicken curry was not only very good but also visually appealing. The intricate lace-like pattern of the Roti Jala added an extra layer of charm to the dish, and the accompanying chicken curry was rich and savory.However, the real star of the meal was the Chili Pan Mee. It stood out as the best among the dishes we tried. The flavors were explosive, and the noodles were cooked to perfection, maintaining just the right level of consistency. It's a must-try for those seeking a flavorful punch in their meal.On a positive note, the restaurant honored our check-in and offered us a delightful treat to end our meal: coconut ice cream. It was a pleasant surprise and a perfect conclusion to the dining experience.
Amazing food, friendly staff, cool decor. 10/10 bussing. the roti jala with chicken curry in particular was absurdly good, super tender chicken in a great coconut sauce.

They had a variety of dishes, but I believe they could cook better. I guess they have to serve a crowd, so they do it fast and come out of it remains uncooked. And some part of it was a little burnt, assuming it got overcooked a little.We enjoyed our dinner here. The food was delicious, and the staff was friendly and helpful. The site was comfortable to dine in, so simple, and everyone was hospitable. The food took 20 minutes to come out.
Unfortunately they were out of the mushrooms, but the meat dishes we had were very good. Everything was seasoned nicely, and very fresh.

I have been here several times and there is always a crazy wait. I recently tried out the No Wait app to "get in line" rather than actually get in line. The only problem is that you can't get in line until the restaurant opens. I used the app 30min after the restaurant opened on a Tuesday evening and still had to wait almost 2 hours to be seated. Plan on getting pre-dinner drinks at the bars around the corner if you decide to come here. The food is always amazing and makes you feel like the wait was worth it. The menu seems to be slightly different every time I visit so I am always trying something new. I recently had some very spicy and crispy chicken wings. the Jala bread was very delicate and almost melted in my mouth with the curry (?) dipping sauce. For my entree, I enjoyed the nashi goering (?). The food is always hot, always delicious, and heats up well the next day for more goodness. While the food is great, service is sub par. Waitors seems to enjoy plenty of relaxed conversations with each other at the bar while my throat is burning since I seem to never have my water refilled...Would very much appreciate a bit more attentive service. The restaurant is always packed and hiring an extra bus boy/water boy would make a huge difference in service.
Awesome food, fantastic drinks! Expect around an hour wait during the weekends for dinner.

So really great! My first time here. I've learned about it through the grapevine when it was only that little take out place on olive. I'm so happy they updated the place. We'd the roti Babi, chili pan mi and wok cooked pork belly. We ate every bite! Delicious!

The food was absolutely mouthwatering, featuring generous portions that left everyone satisfied. Each dish was bursting with flavor, showcasing a variety of well-balanced ingredients that tantalized the taste buds. The staff went above and beyond in their service; they were exceptionally friendly and welcoming, which made the dining experience even more enjoyable. It was clear that they had a genuine passion for the food they were serving, as they took the time to explain the dishes and share recommendations. Overall, it was a delightful experience that highlighted both the quality of the cuisine and the warmth of the service.
Kedai Makan have a delicious food quality. Great staff services and good environment with Good food too! I will back again......
Would suggest this location! Everything was delicious, the food arrived swiftly, and there were plenty of vegetarian options.The dish with mushrooms was my favorite thing. It had a great flavor.
I thought this place shut down but I guess it was their other location. Food was great here.

I thoroughly enjoyed all the food and drinks at this restaurant. The cocktails were especially nice--I tried the Passion Old Fashioned, the Lychee Martini, and another delightful drink whose name I can't quite remember.The kitchen went above and beyond to accommodate my peanut allergy. They made my wings with a different sauce, as the original had peanuts, which others in my group wanted to try. This thoughtful gesture was much appreciated.My favorite dish of the evening was the Nasi Biryani. The flavors were rich and perfectly balanced. It was a fantastic dining experience, and I can't wait to visit again!

When seafood meets soul food, it's a magical thing!If you're craving comfort food with an ocean twist, then look no further than Shaker + Spear. Last night I had the pleasure of dining here and their food did not disappoint. Soul food classics get a delicious upgrade with fresh local seafood and ingredients. I devoured my seafood boil with a side of greens and can't wait to go back to try some new dishes (they update their menu according to what's fresh in season). I absolutely love the ambiance too. It's a true wine bar vibe. Shoutout to Robin, our waitress that had amazing energy.

We recently dined at this Malaysian restaurant and once again, it didn't disappoint. The Nae Limak was not only delicious but also had a generous quantity--enough for two. Despite the slightly higher prices, it's worth the meal experience. We've been regulars, and the consistency in quality keeps us coming back. The honeycomb cake from the dessert menu was a delightful end to the meal.

Great environment with cozy spaces. We did not order side dishes. We went for main dishes directly as recommended by friends. They all tasted good except ribs (in dry side). Parking can be challenging. Service is good and fast.
Would recommend this place! There were many vegetarian options, the food came out quickly, and everything was very tasty! My favorite item was the mushroom dish. It was very flavorful.
The food was amazing! The service was great! More seating options would be great but otherwise wonderful place!
The food here is great and atmosphere is awesome. We had wonderful service that was quick.
Can be a long wait but well worth it. Some of the most unique food I've had in Seattle. I remember when it was just a take out window!

Holy moly! Best Malaysian spot in town, the place was packed and I now certainly know why, food was excellent, we got the wings, the ribs and and the Nasi lemak, all are definitely a must, can't wait to try other items on the menu when we comeback!
Love love love! Roti Jala and fried rice were extraordinary! We also got the wings and some cocktails, everything was on point. Great service as well, can't wait to try the rest of the menu.

Lovely place to eat. I turned up as a solo diner without a reservation, and they were more than happy to accommodate me. The staff were polite, and the food incredible. I thoroughly enjoyed my meal, even more so as it was served very quickly, piping hot.I highly recommend the nasi goreng kedai, unique, but great nonetheless, and the roti sum were a nice side.

One of the best restaurants in Seattle, you'll never have a bad meal here. Well worth the wait, just make sure to get there early and put your name down. The fried chicken and Roti are off the hook! Service is always great and the ambiance is too.
I love chicken , especially at this place

Got there about 30 minutes before opening and there was already about 8-10 people waiting in line. Get their early if you want to try most of the menu. THE FRIED CHICKEN IS A MUST HAVE, we tried everything on the menu and all was delicious
Fantastic meal, worth the long wait . Been there twice and every time it was on point
Everything was excellent. Food is fantastic and service is friendly. Only complaint is the wait but it's understandable.
kedai makan has fantastic food, it was my first time and they did a great job in every area.
First time having Malaysian food and I'll definitley be coming back to kedai makan!
The food was great.The owner was very friendly and the staff was helpful.Highly recomend .
They had amazing Malaysian food
All I can say is take one step in the place and let your sense of smell do the work. This place is unique and delicious.Cozy and worth the wait.
Wow I can't say enough about this place. So I won't.
If you haven't eaten here you've messed up already. You must go, and go now. Or as soon as you can.
Some of the best food I've had in Seattle! Love this place.

One of the best restaurants in Seattle, you'll never have a bad meal here. Well worth the wait, just make sure to get there early and put your name down. The fried chicken and Roti are off the hook! Service is always great and the ambience is too.
The best authentic Malaysian food in town. Give a shot and you will love it.
One of my favorite spots on the hill.

Worth each moment of any hold up time you're given. Great leader, holding up staff, and obviously, the most tasty and complex flavors you can request in Seattle. Pass on my most loved place in the city.
Get here early when they first open and you'll love it. Otherwise get here later and wait in line and you'll still love it.
Worth the wait. Delicious food, cool ambiance, great service and fun drinks! Be prepared to wait in line but know that you're in for a treat

It's hard to find Malaysian food to begin with, let alone good Malaysian food. The flavors are delightful, reminiscent of when I was wandering around SE Asia, and the portions are more than enough for a meal. The bonus meal you get from leftovers are icing on an already delectable cake of carbs, carbs, and more delicious carbs.If you're looking for something extra special (in a unique way, not a you'll-necessarily-like-it way), try the Chinese herb-infused shots. They pack quite a punch, and, as someone who grew up surrounded by herbal medicine, a healthy dose of nostalgia.Really appreciated being able to share this experience!

Such a lovely gem in Seattle! This restaurant is tucked on the north end of Capitol Hill and sound 4:30pm is when the line starts forming around the block :-OWe ordered the netted roti appetizer, the Nasi Goreng (fried rice with a sunny side up egg on top) and the fried chicken and rice dish. Everything had such complex flavors and were delicious! This place did not disappoint and I can't wait to come back again! Can't wait to bring my mom when she comes to visit!
The best restaurant I have ever had the privilege of attending.

I came back to Kedai Makan to bring a friend that was staying with us from Denver. He liked it and mentioned that he will bring his wife when she comes in town. The food is always great and the service is fast and friendly. If you have not tried this place yet, you need check it out because once they put your order in front of you, you will not be disappointed. Enjoy!!!Any explanation I may attempt to describe Kedai Makan will not do it justice, so I suggest tasting it yourself. In fact, you can try the food by yourself, or get a group to share many dishes! I have had a great experience and great food every time.Service was perfect for my visits here. The drinks are always filled, and my water never touched the bottom. Food arrived in a timely manner. No complaints, really. Will I be back for more? Yes! The food is so yummy!
When you need noodles, this is the place to go!
Amazing food with great service! I was pleasantly surprise and can not wait to go back.
The food was incredibly delicious. Big portions, full flavor. The staff was so very nice and really seemed to love the food they were serving.

Food: The spice blends in the lamb fried rice were amazing - complex and delicious. Also highly recommend the stuffed naan. Table wait time can be up to an hour, but we were able to get seating immediately at the bar.
Love this place!! My favorite food in Seattle!! I would highly suggest checking this place out.
Absolutely incredible food. May be a long wait, but the drinks are unique and amazing, and the food is some of the best Asian I've had.
This is the best restaurant in Seattle as far as I am concerned.
This place was fantastic! Expect long waits, even on weekdays.
the lamb fried rice was so good!!
Straight up volcanic.

Hostess was really rude. Asked for a table and she said it would be 20 minutes. There was no one in the place. My wife came a minute later and she said 30 minutes. Asked politely what the deal was and she was really rude about it.

Corporate raiders. Adding 20% to the bill WTF??? Oh no, Not giving this to the servers, but pocketing for pure profit. Unscrupulous to wait to the end of the meal to tell us. What's the issue? Can't compete fairly with other real restaurants??? Looser management. Never go to Elliott's or any other E3 owned restaurant. Unbelievable, truly"

Worst host ever!  He was very rude and stereotyped us right from the start! Told us they weren't taking walk-ins and while we were literally standing right there he offered 4 other people walk-in spots!  He also turned the Asian guy away!  How can he be LBGTQ and still judge people? He should know better about being judged.  Such a shame! If zero stars were an option I would have gladly entered it.

The food is good but BE AWARE that there's a 20% service charge plus 9.3% tax on the service charge. There's no sign about this charge and you'll find out on the receipt when you are paying. You end up paying over 40% to the total when you include gratuity for your server. I'm NOT going back to this restaurant!

While I was dining at Elliot's Oyster House, I witnessed the most appalling scene. Near my table, a man was being interviewed for a serving job. The hiring manager, at a certain point, said to the applicant, "Look around at the servers. We don't hire your kind here." The applicant was a black man. The applicant had a friend (maybe partner? unsure) with him who immediately got up to leave. The applicant replied to the hiring manager by saying, "You can't talk to me like that, sir. That is out of line." The hiring manager replied with, "You know what? We don't even like serving your kind here," and promptly kicked the applicant and his companion out of the restaurant. I quickly asked for the check and left the restaurant. I don't care how good the food is or isn't, I vow to never support this restaurant again. If I had ever known that they employ racists and ask those racists to hire based on skin color, I never would have set foot in the establishment in the first place. The sheer audacity that a hiring manager felt comfortable having this conversation in the dining area, within earshot of paying customers, is indicative of the kind of insidious racism that can't be pinned on one solitary employee. Elliot's can't do anything to make up for this. I can't imagine what the culture is like in the kitchen, where the line staff is likely entirely composed of people of color. Will never set foot in here again and highly encourage everyone to reconsider spending their money in a place that discriminates against the African American community.
Worst Mother's Day experience!!! Had reservations but many seated before us. Very unacceptable!!!
The place gets one star for consistently ignoring emails sent to management regarding an incident of very bad and insulting service. Never going back, never recommending.

Very bad service, we went there for dinner on Monday,  we got seated in the room where they have the large tables, the waiter who took care of us gave us a lousy bad service, he made a couple mistakes, he didn't took any dirty dishes out of the table, our table was a mess, he didn't even offer us dessert, (young tall cocky white guy, reddish hair, tattooed arms, waive short hair and glasses) so next time if you go to Elliotts and this guy is ur server u better run off

All we wanted was happy hour but the bar was full so we asked to sit on the patio they said yes. They put us at the very end of the patio outside which was okay because it was a nice day. We had to go into the bar and order our own drinks which was fine. But then we decided we wanted to have the oysters so we went into the bar to order the oysters and they told us no because we were not sitting in the happy hour section very very very bad service Left unhappy
Unreasonably slow service and quality is not worth the price.
Over priced. Took extremely long. Food was fair, fries not cooked well. Seems a place like this could properly cook french fries. 3 people agree the "gravy" was friggen wierd.
Not worth it. If you can find another place, go there. It might seem nice at first on the outside as it is beside the water but overall is a failure.
The food was good but the service was horrific. If you go plan to wait. We waited 45 minutes for a cup of chowder and salad. No apologies given.

We chose to eat here because our friends were already downtown and we wanted seafood. The restaurant is located in a very touristy location, which takes away from the experience. Oysters: The oysters all tasted the same and were not particularly memorable. There are better places for oysters in Seattle. Appetizers: The calamari is frozen, not fresh, which the waitress was forthcoming about when we asked. We did not order it. The crab cakes were fine, but not remarkable. I ordered the Cioppino for the main course. The fish was tough--I did not like the texture and was not sure how fresh the fish was. Bottom line: Save your money for better food and a better atmosphere in a less touristy part of town.
Nothing special but longer time waiting for food! We have been waiting with 3 cups of water Above 20 minutes~
Very average food, especially for the price. We were very disappointed. I wouldn't recommend them.

Elliott's Oyster House was really good. The oysters were fantastic, especially with the awesome toppings they came with. The mussels were great, and the crab cakes were delish. The salmon Caesar was also very tasty.The views from the patio are lovely, which definitely added to our experience. The service, on the other hand, was just okay. It started off pretty slow, and unfortunately, our server forgot to bring the spicy crab & corn chowder we were excited to try. But overall, we still had a good experience!
Loved the view but Oysters were bad, they brought us new ones but after I consumed a bad one. Felt a little gross but the risk in oysters. amazing views worth it despite the touristy vibe
While this restaurant was quite good, it was not worth the prices they were charging.

We recently dined at Elliott's Oyster House during our Seattle visit and our experience was a mixed bag. Let's start with the beverages - I ordered an Old Fashioned and Amy had a glass of cider. The Old Fashioned was quite disappointing. Note to all restaurants - don't serve this classic cocktail without a single ice cube, it's a major faux pas.We kicked off our meal with an assortment of oysters. It's fascinating how different oysters can taste depending on their origin, and as someone who prefers ones that carry the taste of the sea, this was a treat. The Ahi Tuna Tacos were next - they were perfectly portioned and tasted incredibly fresh.The Seafood Pasta was a hearty and rich dish, with shellfish taking center stage. However, my wife Amy wished there had been more shrimp. The seasonal specialty, a Halibut dish, came served with fresh vegetables and was full of flavor.But here's where things get tricky - Elliott's Oyster House is not easy on the wallet. The prices are quite steep, and to add to that, there's a mandatory 20% service charge added to the bill. The check mentions that part of this charge is shared with the service staff, who are paid a competitive wage. But what's unclear is the exact portion of the service charge that actually goes to the staff. In comparison, other similar establishments often explicitly outline what percentage of the service charge goes to the wait staff. Without this knowledge, customers like us are left wondering if we should tip more and whether the servers are actually benefitting from the service charge. In conclusion, while the food at Elliott's Oyster House is truly wonderful, the service charge practices leave you with an unsavory aftertaste. It's a real pity, as such issues detract from an otherwise great dining experience.

The spot was very more agreeable than anticipated. We felt like home so we cut our stuff down and furthermore laid back on the excursion persona we have when we got out. We had an incredible time here. Some of the best oysters you'll find. Seattle really grows on you.
I never been to a restaurant have such a fresh seafood. The view is beautiful, one thing is don't expect the service. Service was horrible.
Cheap oysters during happy hour. Im sold!! Had a great time here the other day and I will be coming back for ages.
I love supporting local businesses; this place offers a very fancy experience at a very high price for oysters if you're not going for happy hour. Their staff is great and always helpful.
Seriously we paid $100 for dinner and they couldn't give us bread without charging $3.
Food was decent for the price paid. It wasn't outstanding by any means.
I enjoy there clam chowder, but I didn't enjoy the hostess!
Over 2 dz oyster varieties!
Really pricy but the food was pretty good. Large portions.
Great Happy Hour. Otherwise the menu is a bit pricey.
Very good. I had the sole and the house salad. It was way too much food for me.
Meh...

I'm new to the city and this place was recommended to me by my co-worker. I think this place has it's positives and negatives. I loved loved loved the happy hour. The oyster's were incredibly yummy and it was unexpectedly affordable. However, when going back for dinner at a later time I was very disappointed. I found the food was not up to par - especially considering the price. Also, I wasn't satisfied by the seating. Our table had a lot to be desired.I will go back again and try out lunch but will go with a reservation and request a boot so that there will be more room. The servers were pleasant, which is very important to me.Will re-review once I go for lunch. *fingers crossed*

Tourist place, nothing wrong, but nothing special.Seafood is excellent. The place is big and busy, filled with tourists. But there's no special class to the presentation, nor anything but standard fare on the menu. Swordfish - with potato salad and mustard. Now there's a creative presentation! Crab cakes - with slaw and fries. Go here if you need some boring food. Good food, but boring.
Even the restaurant was in a tourist area, but more food. I hope they continue. Only one thing, we have to wait to eat. Overall we will enjoy our meal.
Great service and food. The chef's on oysters was awesome. The view warps the whole experience up that few restaurants can match.

Recently dined at this restaurant and the crab cake and oysters were delicious, definitely a highlight of the meal! Unfortunately, the halibut was a letdown, it didn't quite live up to my expectations. However, the stunning view made up for it, and the good weather added to the overall pleasant ambiance. The service was also top-notch, friendly and attentive. Overall, it was a nice day out, and I would recommend this place for the views and some of their seafood options, just maybe not the halibut!

Consider this review from someone who is not an avid seafood lover. However, the ambience was nice and make sure that you make a reservation prior to going OR be the first to stand in line when it opens. The Servers and management were very nice and accommodating. We ate they right after they opened and the food was good. I ordered Fish and Chips and the Clam Chowder. The clam chowder had a really tasty base. I definitely would recommend this place while visiting Seattle.

The seafood was fresh and delicious. The service was very friendly, and our server was very attentive and accommodating. We had the crab which was fresh and tasted great, and the Oysters were out of this world. I also loved their clam chowder. All tasted great. Some of our dishes are expensive, but I'm sure it was all worth it.

We enjoyed the food at this place but the facilities sure need a little revamping and even a little more serious cleaning in some places. We ordered the clam linguini, the seafood risotto, a couple of the fish a chips, a glass of wine and strawberry lemonade. We all felt the food was very tasty, packed with quality and fresh seafood. A good wine selection allowed for a good glass of wine and the strawberry lemonade was a hit with the kiddo in our party. But for the location, the up an coming newly revamped Seattle water front, this place fell short in terms of style and even cleanliness. The carpet throughout the place is truly done after way too many years of service, and the bathrooms were truly way out of sync with the location, menu prices and reputation of the place. So they loose a star (should have been minus 2 stars but wanted to be more lenient). The bathrooms were for sure fairly dirty, but the food still made up for the decaying ambiance. Hopefully it gets a lift sometime soon. P.S. the staff was welcoming, very nice and efficient.Thanks

Our appetizers were very good (oysters on half shell, calamari, clams) but I did not like my main course: the halibut. Everyone else liked their entree. A little overpriced but not terrible (except crab was really high). Need reservations! The people who came at same time as us were told an hour wait or more. Restaurant wasn't super crowded but probably limited due to being short-staffed.
The oysters are cooked really well, delicious sauces to pick from too!

This was my restaurant of choice for my recent birthday party. I had the Halibut cheeks with wild rice and a shot of Glen-Livett. The portion of the food that was given was very impressive for me. I have a cup of their clam chowder too and it's perfect. The atmosphere here is beautiful and the bar is awesome. This is an absolutely lovely restaurant and they have outdoor seating. Their staff was helpful, hardworking, and the service was excellent. They wear a mask and they enforce social distancing too. Kudos to this eatery. I'll brag to my buddies about this store.
Great food and atmosphere. Lovely first night dinner. Service was super friendly too.
A little overpriced but I love their oyster chowder ! Very nice sit down restaurant off the pier in downtown Seattle.
Prices can be high but that's why I get paid well.
Good spot. The fish and chips were huge
Excellent oysters! I had the house salad and highly recommend it. Service was also excellent but very busy so relax and enjoy the atmosphere. It is speedy but it is fine dining on the Harbor.

Remedy to Review - in the wake of voicing my failure with the dinner (not the administration which was astounding), the general director contacted me and tried to make things right. I regard that and value his thought. He has given me a gift voucher to take care of my expense and, that by itself, is all that could possibly be needed to make things right. I mean to return and attempt Elliott's Oyster House once more. My suggestion is that it merits experimenting with and if things aren't up to standard, convey it up to the administration. I'm certain they will take the necessary steps to make things right.
It was excellent food but we had to ask for drinks after about 15-20 minutes. Service wasn't the best but awesome food.
Great happy hour if you're an oyster lover. My company has an office up here and this is my go to place for oysters on the half shell. Get there early!

While I would give the food about a 4, the location is a 5, and the wait staff is always friendly and nice. This is really about a 4.5 stars.The Oysters are solid, but I would suggest that when you order your fish medium rare, you emphasize that they cook it that way -- mine came semi well done.

I have been here about 6 times. I have only been for happy hour, but it is excellent. All of the small plates on the happy hour menu are very good and the drinks are excellent. I brought a foodie friend from out of town to Elliott's Oyster House and he was impressed with my selection.
Excellent oysters yes one of my favorite foods, and this is a great location, just get there early, friendly staff and don't forget happy hour.

The food was very good. Portions were terribly small. Spent over $200 on dinner for 2 people, my wife and I. My 115 pound wife made me take her to get pizza afterwards because she didn't get enough to eat...

Come here do the amazing oysters and happy hour specials. Best part of the whole thing. Better seafood experiences can be found other places with less tourists. But as far as an oyster bar it is perfection.

Delicious! Had the king salmon grilled. Smaller than I thought but oh so tasty!! We were a group of 28 so it was a tough order to keep us sorted out and the noise level was a challenge. All in all, the views, location, service and food were as I expected, pricy, above average quality and good service. I would go again for another special occasion. Requesting a quiet corner.
Awesome oyster! Waiter was very knowledgeable on all types of oyster. The hamma hamma, was our favorite.
When they call it the Oyster House they were not kidding, all the Oysters you can eat. Try to catch them during their happy hour from 3 - 6 and you will not be sorry

Only the best oysters today: Hama Hama, Kumamoto, Cranberry Creek & Hump Island. Eating them & then finishing it up with the dessert like Chinook salmon aka King Salmon alder planked prepared medium rare with beurre blanc & the season's fresh vegetables was surely a dessert of its own, as it is seldom noticed as one, whilst finishing sweet down my gullet with Omega 3 oily fats in the finest way possible. If I could see the merry catch hauled off the Puget Sound whilst eating the very catch, bait & shelled crustaceans as they're coming off the boat from the Pacific Ocean, then it would have surely been a more superlative sight to behold, & I may have added another star, so catch that. ;-) Being one of the tourist venues notwithstanding garners it one less star. Just eat, chat with the knowledgeable shuckers & then shlurppp some more, & then what? Then proceed outward bound hastily walking out from Elliott's, which is packed like sardines with the general ill-informed tourist populace popping their heads in here thinking this is THE place where locals go, & then constantly bobbing their heads in disbelief like the buoys you can also see out in the water. :-PGood, attentive service followed by the charging of my phone was even better than the real catch. ;-)
Came for dinner, it was ok. Overpriced. Came for happy hour, what a deal.Recommend only for happy hour.
I love oysters. The oyster house is the place to go. A little spendy but well worth the drive into seattle!!!

Really good food. They had an amazing spread of oysters and delicious food. We split the strawberry and walnut salad and the ciopino. Only reason why not 5 stars is although the food was good, the price was very high. Bread and butter was an extra $5 which seems ridiculous not to include that at a fine dining restaurant when you're asking patrons to pay $35+ per plate not including apps, drinks, etc.

It was so great that we ate there twice in the 3 nights we were in Seattle. Service the first night, brilliant, I 'd crab and they did the total crab service with the bib, hand washing and all that fun stuff. The second time we had a younger waiter that 'spoke too much" according my honey. I adored the salmon bisque and the crab (yeah, not overly original). Honey had oysters galore and they were fresh (made me have a flashback to my days as a mermaid) but I actually can not tell the distinct in flavor.

Would be five stars if the two younger hostesses at the front desk weren't so rude. Hey we're condescending and had an attitude like they didn't want us to be there. They shouldn't be employed at Elliot's as the first impression.

The oyster happy hours is always fun! A race to order more before prices hike up every 30 minutes. They seem to have a good selection of local draft beers as well which go well with the oysters! Wine selection is actually decent and reasonably priced. Only downside is the regular seafood menu items like fish, crab, etc. are good but nothing spectacular. Still, overall, I am a fan!
If i had only know about the progressive oyster happy hour before I ordered. Still, this place is great.

Room didn't have coffee maker, so I ordered a pot of coffee from roomservice. The pot was good size, and was only $6. But with a $4 service fee and 18% gratuity, it was an expensive pot. Room service food was great, restaurant food was great.

Great happy hour prices, great view if you seat by the pier! Knocked off a star due to long waits but that's understandable, their happy hour prices increased recently though :( the cheapest happy hour is now $1 per oyster. Still great, fresh, juicy, but you know how it feels when you are 100% positive that a place increased their pricing!
Okay. For the price, it was not spectacular.
really nice place. food was good.
All positive, and on a Sunday evening! Definitely a return visit!
Great seafood fettucini.
Just great! Tasty drinks too.
Oh boy this place is super expensive oh well still pretty good.
salmon was great, but the view was amazing!!
Great oysters and excellent service.

Who knew there was so much to oysters?! Those slimy gooey sexy little briny bivalves! OMG. I think the oysters here were definitely the highlight of our self-guided Seattle food and drink tour. Pretty cool little happy hour deal on them too - I think they start at like 75 cents each and then increase every half hour. Unfortunately, we got there at the last half hour, so by that time they were $1.75 each, but damn, they were worth it. And the oyster shucker (oyster tender?) knew a LOT about all of them, giving us samples of his favorites as we dined at the bar. It's a swanky spot for sure, perhaps a bit outside of our swank range, but we sat at the bar with a drink and some happy hour oysters (and other appetizers which were less memorable, including the babiest sized mussels I have ever seen! - slightly disappointing) and we enjoyed ourselves thoroughly. So I say to you, Yelpers, go there for happy hour. Get there early and fill yourselves with many, many deliciously glistening oysters. They're good for you!
Came up from Gig Harbor for lunch today and the oysters were great. Very fresh. The room is a bit too touristy for me. The service was efficient but I really came for the oysters and I'd do it again.
The seafood is outstanding
Always a good time; quality service, and quality oysters.
service was not the best, but can't really complain about 50 cent oysters!!

First stop in must do things in Seattle was the .50 cent oyster HH that runs Monday thru Friday. The way it works is starting at 3pm the HH prices are .50 cents each with a 3 dozen per table limit on the order. If you finish the ones you order you can order more but depending on the currnet time each half hour the price increases by .25 cents. Factors like the time to place the order and have the oysters shucked plus eat time can slow the glutany process down. At 4 when we finally made it there and got a table the price was already $1 per oyster, not terrible but not quite the price we had been shooting for so curse you broken GPS, Seattle freeway system, Seattle parking machines and man who took extra 20 mins at the table which we were waiting for at the bar......Yeah I know better planning should have been happening here but we were dying to try em. We also got $3 beers, oyster shooters and a few other appetizers for $3 each. The Salmon Slider was really awesome in my opinion but the fish taco was just ok. I liked the oyster but I didn't love them and I felt the sizes were not consistent but over all I would love to just stuff myself on .50 cent oysters next visit.
Excellent spot for drinks and appetizers.
ok!
If I lived in seattle, I'd go there for happy hour oysters every friday!

I'm not an oyster fan but my fiance is. So i was very excited to find out they have alot on their menu other then just oysters. They have amazing seafood pasta dishes. And good cocktails. I rarely say avoid happy hour, because normally the deals are really good. The only thing is people have caught on to their cheap oysters at happy hour so the place is fairly packed.
Very good oysters, and a hefty selection.

A friend and I had been galavanting about town all day and wanted to eat somewhere semi-fancy for dinner. After wandering up and down the pier looking for a restaurant that my friend wanted to go to that he couldn't remember the name of, or where it was, or what it looked like, we settled on Elliot's.The food was great, and the waitstaff was very attentive. We started with the Appetizer Tower, which the waiter seemed a little shocked that we wanted that much food between the two of us for our APPETIZER, but neither of us had eaten anything all day, and hell, we were in for an adventure. I didn't try any of the calamari, but my friend said that it was very good, and I really enjoyed the crab cakes, and the dip was good as well. Ate my appetizers with a very tasty Lemon Drop.For entrees, I had the King Salmon and chips, he had the Blackened Rockfish. I'd never had breaded salmon before, and while it was good, it left a little to be desired taste-wise. The Rock Fish I was told was tasty, but could've tasted a little Blacker. Had my entree with the best Mai Tai I've ever had!For dessert, I had the Granny Smith Apple Napoleon, which was AMAZING, despite not a hazelnut to be seen. My friend had the Deep Fried Truffle Sundae, which I had a bite of and thought was very good.Finished the meal with some Kenyan coffee to sober us up enough to make it to our next destination :)All and all, it was a very good dining experience. They do get docked a star though do to our complaints (listed above) about the entrees, and the fact that while there was not another person out of the bar/lounge area, they still tried to hide us (a very pierced, tattooed, brightly colored duo) in the furthest table in the back.

As a first-time visitor to Seattle, dining at Elliott's Oyster House was an absolute highlight of the trip! The food and drinks were incredibly delicious, and the ambiance was equally amazing--elegant yet welcoming, with stunning waterfront views. Everything from the fresh oysters to the perfectly crafted cocktails exceeded our expectations. We're already planning to come back on our next visit to Seattle! A small tip: make a reservation ahead of time because this place gets busy, and it's easy to see why. Highly recommended!

If you're craving fresh seafood in a cozy, upscale atmosphere, Elliott's Oyster House delivers a truly exceptional dining experience. Located in the heart of the city, this seafood haven offers a wide range of dishes that highlight the best of the ocean's bounty.

Our company recently hosted a dinner for 30 guests at Elliott's Oyster House in Seattle, and let me tell you - they exceeded every expectation! We had 10 additional guests show up unexpectedly, but Corrine and Vince worked their magic to accommodate everyone seamlessly, as if it had been planned from the start. They quickly arranged extra tables and chairs without missing a beat.Nick and Tom were absolute stars, keeping everything running smoothly and ensuring that all our guests were happy throughout the evening. The service was 1000% - truly flawless!And the food? Outstanding! Every dish was top-notch, but I have to give a special shoutout to the desserts - they were phenomenal!If you're looking for a venue for any event, I highly recommend Elliott's Oyster House. The combination of impeccable service and incredible food makes it the perfect place for any gathering. We'll definitely be back!

Elliot's Oyster House offers a perfect blend of fresh seafood, excellent service, and stunning waterfront views. The oysters were incredibly fresh with a wide variety to choose from, and the staff's recommendations were spot on. We also loved the crab cakes and grilled salmon, both cooked to perfection.The wine and cocktail selections paired perfectly with our meal, enhancing the overall experience. With its inviting atmosphere and unbeatable location, Elliot's is a must-visit for seafood lovers. We can't wait to return!
Amazing food , excellent service and beautiful view. Would definitely come back!! Our waitress gave excellent recommendations.
Place was really clean, service was fast and drinks were delicious. Food was really tasty.

Wonderful seafood dinner by the water with views of the sound, ferries, and sunset. Ordered the Kumamoto oyster, mussels and crab cakes as starters. Followed by the grilled prawns, swordfish and scallops as entrees. Oysters were so good and especially liked the grilled prawns. Highly recommended!
Fabulous place for our special celebration! Just gets better and better each time. Service great, food superb!! Portions were very generous with their price truly affordable. Will keep coming back!

We stopped by here before SeaTac because we were craving fresh seafood, and we were shocked at the quality. A friend said their fried oysters were the best he's ever had, and the fresh oysters I ordered were absolutely amazing! The clam chowder was probably the best I've ever had, as well. Customer service was top-notch from our first step in the door. So appreciating this place and will be back soon!

The oyster bar has one of the most extensive offerings I have ever seen. The service was friendly and quick. The restaurant is beautiful. There was a bit of a service issue,The clam chowder, my personal fave, was delicious. We ordered a panko crusted fish and chips for the table which satisfied our craving for fried fish.
Good Seattle staple! Was a bit cold inside but the food and service were all in point!
The oysters are super fresh, and the Dungeness crab is a standout. The sea view vibe is relaxed, not too fancy. Good service too. . Shoutout to the staff--super friendly.
First time here the seafood was great! Great service and loved the location on the waterfront.
Food was great an Charles the server was excellent. Definitely coming back for another meal
This place is realy amazing,the food wos sooo tasty.Honestly i realy love this place,my bf and i came here for seafood experience it wos soo tasty.
Great services ,good food very clean place
Food is good and the vibe is good as well. The waiter that served me was top notched so I'd give this a 6/5.
Very nice place and the food is always deliciously served.
Overall, our dining experience was great! Definitely will be back again on our next visit to Seattle.
Stopped by while I was in town for business. I love oysters and this place was so good
Great customer service and also have a great dishes which will make you come back for me
I highly reccommend this place.

doesn't look like much when you walk past, but I was practically dying of hunger so I popped in. The definition of a hole-in-the-wall. I got the regular hamburger and wow... there are no words. A classic burger done right. Crisp bun, juicy patty, stuffed with all the essentials (ketchup, shredded lettuce, tomato, and pickles). There's about a million options available between the menu board and wall full of specials, so it can get a little overwhelming, but you really can't go wrong. Not much else to say besides go see for yourself! You won't be disappointed.

The setting of the caf is the thing that removed me as it can oblige individuals agreeable. Other than that, the servers were amicable and assisted us with choosing the best supper that we could appreciate. So far no gripes since it was my first time there however you merit my 5 star rating.
Been looking for a place to get some really good oysters and I finally filed it too bad I was only visiting from out of state if I ever come again I will definitely be back would highly recommend
Nice place and good service. Delicious food as well. Highly recommended
I was in town with my dad, and we wanted to visit this place for dinner. We really enjoyed this place, and it's a restaurant that never disappoints you.
The food was amazing and they treated us really well. I will definitely come back when I come back to Seattle!

Brought my parents in for dinner last week. We didn't have reservations but were sat right away. Everything from service, ambiance and quality of food was incredible. We had several dozen oysters, pan fired oysters, king crab legs and some salads. Everything top-notch! Great care was taken to follow state rules regarding Covid-19 but never felt that it impeded on our meal. Our entire party left very happy and full.I would highly recommend Elliott's to anyone interested in the best seafood in Seattle!
Excellent food, especially the oysters. Would highly recommend.
My favorite hot spot for oysters. Wis I could eat here every day. Great waitstaff.
I love the see food and this place is amazing for that food

I enjoyed an evening meal here with some friends, and we all had a wonderful time. We did make reservations ahead of time. The location was very nice, and we sat outside with the view of the water. The food was amazing. We had oysters, spicy crab, and King Salmon. They are all tasted great.
The food was wonder and the Natalie was friendly and knowledgeable I recommend this place.
Food and oysters were great!!! Our server Natalie was awesome! Very knowledgeable about the oysters and helpful.
Awesome fresh oysters. House salad is delicious also. The staff is super friendly, definitely a great place to go!!

This place is incredible!!! Everything from the food to the service was perfect. The cocktails that we started off with were delicious and well priced. The variety of oysters our server chose for us were incredible. My entree of salmon was perfectly cooked and seasoned. My girlfriend's rockfish was interesting and tasty. Our server answered every question that we had and was spot on with every possible detail for our meal. Wish I could give this place more stars! We will definitely be back the next time that we are in Seattle!!!
I eat here every time I am in Seattle.  The food is great and service outstanding.

My friend convinced me that Elliot's was the place to go if I wanted the best oysters on the pier. And I wasn't disappointed. We sat at the Bar and was served delicious drinks by Ben. He also recommended some great pairing with our appetizers. He provided excellent service as we feasted on our Happy Hour oysters. They were delicious and too tempting when asked if we wanted more and the minutes seem to pass by faster. The ambiance is really great. You have the view right out to the pier. The food is on point. And I couldn't have been happier with my sweet fresh Seattle oysters. Shout out to Ben and the staff here!

When in Seattle right? A friend took me here for their happy hour which was unique to anything I've experienced. For $1.50?? That's a great price.The oysters were fresh and flavorful, there were two types that we ordered and both were delicious. They came with pink Himalayan salt as well as tobasco sauce, and a house made sauce. You can't complain about the cost, and you don't feel guilty eating so many!The service was very friendly, we ordered more as we went and also asked for more sauce and our waiter happily helped us. A must go for fresh oysters!

Wow u have to try their mussel n calms, oyster, crab cake n the pan fried oysters n salmon exceeded my expectation. We like the place, the atmosphere, the view, the people, the service and the food. This is a place I would enjoy coming with friends regularly.
The service quick & efficient. The prices reasonable. The food excellent.
Elliot's is one of my go-to places for seafood. I looooooove the fried..everything haha. Really, everything is good. Love it!

Amazing service!!!! The king crabs is buttery to perfection! The layout is nice and open with a gorgeous view. It's not too loud and once again the service especially the chefs are on point! Go here if you like seafood!
Here you can find the best steak in town :) I know is a oyster house but for those one who prefer meet I hope this will be helpful.
Dude, it's Elliots! Nuff said! OYSTERS ON THE1/2 Shell!
Amazing place and a must for oysters, the service was the best I have had in Seattle.
The oysters and crab melt were good.. service was nice . Large verity of oysters to choose from

Really great! The poke appetizer was awesome. I feel like the wine was poured light, but good options. I got king crab legs which was cooked perfectly and easy to get out of the shell. My date ordered the Halibut which was incredible! I would order the halibut next time. We got the strawberry shortcake dessert which was also very tasty and full of flavor. There are so many places to eat in Denver, and i would choose to come back here.

This place is amazing. It lives up to all the good reviews on yelp and then some. I had the steamed sampler with peel and eat shrimp, mussels and clams. The shrimp were huge, the clams delicious and the mussels steamed perfect. The coleslaw on the side, a perfect blend of tangy vinegar and dressing to go well with the meal. The wait staff were also awesome. If you love good seafood without all the fuss, go here.
Great place in Seattle to have a seafood
Loved their space and oysters! Perfect for a big party and fancy brunch. Oysters were pretty fresh and service was decent as well. Classy!
Absolutely love this place!! The best seafood, the best service, the best happy hour!! Sit at the bar, it's the best spot as well!
Great meal, but very expensive.
Very expensive. but pretty good if you don't get the red tide shellfish.
The best seafood place in Seattle. Great food, great service.
Why not go back to a restaurant that really took care of you and fed you great yummy seafood and oysters and crabs

THE FOOD WAS AWESOME! The view couldn't have been better. Our server was very, very sweet and caring. She did an impeccable job waiting on us. Thank you to all those reviews, it helped us decide to try it! Seafood is a staple of the Seattle eating scene and Elliott's has represented it perfectly. It is ot the cheapest place in town, but well worth the price.
Best variety of oysters i have seen yet.
Love their oysters! Go there at happy hour to get more oysters!
Good food and a great, authentic setting. No line, either!

Super nice and classy place for seafood. I love oysters so I had to try it. The oysters were so fresh they practically melted in my mouth. The service was fantastic especially for a busy dinner hour. All and all I'm glad I went out of my way to give the place a shot, you should to. You will not be disappointed coming here if your a seafood lover. Nice atmosphere to.

I love this place...the food is very fresh and delicious. The oysters are very good, this is the place where you get the freshest produce from the market. The menu is easy to follow and the waiters are very pleasant and easy to work with. They don't give any attitude and will take good care of you. I never thought that I would be able to differentiate between various types of oysters before I started coming here but I was pleasantly surprised. There are a lot of tourists that stop in but it's one of the best attractions in Seattle. It can get a little busy so you need to know when to go, otherwise the service is quick and enjoyable. Its' also clean considering how many people stop in every day. If you are looking for the freshest oysters, go there and you will not be disappointed.
Went last night with the office. Great food, great service, awesome night!
I love this place. It makes me so happy.

I love this place! Every time I'm in town I come here for dinner. Their oyster variety is great and delish! You also have a great view of the waterfront and it's right next to the famous wheel. Highly recommend! Start off with an oyster and tequila shot ;)
wowowowowowowowowowow this is the best food i have ever had in my life of 27 years i am extremly satisfied and i would like to come back here again and eat all this beautkufl tasty food.
Came here for their happy hour! Oysters were fresh and their appetizers were delicious. Staff were very professional and friendly. Will definitely come here again!

I was here about 4 years ago and enjoyed their Dungeness Crab. First time I ever ate that type of crab (I'm and East Coast guy) and love it and order it whenever I get a chance. They also had these enormous seafood towers that looked amazing... but we were too busy eating the crabs to want anything else.
NOM NOM NOM NOM... Martinis and oysters from around the area... What else can you ask for?!
Excellent food! We had lunch there and liked it! Prices were reasonable too. Would recommend it!
Loved here, but just too many people
Great location, great service, great food what more can you ask for!
I love oysters, and there really isn't a much better destination than this one in Seattle. Hands down the best around in this town.

I haven't eaten at a ton of places in the Seattle area yet, I'd estimate about 20, but this place is far and away the best! Our waiter was awesome and every thing we ordered was delicious. I highly recommend the oysters. There's not much to say about this place that hasn't already been said. Just go!
The only place to go when in the area. Great food, great service and great atmosphere.

Wasn't sure where I wanted to go for lunch. Been to some stuck up places but this place seems cool. Having lunch and the bartender is very cool. Made grwat recommendations to save me a few bucks. Def will come again.
great oyster selection. I was very impressed. definitely try out this place. we ordered a big selection of oysters, the salmon and the fish and chips. All were great.
TOP NOTCH oysters here.  And great service. Go if you haven't!
only the best of the best happy hour in town!!!! the very best and freshest oysters!!!

Came here for the happy hour oysters. 3-4pm is $1 per oyster. Came here right after the locks cruise and waited for 30 minutes. We positioned ourselves behind a family seated in the bar area as it's first come first serve. Table would have been a two hour wait. Got a dozen hama hama oysters and a dozen calm cove oysters. Came with complimentary pink champagne vinaigrette flavored ice. Also ordered calamari in garlic aioli, tequila lime mussels, and black cod lox. Ordered a drink of grapefruit Collins. All were so delicious and cheap. Worth the wait for happy hour prices.
Best bloody caesar around.
great price with fresh seafoods!!!! i would go back to visit again!!
Go for the happy hour!
Excellent service. Food was delicious. Would definitely come again!
Great oysters
Happy hour oysters at Elliott's are a must!
Great food and great location. A staple in our Seattle dining experience. Frequent positive experiences with staff and consistent food. Would strongly recommend! Multiple times. And then a few more.
Excellent service. Food was great. Wonderful location.
Excellent service and quality of dishes!
Wonderful evening. The food is terrific, and the atmosphere is charming.
loved it!

Love the HH... always go there on monday cause is my day off... the HH oyster so tasty... yummm... soup is good, great services... sometime wait kinda long but is worth it... THE BEST OYSTER IN STATE ...... yayyyyyyyyyyy
12 for me and 12 for me. Kumamotos here are zee best!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Best oyster happy hour! Worth the wait.

Dan & I still talk about the King Salmon...pretty much anything to do with salmon and this place knows how to serve it. It melts like "butta" in your mouth. It was so good the first night, we went back a second night. With drinks and everything the check was well over $100 each night. But let me just say it was so worth it!
Love, Love, Love this place. Food, staff and atmosphere is 5 stars or more.

Had a fantastic lunch here - this is what living in Seattle is all about! We were seated by a corner glass window overlooking the Puget Sound, with the sun, boats, and Bainbridge Island in the background. The wait staff was very courteous and attentive, and their recommendations on the menu were very helpful. We had the smoked salmon linguine and Rockfish tacos, along with an oyster sampler. The champagne topping for the oyster sampler went well with the oysters, without overpowering them. The salmon linguine was delicious and a generous portion size, due to being so rich! I actually had trouble finishing it. The Rockfish tacos were delicious and had a very fun presentation - the redness of the very large cut of Rockfish was an eye-catcher. The texture was perfect - most and just flakey enough. The atmosphere and food were top notch, and the setting can't be beat. I would take any newcomer to Seattle here for a real experience of Seattle living!
The scallop risotto is to die for!
Amazing seafood & great atmosphere!
Freshest oysters I've ever had!!Go for their amazing happy hour.
Best oysters and smoked salmon pasta!
Killer shellfish paella! Great service by knowledgeable and friendly waiters.
Happy hour menu is excellent. Atmosphere is wonderful and the service is attentive. Great place to check out!

I had to sign up for Yelp today in order to leave my review because I don't know where else I can do it, maybe on Google too. Nah....food is not the same as it was before. This will be good only for those who never tried real Georgian food in Georgia. Very sad. It was delicious before and the server was a very friendly and cool guy too as other servers. Now it's all suck. SAD.

I have been to Skalka twice before and the food was delicious as Georgians were making them as far as I remember. I was there today with my girlfriend, and we ordered the same food, but the taste was different. I'm not sure why but it does not taste the same anymore. Very disappointed. Of course, people who never tried this food before will be good to them, but those who have been already eaten this food before will see the difference right away. I hope you guys will bring back the same authentic taste as it was before.
Waited 50 minutes. Was told to deal with it.It's a pizza (with egg) place. Totally not worth it.
Ridiculous wait list management. We have been said it would take 30 minutes wait, and it haven't been ended in more than an hour.

I recently visited shalka and found their concept to be quite unique. The food itself was absolutely delicious, and I thoroughly enjoyed it. However, I do have a few concerns regarding the service that I would like to address, which is why I am deducting a few stars from my overall rating.One issue I encountered was the opening time. Despite the advertised opening time of 9AM, the door was already open for guests to enter before that. It was a bit confusing as we were told that they don't officially open until 9AM, even though we were allowed to hang out inside until then. This inconsistency in their opening procedure was a little frustrating.Additionally, there was a situation where someone placed an order at 8:48AM, and they were told that they needed to wait until 9AM. This kind of miscommunication or refusal of service after the official opening time can be quite off-putting for customers.Lastly, when we wanted to share our meals, we realized that there were no knives available. It would have been more convenient if the restaurant had provided all the necessary utensils to enjoy the meal properly.In order to enhance the overall experience, I would suggest that shalka ensures that their doors are not opened before the official opening time if they are not ready to serve customers yet. Consistency in adhering to the advertised opening hours would greatly improve the customer experience. Additionally, it would be beneficial for them to ensure that all necessary utensils are readily available for customers, especially if sharing meals is encouraged.

This place does bread bowls right! The filling is delicious--cheesy, flavorful, and super satisfying. They offer options for everyone, with chicken, beef, or vegan choices, so there's something for every preference. Each bread bowl is made to order, keeping it nice and crispy on the outside while perfectly holding all that tasty goodness inside. The place itself is clean and set up for self-service, from ordering to cleanup, which makes it an easy, casual stop. Definitely worth a visit if you're craving a hearty, well-made bread bowl!

Despite frequently passing by this restaurant, it was my first visit, inspired by rave reviews. I decided to go for brunch on a Saturday, but the timing coincided with the Seafair Torchlight Parade, which led to most streets being closed. After 30 minutes of searching, I found street parking nearly a mile away and walked to the restaurant.**Ambiance**:The restaurant has large floor-to-ceiling windows that let in plenty of natural light, creating an airy and welcoming atmosphere. The decor is funky and fun, adding to the overall charm.**Ordering Process**:I ordered at a kiosk and provided my phone number, which felt unnecessary. It would be more customer-friendly to use numbered tokens instead of collecting personal information. After ordering, the food was brought to my table, and there were no further interactions with the staff during my meal.**Food**:I ordered a Lobiani, which consisted of red beans, runny eggs, bacon, banana peppers, and butter melting into the cheese alongside the egg yolk. Initially, I was unsure how to eat it, but I decided to chip away at the fresh and fluffy bread and use a fork for the filling. Once it was small enough, I used my hands. Although it didn't look very big, it was quite filling, and I had some leftovers.**Taste**:The food was good, but it didn't live up to the rave reviews that had set my expectations very high. It reminded me of a pizza, especially with the egg yolk and two handle-like protrusions on each side. However, it was still enjoyable and satisfying.**Value**:The price was around $18, which seemed reasonable for the portion and quality.**Conclusion**:I have nothing bad to say about the food, but it wasn't as mind-blowing as some reviews claimed. Despite that, I'm a sucker for breakfast restaurants and wouldn't hesitate to return.

Nestled on the outskirts of Pikes Place in Seattle, Skalka offers a delightful culinary experience with a scenic backdrop that complements its unique approach to dining. The restaurant's commitment to delicious food and an innovative online ordering system makes it a standout in the bustling Seattle food scene.One of the notable features of Skalka is its picturesque location, providing a charming escape from the urban hustle. The ambiance is perfect for those seeking a break from the Pike's Place touristy noise.Skalka takes an unconventional approach to ordering, with the entire process conducted online. While this may be a novel concept, it does streamline the ordering process, ensuring efficiency and accuracy. However, this approach might not suit everyone, especially those who prefer a more traditional experience with face-to-face interaction.The menu at Skalka boasts a variety of delectable options, showcasing a fusion of flavors that cater to diverse palates. The Chicken Boat seemed a bit overwhelming and a bit to ummm mushy. In hindsight, opting for the Cheese Boat alone might have been a wiser choice, as it allowed the individual ingredients to shine without the slight overcrowding observed in the Chicken Boat.While the food at Skalka is undoubtedly a highlight, the service could use a friendlier touch. The online ordering system, while efficient, lacks the personal interaction that many patrons seek in a dining experience. A bit more warmth and engagement from the staff could elevate the overall satisfaction for guests. If the restaurant could enhance its service with a more personable touch, it would undoubtedly secure its place as a must-visit destination on the outskirts of Pikes Place in Seattle.
Came here for my birthday breakfast and it was absolutely delicious! My mom is coming to visit in a few weeks and I'm going to take her here!

Skalka's chicken boat khachapuri is a Seattle gem. The bread is perfectly balanced - soft inside, crispy out. The gooey egg and cheese meld beautifully, and the saucy chicken takes it over the top. A comforting, flavorful must-try.Great service and the servers treat me well. Nice ambiance and I like ordering on tablets.

I visited Skalka this morning and ordered the Chicken Georgian Boat. Wow, it was one of the best things I've ever tasted! The bread was incredibly soft and doughy, perfect for tearing off and dipping into the flavorful ingredients in the middle. It took about 20 minutes to come out, but it was definitely worth the wait. Highly recommend!
Yummy! Will come here again... they are very nice food is good a lil pricey but i would be happy to spend my money here
Food is always amazing! Wish they would open up other locations so it's a little far but can't wait to go back

The ordering system was interesting, but I really enjoyed the simple menu and the interface was easy to use. The options were just enough for anyone who had specific dietary needs. I got the lobiani khachapuri and it was delicious! The wait was about 15 minutes after ordering it, but it was well worth it! They make the food to order and it shows. The bread was crisp on the outside and pillowy on the inside. The toppings were fresh and perfectly cooked. I love this dish and I can't wait to get back to try the other variations they offer. You must stop by here if you're downtown Seattle.
The food is AMAZING, the stroganoff is my favorite 10/10. Would post a pic of the food but the food was so good we forgot to

Delicious! Hidden Gem and the price is fair!Meaty, cheesy, saucy bread bowl with a runny egg yolk to top off! It's as heavenly of carb load as it sounds! Very satisfying! Can't wait to go back with friends and family! Totally unique and amazing.If you're in the area, I wholeheartedly recommend stopping by Skalka Restaurant. It's a 5-star experience all the way!
Very tasty, I really immerse myself in the taste of childhood! Crispy crust with great flavor filling
Delicious. Perfect bread. One of them is enough for two people for lunch. Will add to my list.
Delicious! Try this the next time you are in Seattle. We will definitely be back. This was our first time visiting Seattle and our first time trying Khachapuri
I always love coming to this place. So simple and delicious. Always a recommendation to other friends.
Just plain delicious. Especially on a cold morning - what a great creamy smooth breakfast. Just do it!
This place is Delicious but a small spot. Service was nice. 9/10 recommend. Not bad with prices too.

Our lunch was good there yesterday, so amazing food and great breakfast options. The Stroganoff Boat and Lobiani Boat taste so good and very delicious. I enjoyed the food there. It has a wonderful flavor and the texture were great too. Every bite was so good and smooth. Well-seasoned too. Would definitely be back again.

Good food, generous portions, and a nice place. Went with my family on a Friday for lunch. We ordered the stroganoff, veggie boat, and badrijani. Everything was delicious. The waitress was very nice and very attentive. The restaurant wasn't even that busy. Overall good food and well served by the waitress.
Yummy and filling! One khachapurri is enough for at least 2 people
It is so impressive and excellent . I love it .Really I am so happy.very impressive and amazing food.
So so good! My family of four (with two kids) all loved the food. It was a 30 minute wait, but worth it!

You're insane if you try to find breakfast anywhere else in Seattle. Go here just; don't go anywhere else. A good time, quick service, and delicious food. Anything you order from the menu will blow your socks off. Even just the chicken boat was fantastic. EVERYTHING IN THIS PLACE IS SALTED! Don't walk, but run to The Skalka.
The meal is pretty big so one can feed two but the meals are really good enjoyed it a lot
Amazing you need to go here for sure it was a great place to eat whole family loved it
It was amazing!!!!! This breakfast dish was filling and delicious! I would re-visit any time!
I could eat this every day of my life. How is the bread so good?! Can't wait to go back.
it was very tasty and cheap, I recommend everyone to try boat with chicken! Waitresses were very nice i will come back in this place.
It was very good. Has the chicken one and it was delicious. Would definitely recommend
The bread boats were delicious. We ordered two but only needed one between the two of us. My favorite was the veggie boat

The interior is beautiful and romantic. It's all well-furnished and has an add-on to your vibe. It's perfect for a first date if you have one. Cause I had here mine. The staff helps you to get the best food and drinks too! They were very cooperative with me. We were pleasantly surprised at the perfect menu choices, service & great tasting food. Say enough good about this place. We will be back!
This place is fantastic. Everything is clean! Check out Christmas lights. Very delicious!!!
Excellent food, tasty and so different. Definitely coming back with next visit to Seattle.
It is really tasty. You should definitely try it out. We tried beef and chicken they both were great.

We were very pleasantly surprised at the awesome menu choices, service & great tasting food. We were served the most delicious food we had on our recent trip to the area. Say enough good about this place. We will definitely be back!
Servings are huge! I shared two between four people and we still could not finish. This place is a must!
The host was great. I'm such a foodie and enjoy discovering new places this. Just be very specific about what you want in your order and if you're allergic to anything but other than that
I found that the food at skalka was really high quality!

The interior is beautiful and romantic, it's all well- furnished and has an add on to your vibe. It's perfect for a first date if you have one. Cause I had here mine. The staff helps you to get the best food and drinks too ! They were very cooperative with me.
You get your moneys worth! Generous portions. Delicious food.
I have never had this kind of food before and now it's one of my favorite places to eat.
I really enjoy the pizza at skalka!
I haven't had something like this. I was thoroughly impressed.  The baking was really high end
I really like the pizza's here, the thick crust is very good!
Greet food and the service is great thank you I will recommend you to all of my friends and family
Delicious pizza. I actually really liked the lemonade they have here too.
We just went down here to take orders for a later dinner, and it really tasted fantastic, juicy and fresh. The staff is very supportive and polite. It's highly recommended!

The food here is amazing and the lady that served us the food was very nice as well. The only thing I did not like was a green drink I don't remember the name of. I'm sure other people love this drink, but it's not something I would order again.

Bad service. Bad server with impolite attitude. Very racist restaurant. Always ignore Asian faces and lie that they don't provide this or that even yelp shows other customers are taking the same service. Don't go. Try somewhere else.

I decided to check this place out while I was downtown checking out the biospheres. A weird latin influenced menu which doesn't seem to be figured out yet. The chef seems confused. The cocktails are ok, however there bartender seemed almost irritated that he had to serve me and wasn't very knowledgeable for the food. He was very rude. If your in the hospitality business, shouldn't you not serve with a smile. The location & design are the only reason its getting any star. Underwhelming indeed.

Having visited the 2120 establishment with girl, I was pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere that reigned in this place. The cool and cozy atmosphere created a special mood for the evening. The service also deserves the highest praise - the staff was attentive and friendly. However, there is one point that slightly clouded my experience.
