After trying the Prime New York Steak, I ordered it Well Done. Unfortunately, the dish was brought medium rare. But it is worth nothing that when I brought this error to the attention of the waiter, the problem was promptly corrected.Thus, despite a small glitch with the order, the overall impression of the 2120 establishment remained positive.

I visited the restaurant for a mid-week dinner. I had made a reservation a few weeks in advance and arrived slightly late due to traffic. Thankfully, they accommodated us, but requested that we finish by a specific time, which was fine as we had enough time. A nice touch was the free parking available in the same building after 4 pm.The restaurant was quite busy, and it took a while before someone noticed us and took our reservation. However, once we were attended to, the service was smooth. The closely spaced tables contributed to noticeable noise levels, but it wasn't unbearable.We started with some small dishes, which arrived quickly. However, our main courses took a bit longer. We ordered six items, but only one stood out for me, and I would consider ordering it again: the calamari. The green salad was good but rather simple, consisting of greens, strawberries, and crumbled cheese with a tasty vinaigrette. It was enjoyable but not quite at the level I expected.The calamari was very good, with the highlight being the yogurt sauce (though it was labeled as labneh, it wasn't as sour as traditional Mediterranean labneh). The warm spices added a nice touch.The pork belly roulette was disappointing and felt like a calorie waste.I had high hopes for the steak tartar, but it turned out to be overly sour, with the sourness overshadowing the gentle sweetness of the yolk. The textures of the meat and the popping mustard seeds were interesting, but the sourness was too much for my taste.My husband ordered the rack of lamb, which tasted very good but was rather small for its $62 price tag, consisting of only two chops and some veggies.The cream puff had a moderate sweetness level, which was appreciated. However, I found the cream both inside and outside to be overly fatty, with just a hint of fruit filling in the middle. I would have preferred a better balance with less cream and more filling.Despite the restaurant's great reviews, I don't plan on returning.

I liked this place a lot! I came in for brunch and the food/ drink aesthetic was very pretty and the flavors were very well mixed too! It is also across the street from the Amazon spheres and that was neat. The one downside I really had was that my poached eggs were really over cooked and that's never fun. But I'd definitely be open to coming back!

A solid salad, enough to fill you up although I don't think they give as much as evergreens does. Here, I'd stick to a preset menu item over individually ordering because so many things cost extra that it's too much to keep track of. The harvest salad was definitely yummy but I really couldn't tell you how I ended up paying $20 for it. I feel like sweetgreen is cool because it's the prototype for these types of salad places but holy moly I don't want to pay this much for a bowl of kale.

I recently dined at 2120, an upscale casual restaurant located inside the Amazon One building, the birthplace of Jeff Bezos' empire. The ambience inside is warm and modern, with about thirty tables and a bar that seats around ten to fifteen people. The restaurant also boasts a very nice patio that overlooks a globe building, adding to its aesthetic appeal.The highlight of the evening was undoubtedly the food and the service. I started with the carrots as an appetizer, which had a surprising texture similar to a baked potato rather than traditional carrots. For the main course, I had the scallops, which were absolutely amazing--tender and delicious, served with a curry and cumin sauce that was out of this world and really highlighted the dish. We also tried the Belgian frites, which were crispy and flavorful, clearly benefitting from their double-frying process.Our server, Will, was excellent. He was attentive without being overbearing, allowing us to enjoy our meal at a comfortable pace. He had great wine recommendations and picked out an incredible dessert for us, carrot cake, which was a perfect end to a wonderful meal. Will truly enhanced our dining experience with his professionalism and expertise.Overall, I highly recommend 2120 for its outstanding food, inviting atmosphere, and exceptional service.

It was our first time visiting the restaurant , and we decided to celebrate Galentine's Day there. I must say, the overall experience was amazing.The highlight of our evening was our waiter, Spencer. Spenser's patience, kindness, and attentiveness made our dining experience truly memorable. Not only did he provide excellent service, but he also recommended great dishes and drinks. The combination of delicious food, impeccable service, and a beautiful setting made for an unforgettable evening.Thank you, to Spencer for his exceptional service.

We chose 2120 to celebrate a family birthday, based on yelp reviews. In short, 2120 delivered and then some. We loved the variety of food, the atmosphere and the service.A memorable evening. We will be back.

Hold onto your taste buds and prepare for a wild ride at 2120 in Seattle! This place had me drooling, and questioning why I hadn't discovered it sooner. Brace yourself for an epic culinary adventure that will leave your belly satisfied!Let's talk about the braised lamb cacciatore, shall we? It was so good that I momentarily forgot my own name. The lamb was so tender, it practically serenaded me with a love ballad as I took my first bite. The tomato sauce was so rich, it had more flavor than a Shakespearean tragedy. I half-expected the chef to burst out of the kitchen and take a bow for this masterpiece. Seriously, they should consider selling tickets to this lamb extravaganza--it's that good!And oh, the pumpkin puff! It was like the dessert gods decided to throw a party in my mouth. The puff pastry was so light and fluffy; I swear it had levitation powers. The pumpkin filling was like a magic potion brewed by a mischievous wizard. One bite, and I was under its spell--complete with giggles, swoons, and a longing for more. Move over Cinderella, this pumpkin creation is the real star of the fairytale!The ambiance was the cherry on top of this feast. The lighting was dim enough to create an intimate atmosphere, but not so dim that I couldn't see my food (because let's be honest, that would be a tragedy).To sum it up, 2120 is the place where culinary excellence. The braised lamb cacciatore and pumpkin puff are the headliners of this comedy show for your taste buds. The staff deserves a standing ovation for their top-notch service. So, bring your appetite, and get ready to feast on delicious food at 2120. It's a culinary adventure you won't soon forget!

I have been talking about this salmon since I visited 2120 back in February 2023... it is the best salmon I have ever had.People typically describe their salmon according to its flakiness, falling apart with a touch of their fork. Looking at it from that lens, 2120's salmon would melt apart if you were to simply blow on it like a candle. It was buttery smooth, fatty, with almost no need to chew. It was perfection and I am already planning a return when back in Seattle later this year. Amazing food aside, I also want to shoutout their private dining service. Our group of 20 was welcomed to our dining room with a signature cocktail, a three-course menu imprinted with our names, and friendly service that didn't miss a beat.Highly recommend as a must-visit dinner restaurant.
I really enjoy the place and their food. I love to go there again. Highly recommended!
Nice location, booking in advance at peak times is a good idea, the atmosphere and service is great, each dish is well prepared and tastes great.

Thank you 2120 for the amazing food & the complimentary donuts & champagne for our engagement. Ambiance was beautiful! Perfect for date night, coworker hang out, friends reunion. Beautiful design and service was super nice. But the star of the show was the FOOD! Burrata and panna cotta were a perfect bookends of freshness to introduce and conclude our night. My fiance had an super juicy Pork Chop while I had the best Salmon I have ever eaten. Must visit if you are in Seattle! BurrataKing Salmon Miso Butter Pork ChopHouse Made DonutsEspresso Panna Cotta

Tried 2120 this evening!! First time in this stunning restaurant. Great service from Wilson!!! The food was amazing!! Chef Kyle and Chef Nick know how to bring out great flavor in all of the dishes!! General Manager, Chris was so hospitable, serving wine and great conversation. Give Wilson his bottle of wine!!!! We will be back. Tell your friends!!!

Amazing service! From the moment we walked into the restaurant to the moment we left. Our server was very accommodating and went above and beyond. The food left us speechless; we had items for the night, and everything was our favorite, can't pick one if we had to. We can't wait to come back and see what new items they'll have drinks, were perfection.
Food is always amazing, drinks are even better. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu

My partner and I decided to dine at 2120 for the first time tonight.. safe to say, we are both at a LOSS for words. The food, service, ambience were beyond immaculate. Amanda was an incredible part of our dining experience. She was lovely to talk to and made our night. We honestly cannot wait to dine here again!!!

We had Jason as our waiter for this evening and it was an absolutely incredible experience. From the food to the service to the reception it was a complete treat as an experience. Not only was Jason attentive and friendly he was someone we would come back to see here for a regular basis. Unbelievably positive customer experience, fantastic food, great atmosphere. this might seem like a bot posting this but I promise if you give this place a shot you will NOT be disappointed. 10/10
This is a great place with amazing food and fabulous service!! I would recommend this place to everyone!

My wife and I were celebrating our anniversary and decided to check 2120 out. We were so incredibly impressed! The staff greeted us by our names and wished us a happy anniversary. We were given complimentary champagne...amazing!...and Wilson, our server, was so attentive and fantastic! They went above and beyond our expectations and have definitely set the bar incredibly high. This is our new favorite spot in Seattle and we have already told so many of our friends. Thank you! - Justin and Sabrina

I came here for lunch with a friend and was very happy with my choice. I had the roasted delicata bowl and my friend had the Caesar salad with shrimp. Both were very good and full of flavor, and the portion sizes were generous. We each had a glass of ros, which was also nice (I like that their wine list is Washington focused). Our food came out in a timely fashion, and our server was very pleasant. The restaurant itself is very pretty with a nice view of the Amazon biospheres. I also like that they have convenient parking in the building. I'll definitely be back for lunch again, and look forward to trying their dinner menu soon.

I decided to come back for lunch, as I heard that they changed up their lunch menu a bit (I normally come for dinner). They have a nice selection of sandwiches, which they had previously, but also added a new Salads & Bowls section that has some yummy sounding dishes. It looks like the bulk of the new dishes have vegetarian options too. I had the roasted delicata dish, and it was very good! Full of flavor, and quite filling. The food came out quickly too, which is great for my lunch time crunch. I look forward to trying some more of the new lunch dishes soon.

I came back to try their new lunch menu. I've tried both the dinner and brunch menus, both of which I liked. The lunch menu was also quite good. I like the addition of their "Bowls & Salads" section, as it adds a nice, light option. Each of the dishes come with the option to add a protein (salmon, shrimp, or chicken), which is great, and I believe that they all come as vegetarian options by default (with out the added proteins, of course!). I had the quinoa bowl with shrimp, and it was very tasty, and filling, but not heavy. I like that I was able to get in an out for lunch at well under an hour too. I'll be back for sure.

Great food and service. The happy hour menu did not disappoint and their new pork belly tostadas were delicious. Also, try the punch on draft. They serve punch bowls and are discounted heavily on happy hour.

This restaurant is modern yet relaxed and the food and service were great! Delicious pancakes and bacon. Polite staff with great views. Enjoyed walking along the water after, and it was a quick walk to Olympic sculpture park.
Good food but extremely pricey for what you get! Omelette was $16, bacon $6. Convenient if you're staying at the Edgewater Hotel...

My favorite place to go for weekend drinks! The ambience is so cool.. right on the water and cool lighting. So much more sophisticated than Belltown, but with the mix of crowd (all different ages because it's in a hotel) it never seems pretentious. I've seen various music acts here most of which were fabulous... too good to be free! And the bartenders and wait staff are great (especially Lee at the bar).  The only reason I don't give 5 stars is that the drinks are on the spendy side, and they have to shut the music down at midnight.
Great service and awesome food! We shall return!
Great food, great atmosphere and a great view! The food was very tasty, the flavors were really nice, and the price for all of it is very reasonable. No problem with service at all!

The views from this place are unbelievable. The food is also very good but expect to shell out some clams at dinner. Breakfast and lunch are a much better value. Every time I go in there on a beautiful day they are super busy and the food takes a really long time. They also seem to be understaffed by the way I see the employees rushing around. If you are not in a hurry and want to enjoy your surroundings then you definitely need to go.
great happy hour, great view. Fish is tasty.

I have spent time at the bar three times when Jagger was working and once when Mark was working; both of them were really good. They took care of customers and gave great service while keeping the drinks flowing for the dining room. Also, I need to give a shout-out to the guy cleaning up in the lodge area; he also did a great job.The food is top-notch, though-it's a bit on the high side, price-wise. A main course will be about $50-60. Expect to spend in the region of $150-200 dinner for two, including drinks. I had the clam chowder, and it was great. Seafood mix and steak were great, nice and done.The only downside would be that the place feels a little old, but that is not really a big deal.

Six Seven Restaurant is a very good restaurant. The service was unimpeachable, with staff who were not only attentive but also genuinely passionate about ensuring our dining experience was memorable. I highly recommend this restaurant.
5 star company! I recommend a must to eat here! recommending everyone and bringing family back
The food was some of the best iv ever eaten. It was a little warm on the patio. Once the sun was about to set it cooled off and one amazing view

I recently dined at Six Seven Restaurant and had an enjoyable experience. The restaurant is located in a beautiful waterfront setting, offering stunning views of the Seattle skyline and Elliott Bay. The ambiance is sophisticated and elegant, making it a perfect choice for a special occasion or a romantic evening.The menu at Six Seven Restaurant features a variety of culinary delights. I had the opportunity to try their seafood dishes, and they were delicious. The flavors were well-balanced, and the presentation was impeccable. The freshness of the ingredients was evident in every bite, and the seafood was cooked to perfection.The service at Six Seven Restaurant was exceptional. The staff was attentive, and knowledgeable, and provided excellent recommendations. They were also mindful of dietary restrictions and accommodated special requests with ease.In addition to the wonderful food and service, the restaurant offers an extensive wine list and a well-crafted cocktail menu. The sommelier was helpful in suggesting pairings that enhanced the dining experience.The only minor drawback was that the prices at Six Seven Restaurant are on the higher side, reflecting the upscale dining experience and waterfront location. However, considering the quality of the food, service, and ambiance, it was a worthwhile investment.Overall, I would highly recommend Six Seven Restaurant to those looking for an elegant dining experience in Seattle. The combination of exquisite cuisine, impeccable service, and breathtaking views make it a standout restaurant that truly showcases the best of the city.

The views from this place are unbelievable. The food is also very good but expects to shell out some clams at dinner. Breakfast and lunch are a much better value. Every time I go in there on a beautiful day they are super busy and the food takes a long time. They also seem to be understaffed by the way I see the employees rushing around. If you are not in a hurry and want to enjoy your surroundings then you need to go.
Amazing place for brunch ,Beautiful view ! The crabs are very tasty and I will go there again for sure on my next family visit in Seattle
Great view, great food and ambiance. We waited a bit longer to sit outside and it was worth it.
I've been coming here for years and absolutely love it!! The staff is always pleasant and go out of there way to make my experience amazing! Totally come here if you want a fine dining experience

If you're looking for some scenery to go along with a great meal I would highly recommend eating here the service was great glad this was one of my choices while I was visiting here in Seattle if I ever come back I would definitely eat here again

EXCELLENT dining experience. Our server was great. The food was fantastic and the view was amazing. They have a bar and sitting area on the lower level. My kids played corn hole with some other children who were present. Overall lovely time. I will be returning.

Delicious Dinner with friends January 17, 2020We had a good birthday party at Six Seven. Dishes included pasta, steak, and pork chops. Be sure to try the amazing artisan bread. We had a friendly and funny waitress, who made our meal even better.she was a gas and a real bonus for helping us to have such a good time.
Incredible view, location and food.! Def recommend attending during sunset hours!

Kait W. This review is for you...what are you even doing with your automatic response...shows that this establishment has gone to or has always been sh...t. Go ahead Kait W. Reply with your usual...with that dry pond!

Not ONE woman working on the wait staff or cooking. This means that all of the higher income jobs are closed off to women. Blatant gender bias. Sorry folks but it's no longer 1980 and this open misogyny is NOT acceptable. Gender equality will never occur if we do not vote with our wallets. If you care about this issue, DO NOT EAT HERE!

Cool spot and good food, but you have to be kidding me making last call at 9:45 for drinks! 9:45?? What are we kids and its our bedtime at 10pm? You have people in the bar that want to spend money at your restaurant and you basically kick them out because your employees want to go home... Get it together!!

If you are thinking of having your wedding or wedding reception here, read more:I was a guest here for a wedding ceremony/reception in the Orchid Room in July this year 2011. Having had dinner multiple times here before in their main dinning area, the food was more than impressive. The view is picturesque and the food is exceptional- for all intents and purposes, this was a great place for a wedding reception. While the overall picture was great, the Catering Team GAVE THEIR WEDDING CAKE AWAY.The cake was bought through Palisade made through a local vendor, Dessert Works, with whom they had a cake tasting months prior like most couples do. The assistant manager came up to the BRIDE during the pictures and said that 'WE' have a problem. They had lost the cake.The bride and groom were nothing but pleasant and accommodating (what else were they supposed to do?) and had their ceremony. During the reception, the assistant manager again spoke to the bride and said that after investigating the matter, they had concluded the cake was GIVEN TO THE ANOTHER WEDDING RECEPTION THE NIGHT BEFORE. He proceeded to describe that 'WE' had two options: a cake from QFC (he misspoke and meant Whole Foods- imagine the astonishment) or cupcakes from Cupcake Royale. The Bride and Groom chose cupcakes and did not elude to their company of the unfortunate mistake as most of the guests thought this was their choice for dessert. Although many people choose cupcakes for their reception, this was not the cake they chose. After more investigating, Dessert Works did their job and delivered what could only be imagined to be a wonderful cake that another wedding party got to enjoy (were they VIP?) because the bride and groom's name was on the cake box according to Dessert Works.Palisade compensated in various ways but you can not replicate the moment or pictures of your wedding day again.

I have lived in Seattle for 30 years and have been to just about every restaruant here. THIS IS THE ONLY RESTARAUNT I HAVE ACTUALLY BEEN KICKED OUT OF! Why? Simply because I asked an obviously overworked doorman why my car hadn't been brought out for us when many others behind us in line were being brought their car?! He accused me of "touching him" on the shoulder. I was with a company christmas party in 2008, and EVERYONE WAS APPAULED. Needless to say I will never return. ALSO! Take notice that the people most excited about the restaraunt ARE THE PEOPLE WHO WORK THERE. They often seem overwhelmed with satisfaction of their own restaraunt, snobbish. If you go, see if you agree....Oh! AND DEFINATELY DON'T USE THE VALET!!! Much better optioin is SALTY'S restaraunt in West Seattle, especially for Sunday brunch. Unlike the Palisades, it's an open buffet of EVERYTHING...meat, seafood, omelette bar, NOT JUST PANCAKES!

This place is way over priced for the unprofessional staff in dirty clothes and unkept appearance. The food quality was very disappointing. I had the surf and turf and ordered my steak medium rare. It came after a long 45+ minute wait, only to cut into it and it was well done. I never send food back, but I did on this occasion because it was a 3:15pm dinner reservation and there is no excuse to overcook steaks when it's not super busy. After sending it back, I was brought a steak that they just threw on the grill for a couple minutes on high heat and they called it a day. It was absolutely rare in the middle and burnt outside. Worst cooked steak ever. I ate it cause it was $74 but the whole deal was terrible. They were out of the desert we wanted at 4:30pm. They said it was cause of the banquet that they had. Ok lol. This place just sucked these days. If you're gonna spend money like that. Go somewhere else for sure. The view is nice of course. But you could find a way better restaurant.

Our latest visit will be our last. Sad to hear their company declared bankruptcy and they are clearly cutting corners on food quality. Servers seemed stretched as we hardly saw ours during the meal and had to flag down multiple people for water, salt and another drink. Fingers crossed a savvy restauranteur will swoop in and save this dying Seattle landmark.
View is fabulous. Food was excellent, when we finally received it. The service or lack there of, was horendous. Manager made it right in the end.

Wow for $209 I would think you woudl have an amazing meal. Hostess staff great and the meal went downhill from there. Appetizer felt like QFC sushi cheap. Steak was overdone we sent back and my wifes sat there for 15 minutes - they brought another 22 minutes later after she had finished very poor serving should have taken hers to stay warm. Then forgot shared salad. When I went to the bathroom I asked to talk to the manager and they point out a bald guy named Paul who said oh he was really sorry. He then offered to buy us a drink, which we were charged for. So as we were leaving we asked to see him again to tell him. I saw him in the hallway behind the bathroom and they said nope he is not here. He was laughing with his girlfriend or hitting on a cocktail waitress. Only reason it gets 2 is the view and the hostess. Awful service and good food but very overpriced.

I recently went here for an anniversary dinner with my wife, and i was treated incredibly rudely by the manager Delyce Howell. The food was ok, but the service definitely needs improvement. After remarking to our waiter that we had a hair on the caesar salad, the manager then came over and gave a half-hearted apology and quite frankly just ruined the evening for me and the misses. I don't mean to be one of those vindictive type of yelp reviewers, but certainly this place could use a bit of improvement. On the plus side, the Palisades Ocean Tower was delicious and the cabarnet short rib was delicious.
I was told the wait was 30 minutes... an hour and 10 minutes later still no text to be seated. Ended up canceling my wait.
I regularly order here and I don't know what happened today, but they usually have good pizza.
U just turned away 8 people. Who makes up your rules? What a bunch of fools!    ............

Not worth the wait. Portions were very small. I was expecting a little more since I was was paying almost 20$ for a pizza, and waiting about an hour , Staff didn't seem to be so nice. We came down the street to eat
Pizza was just ok, not even as good as pizza hut pizzas. Added on 20% tips with out notice. Very bad experience. You really want money? Not this way. Offering better pizzas and services instead!
Rude people. After getting over the rude people the pizza was burnt. Terrible, non repeatable experience.
WTF, forced 20% gratuity? $80 pizza lunch for 3 people? Who the hell these guys think they are? This is a Heist. Never ever going here. Douche. Oh, and I have had better pizza elsewhere.
Great location /restaurant . Not so great pizza /food, not sure what all the rave is about .
I only have the happy hour menu here. The portions are so small.
meh, over-rated...

Extremely Disappointing and terrible Experience at Tanoor RestaurantLocation: Tanoor Seattle My husband and I decided to try Tanoor Restaurant for the first time, but it turned out to be the worst dining experience we've ever had. The restaurant was busy, but we were seated in an uncomfortably tight spot, which already made us feel unwelcome. From there, things only got worse.Despite waiting for 30 minutes, not a single server came to take our order or even offer us water. Meanwhile, we watched other customers, who arrived after us, being served promptly. The servers took their orders, brought out appetizers, and attended to them, but no one bothered to check on us.What made it even more frustrating was that the staff clearly saw us waiting--they even glanced in our direction several times--but chose to ignore us completely. It felt disrespectful and left us wondering why we were being treated this way.After waiting and hoping for someone to acknowledge us, we finally gave up and left. It was humiliating and upsetting to experience such poor service, especially when we had been excited to try a new restaurant.This was the first time something like this had ever happened to us at a restaurant, and it will certainly be the last time we visit Tanoor. If this is how they treat customers, I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

My brother and I live nearby and we've always wanted to check it out. We decided to go on a Friday to avoid the dinner rush. It wasn't very busy, but we ended up waiting for service for 30 minutes. Nobody offered us water and we noticed other people being served. Eventually, we just decided to leave and went to a place across the street. Nobody said anything to us as we left; they seemed more interested in their own conversations. We won't be recommending this place to anyone. Maybe the food is good, but the service, or lack thereof, was really bad. Even Stone Korean, which is much smaller, has better service than this place.
They take too long, the food isn't great, poor management.Would not recommend.

Fresh, super flavorful food! Lots of vegetarian and carnivore options. House made pita... wow! With a large variety of dips- we had the muhammara - peppers,walnuts, pomegranate syrup with a touch of spiciness- could have made a meal from that and the pita! The mixed plate for 2-3 easily served 5 people- freshly grilled veggies, 3 quality meats cooked just right, yellow ( saffron?) rice.  Great value for the quantity of food!    No alcoholic drinks, but a wide variety of juices, teas, and Turkish coffee. Will definitely become a repeat customer!Dietary restrictions: Good variety of keto and vegetarian options.Wheelchair accessibility: I have limited mobility, so I appreciated the no barrier entry- they let me come in a different door,closer to where I parked. Parking nearby would be difficult, as one side of the building is on a steep hill.

I always enjoy going here for amazing atmosphere and service. The food was good and fresh except Kunnafah, they really need to fix that. It was soggy and chewy, rest everything was amazing. I will visit again but will never order dessert.
Delicious , great quality,real family style .Great service . Not a single complaint .

At the end of every meal, I like to wind down my night with a coffee. Surprisingly, this place always brews my coffee fresh. Which a lot of places don't do. And I get a desert to pair with it nicely. I'd just like to say thank you for always providing great and consistent service. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Tanoor in Seattle is a gem for anyone who enjoys authentic Lebanese cuisine. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with warm and attentive service, making the dining experience truly exceptional. The staff here are fantastic, and I must praise Ali, who stood out with his accommodating and cooperative approach. He ensured everything ran smoothly, from seating to meal recommendations, and his efficiency made the evening even more enjoyable.The food was simply amazing. Each dish was packed with flavor, showcasing the true essence of Lebanese cooking. The blend of spices and fresh ingredients made every bite a delight. If you're looking for a place with both incredible food and outstanding service, Tanoor is definitely the spot to visit. Highly recommended!

This was my wife's and my first time here and we thought it was incredible. The food was perfect in flavor and portion. Their home made pita bread was next level and our server was knowledgeable of the cuisine and friendly.
Tried the Batata Harra, and it was a spicy revelation! Perfectly crispy, flavorful, and a tasty kick that lingers. A must-try for spice lovers!

How can you possible justify a $65 dollar strip steak? I assume you're paying for the location rather than the food. Typical for a fame hungry business; ramp the price up for the location while serving unimpressive food. I could make the same meal for $25. I'm willing to pay for service buy you're being ridiculous.
Disappointing meal. Steak not cooked properly, twice. Nothing of quality to report. Very disappointing.
Waited for 20 minutes and nobody greeted me. Parking is also not free, will not return.

not what you would expect when entering a fine dining restaurant. when i entered i wasn't greeted with any sort of hospitality and felt like the next customer. I've worked in restaurants for years and know what good service is. after we were sat the waiter promptly took our drink orders before we could even take a look at the menu. interesting fact, the steaks here a way overpriced. i order the filet, and obviously at these prices i was expecting perfection. instead i got inspection, the steak appeared to be raw so i kindly notified the waiter that i would appreciate a few more min on the grill. when they brought it back to me 10 min later, it was medium well, i ordered medium rare. not to mention the sear on the steak was pathetic. I've been cooking all my life and I could have done better with a filet purchased from Wal-Mart! i was too upset to complain about my meal so i just bit the bullet of a steak and tried to enjoy the remainder of the evening. the service was good but i felt a bit of animosity from the waiter. not sure if ill be coming back here, It' s hard to recommend. el gaucho on the other hand...that's a different story.Ian W.
They changed their happy hour a few weeks ago and it sucks now. The happy hour food is no longer 1/2 off and the wine / drinks are only $2 off. They had one of the best happy hours. It's too bad.

1st time and not impressed. 20% guaranty automatically added to your bill which goes to the company. Waiters receive commission on sales. Our waiters attitude changed toward us when we ordered coffee and not alcohol. Food was just ok and very disappointed.

I've eaten here many times, while the food and service was good I am very upset that they automatically added a 20% service charge to my bill and than leave space for an "additional tip". When my wife and I come we always tip well, to add this automatically is highly offensive. I doubt I'll be back as there are many fine dinning establishments in Seattle who still give you a choice in the amount you tip.

Three times I've been here now. Two times with groups of about 10 and once with a date. The group things seem to put the staff in a bad way. One time we had extra drinks on our bill (The drinks we ordered from the bar due to not wanting to keep waiting forever for our waiter to take our order were paid for at the bar AND put on our receipt) including a bottle of wine we didn't order, a pile of plates were dropped, we literally did not get asked what choice of side we wanted until one of the people in our party asked the waiter if they wanted to know what we wanted, my steak (medium well) also was literally charred on both sides that the meat on the inside was only about 1/4 inch thick. I get that bigger groups are more difficult and things like dropping plates is just something that is going to happen but if you can't provide excellent service at this price point you need to stay within your abilities. My date experience was better but there's plenty of nice places at this price point that can really "Wow" you.
The steak was mediocre at best. The service and atmosphere is excellent.You pay for the atmosphere not the food by any means. Does not compare to the met. I sent my steak back . The salmon was great.

I was really disappointed in the service we got from our waiter. First he wasn't really friendly and welcoming off the bat. My order got messed up and he wasn't very attentive with what we needed. Definetely not what I expected from a classy establishment. It could've been just this particular waiter. His name was Kermit J. Other than that this is a really good place to take a date. Food is alright but the ambience is great.

Here's an improved version of your review for better readability and clarity: "The food was, as always, outstanding, and the ambiance was great. We visited for a New Year's Eve dinner and everything was going well--until just before midnight. Two minutes before the countdown, we received our dessert and asked if we could step outside to watch the fireworks. The staff asked us to leave our card as a precaution due to previous walkouts, which we did. However, when the fireworks ended, we found the doors locked and struggled to get back inside. To make matters worse, the waitress had already packed up our desserts and removed my glass of wine. This was not how I wanted to start the new year! The manager eventually offered to have our desserts remade at the table, but by that point, the damage was done. The experience left us all with a bitter taste. As leaving I went to the toilet, there was no toilet paper and looked trashed...very unusual.It's truly disappointing to have such an unfortunate experience at Daniel's, especially on a special occasion like New Year's Eve,

The staff asked us to leave our card as a precaution due to previous walkouts, which we did.However, when the fireworks ended, we found the doors locked and struggled to get back inside. To make matters worse, the waitress had already packed up our desserts and removed my glass of wine. This was not how I wanted to start the new year!The manager eventually offered to have our desserts remade at the table, but by that point, the damage was done. The experience left us all with a bitter taste.It's truly disappointing to have such an unfortunate experience at Daniel's, especially on a special occasion like New Year's Eve.

Just opened, waited months to try. Fries way undercooked and limp. Fish and oyster also undercooked. Was ok, value was good for what we ordered, will try again. Just make sure you get your fries cooked long enough.

The management offers you a reservation, parking valet, street or private lot, full bars of alcoholic drinks, and you can visit there during happy hours. They will also give you complimentary cakes with vanilla ice cream and berries.

MIIA gave us fabulous service. Friendly and professional. 5/5Wine. Miia offered some Washington wine that i loved. 5/5Invited 6 guests, three from out of country. Normally i like to offer American meat to my foreign guests, in particularly French ones, as I think our meats are so much better than theirs.I got the bone-in rib eye. Found the meat too dry, not great quality perhaps. It was done a true medium rare as i asked. I appreciated that very much but it was a bit too hard to chew. 3/5 maybe 2.5/5Salad. 3/5peach tart with ice cream 2/5ambiance 4/5Price around $150 per person which for such a place is reasonable.I have no problem going back
Steak was a bit over done.
Great food, we came in happy hour. We sat at the dining area with beautiful view but so quiet, we then went to the bar. Had fun.

Enjoy the hors d'oeuvres at Daniel's Broiler on Lake Union. The steak bites are good; however, the service is below par for a restaurant of this class. The waitresses act like you are annoying them and they would rather be at home. The view on Lake Union is beautiful.

This is place was good. went with a fiend and had the filet mignon . it was decent i just dont like s steak from a restaurant where i have to put steak sauce on it. Can do that at home. Im going to try out joeys next door been hearing about that place since i moved here. If you want mediocre steak go here
not too too impressed. average. a lil too pricey. but im a lil cheap. lol nothing to really complain about though

Our Thanksgiving gathering at Daniel's Broiler, set against the backdrop of the bar, followed a straightforward culinary narrative. My companion opted for the classic turkey, while I leaned towards the prime rib. The gustatory experience was undeniably praiseworthy, with flavors that underscored a notable culinary finesse.Service, operating within the parameters of adequacy, maintained an understated demeanor, providing a seamless backdrop to our dining experience.However, the post-dinner endeavor to secure leftovers took an unforeseen turn. A meticulous separation of meat and fat, coupled with a modest request for an extra serving of potatoes, aimed to prolong the culinary pleasure. Regrettably, upon revisiting the remains, the gastronomic continuity suffered a setback. The boxed ensemble, lacking cranberry sauce, horseradish that had been left on my plate, and the absent side of coveted potatoes I requested, presented a major Thanksgiving leftovers letdown---especially taking into consideration the high price we had paid for the meal. Nevertheless, let this culinary service anomaly not overshadow the overall commendable nature of the experience. As we contemplate future visits, a pragmatic approach emerges - a proactive request during the boxing process to ensure a more faithful representation of the intended leftovers. Here's to culinary precision and anticipating an untarnished encore in subsequent engagements.
Really good food for our date night! Our waiter was great and really helpful with the questions we had!
Good food, Nice ambiance. A bit pricy but overall I enjoyed it. Beautifully plated.
Never had dinner here (yet) - but had awesome drinks in a cool atmosphere. So, dinner will be next time!
perfect steaks, beautiful sides.
Who doesn't love Daniel's? Good setting, and incredible steaks. You know that term, 'melts in your mouth?' I never understood what that meant until I had a Daniel's steak. Worth every penny.

The staff enjoyed a lunch out and the food was FANTASTIC! It is incredibly close to our office and all of us love the unique character Preservation Kitchen has to offer. So swing by and give them a try!
One of the best steaks in Seattle, hands down. Great Happy Hour too. Service can be a little stuffy but otherwise a solid 4 stars.

I've visited a lot of Steakhouses in the past couple days and I would have to say by far that this was the best steak I've had in years. It's definitely on the pricey end but its worth a trip Once a month.
The Piano bar is best in class.
perfect location. almost perfect steak!
Great steak but overpriced. $49 for a rib eye?  Please.
French Onion is sub par
Great appetizers. Spendy though.
Food: very good to excellent. Service: excellent. Wine list: excellent. Would be 5 stars if the restroom didn't smell like urine, too much....
Great happy hour! Picky husband approved.
Great happy hour!!

Be prepared to leave with a Doggy Bag when you have a steak at Daniels. I have the pleasure of attending a friend's birthday celebration at Daniels last week, here is the low down :Food : Excellent (I had the Domenico, highly recommended)Service : Waiter was excellent, the busboys could do with a lesson or two in patience (they kept wanting to clear the table)Reception : A little coldParking : Pretty much valet only, $5
Great service.
To be fair, we only sat at the bar for drinks but they were very good!We ended up ordering some appetizers off the bar menu. I'd definitely visit again.
This place has the best service in town. Better than The Met, and definitely better than anything else in SLU. Get the lavender martini. it's really good and so are the steaks. I love this place.
Extraordinary Steak place. We were party of four. We had good food and service. Recommended to everyone.
Great atmosphere, really good food and they had one of the best root beers I have tasted.

Tough to beat Daniel's Broiler Lake Union for Happy Hour. Incredible views of Lake Union, sailboats and seaplanes. Great pricing on signature appetizers like filet mignon steak strips and crispy artichoke hearts and classic cocktails- martinis and manhattans. It's been my go to place for happy hour in Seattle for over 2 decades!

Love this restaurant! I believe it is a Seattle staple. The beautiful views combined with top notch service and atmosphere. I think Daniels is an excellent choice for any special occasion. I personally spent my last birthday here and everything was perfect my steak was cooked to a perfect rare plus. The staff even checks with you to confirm your steak is cooked exactly to your specification. I do not believe that the yelp rating for this restaurant does this place justice. I highly recommend this to anyone who wants to splurge a little bit and have an elegant dinner. Daniels deserves all five stars in my book!

I used to be a steak lover but now I'm a vegetarian/aspiring vegan and want to give Daniel's big love for having a dedicated vegan menu. While most steakhouses have veggie options tucked into their sides and appetizers, it's rare for any restaurant to have a specific vegan menu. As a veggie-eater who still likes the steakhouse atmosphere, I deeply appreciate it.

I used to be a steak lover but now I'm a vegetarian/aspiring vegan and want to give Daniel's big love for having a dedicated vegan menu. While most steakhouses have veggie options tucked into their sides and appetizers, it's rare for any restaurant to have a specific vegan menu. As a veggie-eater who still likes the steakhouse atmosphere, I deeply appreciate it. My friend LOVED the Filet!
Awesome food/drinks...great views...decent prices! I'll definitely go back and appreciate the great customer service!

Went to Daniel's Bellevue for happy hour. This place has one of the best views in Bellevue. Had a salad and a glass of wine. The background music was very nice and the environment was really relaxing. I will be back.

My friend from Vancouver was visiting for the weekend. He wanted steak and picked this restaurant. I've never been here before. I didn't know what to expect. I thought restaurant was burger place. I ordered burger, which was very gourmet and tasty. I tried some of my friend's Porterhouse, and it was the best I ever had. We had teriyaki steak appetizer which was great. Service was 5 star.
It does not get much better than this. Get the long bone ribeye split for 2. its great.

Came here for a business dinner with colleagues. The setting is beautiful with an amazing view! I would love to see what this place looks like during lunch or brunch hours. The food is phenomenal. We had prawns and artichokes as appetizers that were quite tasty. I ordered Salmon that had a tad bit of gumbo. It was delicious. My colleagues had the steak which looked great. Service was also great. Our waitress was extremely nice and made sure our food arrived in a timely manner. This is a wonderful restaurant.
What a fantastic menu, The steaks are amazing and the drinks are great!
Great meal,and service and you will pay for the experience and feel it was worth it
Happy hour is fantastic! We came with a baby and they got us a table quick, quick quick!!!!
Great Food !

I have gone here a few times and I just have to say I love their Steak. The best part about the Daniel's Broiler is its location. It is located right next to the water. Free Valet parking too!! Great food, Great view and free parking? I'm sold!
Enjoyed all aspects of the Thanksgiving dinner.

Gotta be one of the BEST happy hours in Seattle!AWESOME APS!!! The steak bites and seared scallops are the 2 best!What is better than Daniel's bone-in-filet? Not sure anything is (that's legal!)Beautiful bar with experienced and professional bar staff. The piano bar is fun for a switch:)One of the best outdoor patios in Seattle (when the sun actually comes out:0 )

I have never had a bad experience at Daniel's! The staff is amazing (esp. the wine director Erik Segelbaum), they have an amazing happy hour menu (I am an HUGE oyster fan and they always have the best ones at the best price!) During the summer, the outdoor seating area is beautiful which is another plus! Their dinner menu is exquisite as well. I have had my share of steaks and Daniel's has the best steak. Their seafood is also very well prepared although sometimes the king crab legs can be a little bit too salty at times. All in all, if you are looking for a good time with good food, good wine, and good service, go to Daniel's!
Excellent food and service!
Prime Rib Eye, medium plus...that's all I can say...it melts in your mouth...outstanding!
mmmm

people were so nice. Also rib eye steak was fantastic with red wine. but its pricy but its reasonable price and svc.we plan to have dinner someday soon. I recommend to everyone if someone has special event.

Extremely rude employee directing the line. I was trying to look through the window to see if they had the pastry that I wanted to purchase available before standing in line and was yelled at and told that I had to go. I tried to explain what I was doing and she said that she didn't care and I needed to leave. I live and work in the market. Supported this business during the pandemic. I have never been made to feel so unwelcome.
This is not a piroshki definitely, It's a danish pastry! The savoury ones were extremely salty! And also it's not worth the price! The line was super long.

I work for a non-profit organization that supports people of color and the disabled. We were run out of the area by the manager and they called security in my black male colleague who was not on their property. Be aware of this business and stay away fromIt - Black Lives Matter!

Heavy, oily and gross. Not for me.
The long line made me think it would be good. We ended up nothing even finishing it. Not very good.
Not real piroshkies! Too big, doughy and not very good.

The typical Seattleite is a community-college degree holding uncouth miser to have rated this sort of place so highly. Terrible food. To New Yorkers: Would you eat anywhere in Times Squares to line up for a nasty piece of pastry? No, we wouldn't. We would go to Ladure or Magnolia's. Your doubts were correct after first seeing the sort of popular entertainment they offer here, e.g. Duck ride, Pike Place Market, Seattle Center, etc.

I have been banking with Banner Bank for a couple of years with not overdrafts of problems. I used Banner Banks smartphone app (official Banner Bank App promoted by bank) to make a deposit as I was leaving for vacation. I had used this process a couple of times before with no problem. This was used to move money from one of my bank account to another (available funds was never stated as a problem). The app involves submitting a photo of both the front and back of the check. When submitting the deposit the app show "submitted" as status. After reviewing, the app status gets changed to "accepted". I verified that the status was "Accepted" before leaving data coverage. When I returned on 7/19/2014, the status still showed "accepted" but the transaction was never processed. This resulted in overdraft fees of $120 plus the fees applied by the other banks that were declined. On 7/21/2014 I went to the branch to see what had happened. They said that they had questions about the check and had declined to process it. The teller told me that she didn't care what the app said, it didn't process and they weren't going to back off any charges. When I asked to speak to the manager I was asked to be seated. then a couple of minutes later the teller came back out and said that the manager "reviewed the case" and that they wouldn't make any changes. When asked if I could talk to her, I was told NO. When I returned home, I contacted the corporate office and was told it was up to the local branch manager. I did get a phone number for a regional supervisor (Marcello (425) 739-1055), but he seams to not want to answer his phone.
I'm from russia. ,and thats nasties piroshki i ever had.
SImple sandwich breaded with ham n' cheese yet price keeps going very high.Long waits in market and something that is a tourist gimmick.
Maybe good if you've never eaten real Russian food but this place is mediocre at best.
Meh... It's ok. Don't know why all the raves ...
Why anybody would stand in line for overpriced bread is beyond me. For tourists only, no self respecting Seattlite would get within ten feet of the place.
Hit or miss so probably over-rated.
meh pastries, not worth the wait in line. nothing by all hype.
not my kind of Piroshky. missing filling.
Nope, I've definitely experienced better piroshky. It's a tourist trap. Meh.
Liked the food, the only turnoff was the long line....
I was very surprised. The Piroshky was very bland.

Was good but not more than thatLine TOO longCame there only because their great reviews on yelpBut didn't find anything so unique I order the beef&cheese but it wasn't worth the drive specially for it and the wait in the lineI might be wrong but that's my taste:-)
Very rude and impatient employee!

I hadn't experienced Russian before and wanted to give it a shot. For me, it was just okay, but I think it maybe requires a certain acquired taste that I don't have yet. It wasn't horrible. I just wasn't really ready for it I suppose. I will probably try again though someday now that I know what to expect.
I think I ate a salt lick.
Don't understand the hype- pretty tasteless

so used to be one of my favorite places for cheap and filing eats when i am down near the market but lately when i go it is not cooked all the way through and they are not very apologetic when i have taken them back. the center of a piroshky needs to be cooked through!! i dont know if I really like this place as much as everyone else. It jsut seems so over breaded. All the food is unnecessarily unhealthy. Meh.

The service is phenomenal here, before I even mention the amazing food! The waiters are quick to provide water, condiments for bread and fresh napkins & plates quickly. The atmosphere is a great choice for a romantic date or a quiet evening. The dishes are pricey but well worth it - well presented and each distinctive.
ordered a couple of these (beef & cheese and mushroom & cheese), prob not my thing. once is enough.
I'm not a big fan of piroshkies. I don't know why -- they have everything a guy could ask for. What's wrong with me?

I recently visited Piroshky, Piroshky and tried the Classic Smoked Salmon and their seasonal BBQ Pork. Situated in a touristy area, the prices were on the higher side, which is expected given the location. The food itself was just okay; while the Classic Smoked Salmon had a decent flavor, it didn't quite stand out as exceptional. The BBQ Pork was similarly average. Overall, it's a convenient spot for a quick bite, especially if you're already in the area, but the taste and value didn't quite match the hype for me.

This place had a long line and so many people eating Piroshky. It looked popular so I gave it a try. But I found it a bit over hyped. The taste was just fine. But I am still glad they had few vegetarian and began options.I tried Chipotle Piroshky. It was just OK.I also tried potato and cheese Piroshki. I liked it more than the Chipotle one.But still I migh tnot revisit this place considering so many other better options nearby.
In the past this place was great but the apple cinnamon was fairly dry and the beef and cheese was super greasy. Not what I was expecting

Love this service! My lunch disappeared from the fridge at work. Piroshky is a hole in the wall shoppe smack dab in the middle of Pike Place Market. Their food is pretty good... ask them for their most famous piroshky and you'll be happy. You can't actually sit down and eat so you're going to be dealing with a hit and run scenario. To me, a 5-star rating consists of AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE, AMAZING FOOD, AND AMAZING AMBIANCE and here you just get good food.

Piroshky Piroshky is a Seattle institution and a must-visit for anyone exploring Pike Place Market. This small, bustling bakery offers an incredible selection of hand-held pastries that are as delicious as they are iconic.I tried the Smoked Salmon Pate Piroshky, and it was everything I hoped for and more. The pastry itself was flaky, golden, and baked to perfection, while the filling was rich, flavorful, and packed with high-quality smoked salmon. The balance of buttery dough and savory filling made every bite unforgettable.Be prepared for a line--it's a testament to how beloved this spot is. But trust me, the wait is worth it. The staff works quickly and efficiently, and the pastries are always fresh out of the oven.Whether you're grabbing a quick bite while exploring Pike Place or looking for a unique Seattle treat to take home, Piroshky Piroshky delivers an authentic and satisfying experience.
A Seattle classic! always has a line but it moves pretty fast! food never disappoints! size is pretty small tho

Another MUST visit when visiting Pike Place Market! They almost always have a line down the block. Just like Starbucks.  Do not fear the wait times though for Piroshky!!! The lines go very quickly and all food is made from scratch and very fresh!!!4/5 s for atmosphere because it is neat they have windows where you can see into the kitchen and watch them make everything and bake , but they do not have tables or chairs available!!We tried a savory and sweet piroshky! The savory was the salmon pate, which I felt was very fitting since we were visiting the fish market . It was smoked salmon and very creamy--absolutely delicious. The sweet was the Moscow roll. Another delicious choice 4/5 s for service. It is counter service and very quick paced. Not much time for friendly conversation, definitely not rude or bad, just too quick for much.A must try when you are visiting Pike Place Market and I rate it as a must try when in Seattle Peep the food pics there are yummy sights to see!
Love this place, how could you not. I love the salmon. Kid loved the beef.Always a must visit when at Pike Place

Purchased two pirodhkys. Ate one just as soon as I left the store. It was good! I stored the other one in a refrigerator overnight and reheated it. The reheated one was disappointing.Bottom line, enjoy it fresh and hot out of the oven.
I always enjoy the Piroshkis here! You can't go wrong with any of them and they're very fulfilling.
Delicious pastries! Be prepared for long lines if you go during the weekend though.

I can't even describe how much I loved this. Since this was my first time here, I wanted to try the most popular items as a start. They have a "Best Seller" section shown on their menu. The main three: Beef and Cheese, Smoked Salmon Pate, and Potato and Cheese.

It's mid. It's just okay. Worth one visit, or if you have a favorite pastry here then it's worth a stop if you're in the area, but that's kind of it. I don't understand the super long lines and I definitely wouldn't stand in the cold for it. Sounds harsh, but this place gets so much hype and yes it's good, but the hype doesn't match the product in my opinion. Again, worth one visit, but not my favorite.My only favorite thing to get here is the pastry with the spicy cheese sausage in it. If anything, it speaks volumes on how good the sausage is, not the actual breading around it. It's the only thing I will buy here moving forward. Otherwise, workers here are very friendly and patient, they provide a very comfortable vibe and they are just so nice.
I haven't had a piroshky in many years. This place has a lot to choose from and they are pretty good.thanks!
This place has the best food! Taste like your Russian friend's grandma cooked it in her kitchen lol!
This is a nice place for sure, food was great

This spot is super popular, so it was no surprise when there were no tables available. My boyfriend and I decided to sit at the bar. The bartender greeted us promptly and made us some great drinks. She recommended some great dishes and pairings of wine for those dishes. It ended up being a great experience. Will come here again.
Pastries were fresh and enjoyable. Makes for a good break when shopping at the fish market.
This place was my intro to piroshkies. I'm a fan.

My husband has a food allergy, so we have to be cautious where we go. It's not typical that the waiters ask about them but the fact that they did surprised me. I'm quite picky with my meat so I was also surprised at how fresh the ingredients tasted. The food came out to perfection. Will be coming again soon. I would also recommend this place to anyone!
My favorite place to go at Pike Place. This is where I had my very first piroshky and nothing else compares. No other place compares.
Delicious. I haven't had pastries this good in a long time. Worth stopping by!

Their pastries are so delicious!!! I got a little bit of everything but their apple cinnamon rolls are amazing! The cinnamon and sugar balance is perfect. They do get a little sad after they get cold (so 4 stars), so be sure to eat them right when you get them as they're not great a couple hours later.
I think the place is pretty amazing the staff as well.
Good food and great service. Prices were fair for the quality. Will definitely be back!!

This is one of the freshest bakeries i have been to! The staff inside was great as well super friendly and helpful. Prices were very fair, and despite how small these things might look, they were more filling than we anticipated. Everything was fresh.
This place has reached meme-tier levels of hype, and I'm not sure if it's that special, although it's hard to not grab one when I come down to Pike Place Market. I like the potato, cheese, and onion.

You kind of know a place is good when the lines are out the door and the place smells like butter. These piroshkies are a little different then what you would find in a typical Russian or Eastern European bakery. The dough is puff pastry instead of baked/fried bread. Reminds me of a fancy empanada or handpie. I had the beef and onion. Based on appearances, I was expecting it to sit like a brick in my stomach but the pastry was surprisingly light with a good beef flavor and nicely seasoned not overly salty. Wish I had more time and the stomach space to sample their other offerings.
Fast service, suddenly I was expecting more.. not sure why.. mine didnt like it that much..

Piroshky Piroshky! This was actually my friends and I's FIRST stop in Seattle. We were hungry and we looked at my Seattle "to do" list and bam, there it was. Right in front of our eyes. We waited in the line outside with our luggage because we came straight from the airport. The line did go pretty quickly. Do you know what a piroshky is? If not, compare it to a pierogi or a kolachi. Basically bread with stuff .. stuffed inside lol. Carb heaven I must say. Everything has bread with it. Therefore, if you cannot eat carbs or it's a weakness for you, stay away lol. I ended up getting the Smoked Salmon Pate. Giving the traditional Piroshky a local spin, this bestseller is a delicious blend of Smoked Salmon, cream cheese, a dash of dill and onion. I really loved it. It was nice and warm and the smoked salmon was flavorful.Then during a food tour, I had the Smoked Salmon Pate and then an Apple Cinnamon Roll. This includes slices of Granny Smith Apples dusted with Cinnamon, rolled into dough and finished with a glaze of honey and lemon. It is their bestselling sweet creation. It was really good.The morning we had to run to the airport, we ended up coming back. I had the Spinach, Egg, and Cheese. It contained Spinach tossed with Parmesan then baked with egg. This squared pied is topped of a sprinkle of Columbia Valley Sharp Cheddar. Overall, it was a great experience. A little of the expensive side for a pastry. However, it's a "must go" for Seattle! [Review 72 for 2019. Review 514 overall]
Honestly one of my favorite places in the market to grab a quick bite. The long line is almost always quick moving and worth the wait.
love this place. Piroshkys are delicious

The Piroshky Piroshky location on Cherry and 4th is excellent, with lots of savory and sweet options, including breakfast sandwich style items so this location would get 5 stars. We've been going to Piroshky Piroshky for years. They're all pretty good, but my go-to is the beef and cheese. A close runner up is the potato and onion. The sweet ones are really good too. The bread is so flaky and warm. If you're ever in Pike Place Market, I would definitely recommend you check them out. The line can get long, but it's worth it. Best to go during the week.

This place is a great spot downtown for some authentic russian food. I got a piroshky for the first time and it was delicious. I got the turkey and cheddar one and I would definitely recommend. It's always fun to try some food from different countries when you are just in downtown Seattle!

I once dated a Russian / Armenian girl whos grandmother introduced me to the Piroshky (what a fun word by the way!)So after finding other spots through yelp I decided to give this one a go and look this place up... pretty glad that I did. Was not dissapointed one bit. I had never though salmon would go well in a piroshky but oh boy was I impressed. I want to go back and try them all. All the food is made fresh daily and it showsYou can taste the freshness in all of the food. I would consider this comfort food and again not sure if it is really healthy although my ex's g-ma used to say it was... Or maybe she wanted me to put those extra pounds on haha
great piroshkys!! great location awesome staff

One of my favorite places to visit at Pike Place Market! They offer both sweet and savory options, but I tried savory options both times. Their signature item is a smoked salmon pate piroshky... I had someone explain it to me as a somewhat healthy Hot Pocket, and it is very similar! I thoroughly enjoyed the dill flavor in the crust, and the smoked salmon on the inside was fresh, it felt like it had just come out of the oven! I also tried the smoked mozzerella, mushroom, and broccoli and that tasted more like a calzone to me, but still equally as great! The only downside is that this seems to be one of the most popular places in the market and there is often a long line. Be prepared to wait about 15 minutes. It is worth the wait though, I can't wait to come back and try more of their flavors!
Great, fresh pastries and fast moving lines! Having been disappointed yet. Come here at least once a week. Yeah it's that good :)

This area is awesome. I literally have nothing bad to say relating to this area; the piroshky is consistently fresh and the staff is consistently friendly. I have not attempted all of the many distinct flavors of piroshky, but the ones I 've had (which contain the steak and cheese, rhubarb, cinnamon and cardomon braid, cranberry apple, and basic steak) are amazing! They do not constantly have borscht, but when they do it's also excellent and I highly recommend it.

Based on Piroshky Piroshky's web site, Piroshky is a derivative of the Russian word (pir) for banquet. This small hole in the wall definitely lives up to the concept of a double banquet! Situated on exactly the same side of the road as the first Starbucks across from Pike's Place Market, Piroshky Piroshky serves up pastries filled with either salty or sweet ingredients. My favorites include the Apple Cinnamon Roll as well as the Cheese Onion Garlic Roll. They're REALLY SO great!!!

These baked goods are always fresh. Good mix of sweet and savory. They are quite big so make for a good breakfast or afternoon snack. It's busy and rated highly for a reason. Even with a long time, service is quick and friendly. The salmon is a must try!

this place is pretty nice. if you've never had one before, they are like little gourmet hot pockets. they are filled with all kinds of goodies. my favorite is the smoked salmon. they have happy hour i think from 4- close. pretty much anything they didnt sell that day gets marked down.

I've been on a hunt for kolaches here for awhile, then I realized people here don't even know what a kolache is. :((i'm originally from texas, and they rock)if you don't know what a kolache is, i pity you. kolachefactory.comanyways, i was so sad to find out about the lack of kolaches in seattle, until i stumbled across Piroshky. The first time I had it was at the Bumbershoot festival last year. It was freshly made, and the guy gave it to me right out of the fryer. I had the salmon piroshky, shaped like a fish (uber cute). It was sooo good, I went back for another one. Some time later, I was craving another one, so I went by the shop in Pike's Market. It just wasn't the same. sad face. It was still good, but just didn't taste as fresh? I got the same salmon one, but the fish seemed a bit dried out and wasn't as creamy as the one i had at the festival. Still, piroshky is good and yes i will go again, but I still miss my kolaches..

The smoked salmon pate is absolutely amazing! It was worth the wait and heat, especially since the line moves fast and the employees are extremely friendly. I would definitely recommend that everyone give this place a try. Especially since it's easy to eat and walk or loiter in a corner.

Piroshky Piroshky is an absolute gem! From the moment you step inside, the enticing aroma of freshly baked goods surrounds you and the welcoming staff who are super friendly. Among the many delicious options, the smoked salmon pate stands out as an absolute must-try.The smoked salmon pate is incredibly flavorful and perfectly balanced. What surprised me the most was that it doesn't smell fishy at all, which is often a concern with seafood pastries. The taste is phenomenal, with the rich, smoky flavor of the salmon beautifully complemented by the creamy pate. It's a savory delight wrapped in a golden, flaky pastry that is pure perfection.Whether you're a local or a tourist, this is one treat you don't want to miss.

The line might be long, but trust me, the wait is absolutely worth it for the delectable treats awaiting you at Piroshky Piroshky!Piroshky Piroshky at Pike Place Market never fails to impress! I tried their Traditional Beef and Onion piroshky, and it was absolutely mouthwatering. The combination of tender beef, savory onions, and perfectly baked dough made each bite heavenly. The smoked salmon piroshky was another winner, with its rich and smoky flavor complemented by the flaky pastry.To cap off the experience, I indulged in their chocolate hazelnut dessert piroshky, and it was pure bliss! The decadent chocolate paired with the nutty hazelnut filling was a delightful way to end the meal.The staff were friendly, the service was prompt, and the atmosphere bustling with energy. Piroshky Piroshky is definitely a must-visit spot for anyone craving delicious pastries in Seattle's iconic Pike Place Market. Can't wait to go back for more!

Piroshky Piroshky is a gem tucked away in Pike Place Market, and a must-visit on any Seattle trip. This charming bakery is known for its diverse and flavorful piroshkies, and it certainly lives up to its reputation.My personal favorite was the cheese and meat piroshky - a warm, hearty parcel filled with aromatic spices. It was the perfect way to kick-start our day of exploration. The taste still lingers in my memory, making me crave another bite.Another standout item was the Vatrushka, a house specialty. This delectable treat consists of house-made dough topped with marionberries & sweet cream cheese, all dusted with powdered sugar. It was sweet without being cloying, and the marionberries added a delightful tanginess that played off the creamy cheese perfectly.Don't let the line intimidate you - Piroshky Piroshky is more than worth the wait. In fact, the anticipation only adds to the experience. As I pen this review, I find myself longing to be back there again, savoring those incredible flavors.Piroshky Piroshky offers an authentic, delicious taste of Seattle that you won't want to miss. Whether you're a local or a visitor, this place should be at the top of your foodie list.

Just grab your grub and go sit facing the waterfront and enjoy the views with some pesky birds eyeing your food.
