Absolutely delicious food. The line is extremely long all the time but it's very well worth the wait.
I had never had these before and a friend wanted to go here. Holy crap what a surprise! You have to try these!
The line sucks, but the food is great.
You can smell the delights from a block away
Whatever you do, wait in line. It's worth the wait. Get the smoked salmon one and you won't be disappointed.
Very delicious pastries though a bit overpriced. You should try their salmon pate!!

Yummy, yummy, yummy, I got love in my tummy. Piroshky, Piorshky, you are a delightful, savory, devil that will haunt my food dreams. I stuck to the savory items, and although I can't recall the actual name, my favorite was one that had about a bazillion diced up mushrooms in it. I had two, although I wish I had, had the balls to order 4 and let the world judge me how they saw fit. There were some sweet options as well--- one looked like a death star, I abstained given my preference to gorge myself on savory, but it looked great. Also, a fun line to wait in. Part of the experience right?!
Love this place, but be prepared to wait in line.
beyond excellent, highly recommend!
Delicious!! I love their food, but always make sure to come early to be sure you'll get what you want!
I ordered this on DoorDash. It was nice and hot when I got it. The Borscht tasted like my Baba's. I would get it again!

I used to visit Piroshky Piroshky a LOT when it was in Capital Hill, and it was always so flavorful and yummy. Now that they are downtown, I don't get to go as often, but it is always excellent. It makes for a nice little outing as well, as it's right by Pike's Place.
Delicious! Go at a time when it is not busy.

Went here for breakfast, and the piroshky's were delicious. We tried the potato and mushroom, and a chocolate and hazelnut piroshky. Both were delicious, but the potato and mushroom one was particularly flavorful and tasty. The atmosphere was good too. It's cramped and loud in the small shop (in a good way), and was cozy and very enjoyable. Also, the service was super fast and very friendly.
Insanely delicious savory and sweet.
Absolutely yummy!!!!! It's very hard to decide which to get so get lots and share.
I actually signed up to help just to say this place created a new addict. Wow! The smoked salmon is amazing and so is the beef & onions.

Always long line, so that means it must be something worth waiting for. Definitely a Seattle signature. I always recommend my friend to visit this shop during their visit to Seattle, because without it, the trip wouldn't be complete!
Awesome place, always packed but for good reason!
So Goood and warm!! Everything is so delicious, especially on a cold day.
I have to say the salmon piroshki is ALMOST as good as my mother-in-laws! Love this quaint little spot! Its a must try when your down at Pike's Place!
Yes, it is worth the wait in line. If you are a local go during the week. The savory pastries are the best, chicken with mushroom and beef with cheese are incredible.
Nothing bad to say here. Wonderful pasteries
Can't say too much that hasn't already been said. Love this place!
Best food and wonderful people who make pyrozhky and sell them to the public. Always fresh and tasty. Thank you! Larissa Chuprina
Delicious! Fresh and fast service.
My favorite spot to go to for a quick snack during my visit to Pike Place Market!
mmmmm si me gusta. muy bueno. just kidding i speak ingles but food is very good
Great food! Never disappoints!

Piroshky is one of my favorite foods and Piroshky Piroshky does it the best. Whenever I'm in downtown I always make sure to stop by and pick up the salmon piroshky. Mmmm! The line can sometimes be long but its completely worth the wait!
Amazing food, and a cute place!I highly recommend it.
Great service. The pastries are DELICIOUS.

I love getting pastries here. You can choose savory or sweet which is nice. You can be satisfied with one of their savory ham or beef choices if you want a light lunch. They have a salmon option as well for those who like seafood, I recommend it!
Even if the line is 45 minutes, GO! If you like bread, eat here. If you like food, eat here. Because this place is totally worth it. Every single item we bought was amazing.
No words.....should've sent a poet. 5/5 would recommend.
Great spot, Really tasty and the service is great
Love this place! Try and stop every time I'm near Pikes Place. So good!
I was sooooo hungry. A piroshky is a piroshky!

You can't walk by without smelling the delicious aroma of this dough... and you won't keep walking. It's worth the line (or just go when the market isn't busy). Both the savory and sweet pastries are amazing. Mouth watering actually. They did not disappoint. I take everyone who visits me in Seattle to this place.

If I could give it 6 stars I would! The line is worth the wait! They also have a happy hour! I got the beef and cheese, but regret not getting the salmon. Splurging on some pastries here! I ate it for breakfast and while a heavy way to start the day I don't regret it! Will be bringing visitors here next time!
super super good and homemade comfort food.
Best food ever you gotta try this place
Love me some Piroshky Piroshky!
How delicious! Words can't describe! every type I tried was fabulous.

Stood in a long-a** line, but was worth it 100%. It seems kinda touristy at first, but having just moved to Seattle it seemed like it was worth checking out what the hype was all about. Got the mushroom and beef piroshky -- will try some of the cheesy ones next time!
Best Russian food in town. I was happy with the dessert options they have.
Beef and Cheddar is my favorite! I wouldn't say they are traditionally Russian style, but still satisfying
Haven't been here in years and years and they are just as Yummy as I remember! Always a line and efficiency gets u through quickly!
So delicious! I'm not much of a salmon person but this was delicious. I would definitely get in that long line again for this.
Piroshkys! Not much around for competition in this category. Beef and cheese, beef and onion my favorites. A refreshing break from the standard Seattle diet
Love this place, you are always going to stand in line but it's so worth it! I have been here many times and loved it every time. Cheap, fast to get thru the line and always fun.
A Market Staple. Been coming here since I was a kiddo.
Wonderful little hole-in-the wall spot. The epitome of doing one thing and doing it very well!
So amazing,,,,for some reason they taste better at the original Pike place market location. The smoked salmon is amazing
YUMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM. the only downside is the line. but totally worth it!
So so good! I went with three people and we all got something different. I want to go back and try everything!
Amazing pastries. So soft and delicious! Lines were almost non existent after 7pm so we were lucky to be served so fast compared with breakfast and lunch hours when lines were super long.
My favorite in Seattle. They are not baked on site but still taste fine.

This meal was bitter sweet. This is my last day in Seattle and work is carrying me off again. I wanted to leave with a belly full of delicious food and I knew this had to be the place. The crust is perfectly flaky and they are filled to bust. My favorites have to be the beef and onion, the cabbage and onion, and the beef and cheese. The cherry chocolate is always the perfect end. Sometimes the lines are long, *usually* but sometimes if you hit it at the right time, you'll be in and out. Don't let the lines discourage you, it's worth the wait (most good food is). I will certainly miss you and I hope my journey across the country brings me back here again one day.
Line is always crazy on the weekends, but you won't be disappointed. Definitely a must try when at the market!
This is what heaven smells like.

I love the onion Pirosky, this is a great treat if you come to Pike Place. Pike Place is sort of the "tourist" thing to do, but there's locals there too. Great coffee, desserts, and Piroshky Piroshky is unique and delicious!
Russians, piroshky with vodka could be a great recipe) Love this place!
Amazing. Have had every kind they serve over the years. Worth getting line for.
The lines at this place could be long, but it is sooo worth it the food is amazing.
Piroshky Piroshky is amazing! Definitely visit if you're looking for a filling snack. The dough they use tastes great and there is a large variety of flavors/fillings.
Tasty Russian bakery! Variety of sweet and sour piroshkies to try, highly recommend to stop by.
Worth the wait! I'd advised to get more than one.
Yummy food. I stop there every time we go to Pike Place.
Fantastic! As good as in Russia.
I love this place! If you go to the market, you have to go here. Prices are great, too.
The smoked salmon bread is great! Will go again to check out the potato and cheese bread
Best Russian piroshki. Worth every penny and the waiting time
Great place. I visit the Southcenter branch all the time. A really hearty feed that is convenient to nosh while working. And they have good coffee and hot chocolate too. The staff is really friendly!
Get them and put them in your face.

This place is amazing for morning breakfast on the Go with a cup of coffee.Working downtown Seattle for the past 18 years had me coming to this place for about 10 years when I discovered it. Good hard working people and food is delicious.
Delicious! A bit intimidated by the line initially but it moves quickly.
So yummy, but we walked in later in the evening, so we didn't have much selection to choose from.
5 Stars and a Wow! Great place to grab a quick bite to eat....
The line is long, but it moves pretty fast. Just make sure you know what you want right when you get up there, because there's no time to decide! And you'll want to try everything!
This is a definate stop when visiting pike place market. Some of the best pastries i have had while in seattle.
Always a stop when I'm in the market.
This place is WORTH THE WAIT. Everything is delicious. Get in line, NOW!
I LOVE this place. This is the best place to go in the area. The line tells the truth.
I love this place, totally worth the lines
Amazing food. we wait in the long lines. worth it :)
Such Delicious piroshkys great food great price. I will gladly return here again
Great place. Friendly staff. Great hearty food that you can eat with one hand without making a mess or even touching it (the wrapper design is perfect for people on the go). Should be the next McD's.
This bakery is making best piroshki. Every time I came, they always have the wide variety of pastry. Love the smell in this shop.
One of the best bakeries in Seattle. Waiting line is very long all the time but it is worth waiting! Would recommend to anybody!!
There is something about the bread in these things. In Seattle for 3 days and will try to go all 3 days.
Really good! I ordered the cardamom orange one and it was nothing but great.
The service was out of this world. The food was fabulous and it came to us fast. Best experience I've had at this location ever. Look forward to going back soon.
Longtime favorite. Reasonably priced and so tasty.
Hand made fresh rolls so good! The cheese ones and all,e ones are my favorite.
The line is a bit long but it is a wait that is worth waiting for.The food is amazing and there are great things to see around it.Fun area and great food!
Just get in line. I promise, it'll be worth the wait.
potato and cheese is the best! but everything is great
Great spot - one of the most authentic Piroshky you'll findd!
One of the best spots in Pike. Get a pastry or three and enjoy your walk around the market!
too good to describe. delicious .
Love it.The best one is the meat or the chicken.Don't buy only 1 because you will regret that when it's done.buy 2.Always buy 2
Love it.The best one is the meat or the chicken.Don't buy only 1 because you will regret that when it's done.buy 2.Always buy 2
I love Piroshky...special salmon and cream cheese Piroshky!
Love, love, love! Especially on stormy days.

People saying that it's packed, that's part of the cool atmosphere. You can smell the bakery from blocks away and the food does not disappoint. There is always great service and just a nice way to break out of your normal eggs and bacon. This is one of my favorite breakfast/treat places to stop while in the Seattle area.
Its really really good! Sometimes you might have to stand in line, but they're totally worth it!
No matter how long the line is, you should take the time to get some. This is amazing.
This is one of my favorite places to eat in the market. The salmon and cream cheese one is amazing!
Great Food I love The Staff so much
Amazing Marzipan and Smoked Salmon!
Yummy in my tummy - everything is delicious!
Loved this place. Though you have to wait in long queue to get food here but it's worth the wait.
The lines are a bit long, but it is totally worth the wait.

Your review helps others learn about great local businesses.I think this is one of the few places in Pike Place market that the locals actually go to. There's always a long line but it moves quickly. And I think you can actually use an app or call ahead to place your order now. People always go to the Starbucks down the road but really that's just for sightseeing. Come here to get something good.Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees.
The ish...nothing else to say. If your in Pike Place Market you have to stop by.
We are never dissatisfied with anything we've eaten here...only the line!
The Salmon piroshky is indeed excellent (and very photogenic).
Great Food and Good People working there...
Classic Russian place. We come here all the time, very delicious. Definitely would recommend to any of my friends
Quick good eat while at the market Long line sometimes so get there early.
Best piroshki in Seattle and definitely worth the wait in line.
Great food and great owners!
great piroshky, even if the line can get long well worth the wait!
The line is huge every time and hands down the best piroshky in town!
Delicious and worth waiting in the line.
Very delicious! But sometimes it is hard to get because of the lines, but it worth waiting!
All I have to say is- Yum! The line in the summer speaks volumes and it is always worth the wait.
These are amazing, you wont find better in the states.
one of the best restaurants ive had in seattle this is amazing i came with my wife and we tried the traditional chowder and left extreemyl satisfied.
wowowowowoowowowowowoowowowoowowowowowwowoowowowwowoowowowoowowowowow
Never disappointed! Lines always long, though. That's how you know it's good!

Came here two times in two days! Definitely try their smoke salmon pate. Their bread was so soft and fluffy and the filling was strong in flavor but not over bearing. Also had their chicken mushroom and also chocolate hazelnut cream. Definitely prefer the savory over sweet but that's because I'm savory type of guy. Don't be intimidated by the long lines, it moves fast and before no time you will have one of those delicious Russian bread + filling is talking about
A must when you're down at Pike market. Go right on passed Sbux and get yourself some deliciousness. I'm a fan of the potato and cheese.
A MUST stop at the Pike's Place!
Do yourself a favor and stop by Piroshky Piroshky when you are at Pike Place.
The best lunch stop in the Market! :-)
I'm a sucker for potato/cheddar. So good.
Really good pastries. Good for the to go.
Long line but totally worth the wait. It's a great place to have lunch! The food is awesome.
Delicious! Worth waiting in the line no matter how long it is. Potato and cheese is my long time favorite!
Smoked Salmon Piroshky........i'll take all of them!
A must stop for anyone visiting Seattle. We try and come by whenever we are in the are for such a wonderful treat!
Incredibly tasty. A must on a rainy day in the market
This is one of my favorite Russian bakery in town. Highly recommended.
Great russian place in the heart of the Pike Place! Recommend!
I was a little reluctant to go try this place because I like to stick with one cousine but I am glad I went. Amazing food. Your tastebuds will thank you for it.
Yummy russian bakery! I love it.
MMMMMM.MMMM.MMM. The Savory cheddar and Broccoli are my favorite. The salmon snapped piroshky with salmon inside is a delight.

I took my grandchild to Immediate Clinic Burien - excellent staff and provider. We got in and out right away. My grandson needed to get into a specialist and the doctor called ahead and got us an appointment. It was really appreciated.
fast, easy and delicious food. everyone working here is supper friendly. I always appreciate the great customer service.
wow. off the charts good. great work to everyone involved here!
delicious savory bakery good sweet and salty both great

I used to stop by during lunch breaks at work, or after work as a treat for myself after an especially hectic day. I really enjoyed all of the sweet baked goods I tried, and in particular, still have cravings for one of the meat ones - the smoked salmon pat piroshky that is shaped like a fish. A really nice experience, munching away along the waterfront with such deliciousness, especially during the fall or winter seasons. To share the joy, I brought some home (not sure how I managed the 2 hour bus ride home without eating them) and everyone there also enjoyed them!
The best take away pastries in Seattle! I have to stop here EVERY time I pass by.
Love this Place , not the lines. I feel they are little over priced.
Must stop if at Pikes Place Market! Try the Salmon Piroshky.
Get the Beef and cheese piroshky or else the salmon piroshky!
Delicious, that's all I have to say. It's been there for as long as it has for a reason... The reason is it's freaking delicious!

This was my first time here and it won't be the last one. My favorites are the smoked salmon pate. It was delicious. We went there as a family for brunch and it was very filling. They have all kinds of flavors so you can never run out of options. Very good and quick service. People were friendly. The place itself is a bit small but the line moves pretty quickly. Definately worth a try and a very good option for breakfast, brunch or lunch. You can even smell piroshky from the outside. Will be back!!!!
This place is as good as it gets. OMG suck yummy treats
Need to get up there and have some yum!
Best Russian Food Around.
Love me some Piroshy^2. Have been coming for years. Consistently wonderful.
THE BEST. those salmon ones though. cannot even.

I can't say enough about this place. If you like a YUM piroshky, you must try. If you don't know what a piroshky is, you must try. Try to plan your visit away from popular eating times, as the line outside the place will be long. You won't be disappointed in the place.I didn't know what a piroshky was until I was at a Seafair party 10+ years ago. That's when JEN COLLINS made some for the party and I became a major fan of piroshkies. Jen passed away a few years ago. When I come to PP I think of JEN. This review is dedicated to JEN.
Large Selection of Pastries. Always Delicious.
Amazing food and very kind workers!
I will wait in line to go here!!!!!
Great place to go if your at Pike Place Market! 10/10 would recommend
The best! The lines don't even seem that long when everything smells so good!
Best thing to eat on the market!
I've had piroshky a handful of times. This is the best in in WA state, by far.
Go here. If you're in the market, if you're nearby, just go here. It's real tasty.
How can you not love the salmon piroshky!
This is one of my favorite places in Seattle. I love the cinnamon cardamon braids!
Skip the Starbucks. You got to get in line for these. Very good and very filling
Always super delicious when I go. They are always very nice as well! I just make sure I go when there isn't a line! Even with a line, it usually goes by fairly quickly.
How do you go to Pikes Place and not go here?! This place is my favorite. Go during off hours. The line can get ridiculous.
Yum and they always deliver the same quality!! A gem in the market.
The salmon bread fish was melting cheese in salmon with crusty sweet bread. Tasty but American. The potato mushroom has the rugged piroshky taste but it is a very large bear size thing.
Just go here, end of story.
One of my favorite Seattle restaurants!
Delicious cheese & potato piroshky!

Had our roof cleaned and repaired by Darryl Moss Roof care and they did a fantastic job. Came in under estimate and power washed ALL of our entire exposed aggregate and the sidewalk as well. They went above and beyond, and would recommend them to anyone who needs this service.
Ill be back soon for more with friends
I would eat 19 of these in one sitting.
nice authentic Russian food. have tried it a few times and really liked it.Keep it up guys and please add more to your manu

Yayyy piroshky! Love their cheddar green onion rolls, to die for! I don't know if they have other locations, or if there are other knock offs but this is the location to go to for the best piroshky (Been to the crossroads one, not as good).
I always go here when I'm in Downtown Seattle. Piroshky is super yummy, not as good as Kalinka's but still well worth the trip. The salmon one is my fav next to the beef and cheese. :)
The Salmon One is one of my fav!!!

I actually like bakeries and all kind of pastry stuff but I had never tried a piroshky. Have had many other types of filled pastry but NOTHING compares to these little gems. Had the potato and cheese which was super delicious! My friend had the smoked salmon and claimed it to be one of the best things she has ever eaten. We also got a chocolate cream hazelnut piroshky which was also super tasty. The line went fast and service was friendly. I highly enjoyed this place and I will go back there again.
Deep fried meat pies? Can you go wrong with these? They're delicious and made ever so much more so by the hustle and bustle of the market.
very yammy and friendly! good place to hang out w friends
LOVE this place!! This is a must see/ eat for people visiting from out of town!

First time eating Piroshky. Definitely doesn't disappoint! The treats we bought the first day were so great, we came 2 days in a row. First day we lucked out in the afternoon with no line. Next day, we went to get coffee at the first Starbucks in the world next door and got caught up in the morning rush in a 20 minute Piroshky line. My favorite was the salmon pate, a fish shaped pastry filled with tasty salmon pate; it was a first for me, and quite satisfying. I also tried the beef and cheese, ham, cheese, and spinach, smoked mozzarella, mushroom, and broccoli, and apple cinnamon roll, all recommended by other Yelpers, but out of all of them, the salmon pate was in my opinion the most flavorful and suited to my taste. Though the other pastries didn't become my favorite, they were all worth a try. You'll experience various pastry textures and consistencies;
Gods perfect food
I love their food! great location right by pike place market. will go again.
It's really 5 stars good.
A Seattle must. This place has been around forever and for good reason. Do yourself a favor and get two..
worth waiting in line. delicious. so many calories, but who cares?
so delicious! get the meat and cheese!
Wonderful! Got there early Saturday am right before the big crowd.
sooo yammy!!
very yammy but pricey!!! lol
Breakfast - check! Everything I want from the pastry shop and more. Recommending salmon pate if you like that sort of stuff...dat smell, mmmm!
Walking through Pike Place Market, you can find this place. You may see a line, but its worth the wait.
Beef and onion - you won't be sorry.
Best piroshky in Seattle
Meat and cheese pirochky was super good. Borchers soup was cool too. I loved both. If you are in Seattle you should not leave the city without trying this place;)
The best Piroshky's ever!
Very tasty!Long line when we got there but they are fast! So we didn't mind the long line at all. It was well worth it.
Best Piroshki IN TOWN.
YES YES YES! I love this place! The Borscht is (probably) just like the "old country", the people here are always really friendly and the food is always so so good! Highly recommend!
connection to my routes. LOVE IT !!
I'm from here, and I will brave the tourists to stand in the scorching hot lines in the summer to get a piroshky. The line moves fast, people. Trust me.
Wait in line, just do it. Bring cash.

The smoked salmon pate is the business. This flaky hot pastry wrapping around creamy dill and fresh salmon is the handheld breakfast of champions. Don't be afraid of the line because it moves quickly. I frowned for hours that I couldn't find a Russian Bakery back home in Los Angeles. The search continues.
OMG. The beef and cheese piroshky is one of the best things I have ever eaten.
Amazing!!! Warm fresh bread everytime I have visited!!

I really enjoyed this place. The wait staff was amazing and the food was delicious. I would recommend this to anyone in the area. My boyfriend took me here as a spur of the moment type thing. He said it was his favorite place to chow down and now I know why.
This place is a gem! Just excellent, excellent! I would move downtown just to be near!

If you love russian food, you cant miss place when you come to seattle downtown!one of the best piroshki I ever had in seattle so far.One with meat is crusty and very tasty with russiian salad!service is great with a great location.
Everything was delicious and the staff is very nice.
Salmon piroshki!
Good Stuff with Flavor, awesome atmosphere.
Fast service and such good pastries. Need to go back!
My favorite place at Pike Place!
awesome pierogies!

My background is Hungarian, and I thought after my Grandmother's death I would never experience that home-cooked taste in this country. Many of the foods served here are a great reminder of those times. There are some differences, but overall, excellent and great tasting food. I highly-recommend them!

Very impressed with customer service! It's a small bakery but with very big lines waiting to try the famous piroshki. I have visited many times and for me it's the place I like to go when I feel blue. I buy myself a fresh warm piroshki and my day brightens up :)
I love piroshky piroshky. And it's not just because I am drunk. I have loved them since I was like 8.
One of my favorites in the market! They have savories and sweets. The salmon is out of this world. Worth the wait.
can you say caRBS!!!!!
Great food - just always busy at Pike Street

Gets busy in the summer but the line moves fast. Tip: the busier they are, the fresher the food is! When you go in the winter time, the piroshkies aren't as hot and you won't smell that amazing buttery aroma when you walk by the shop. The service is good, too!

This place is awesome, and I am so happy that one of my Russian friends dragged me here. If you have never had a piroshok (I think they are called?) then you are in for a treat like I was. Basically they are mini pies with ingredients like meat, veggies, and other things inside. They are flakey and crunchy and filled with all sorts of things. My recommendation is the mushroom, chicken, and rice, the flavors mixed so well with the bread. Also the cranberry apple piroshki were a great dessert, although I guess they are technically not a desert.The bottom line is go here, eat, and you will enjoy.
Ya gotta have the beef and cheese. I could eat that fun lunch every damn day of the week.
I bring everyone from out of town to P.P.
salmon piroshky the bomb dot com
I love this place. They have delicious food and a comfortable environment.
good food, good service, but little pricey. great location. my favorite thing was the chic and mushroom, very very tasty. would recommend if you are in the area.
It is wonderful. Really enjoys!
a seattle must!!!
Wonderful baked goods!! The salmon one is delish. If you can weather the crowds of the market, a stop at Piroshky Piroshky is a must. yum yum yum

Terrific and definitely lived up to the hype. I had a fruit and cheese one, and thought that surely I couldn't finish it all because of how big it was, but OH I did. The line moves pretty quickly, so don't be discouraged by what appeared to be a long wait.
Quick and delicious! If there weren't so many good places to try at Pike Place, I'd come back here every time I was in the area.
simply delicious
A must if you are at the market. Beef and cheese is a classic!

Love the pastries... particularly the salmon one. Simple out of this world. This is very small place... lined by at least 10 people selling things to customers. A big line of 20 customers is always there... but, you wont wait more than 10 mins :)Awesome fast service.
Tasty and fast.

Simply awesome! But beware of the long queues

yummy!

So good! Worth the wait in line if you're down at Pike's Place.

Friend was recommended by a friend on our trip to Seattle and OMG it was so worth it. It's right in Pike's Place so you can grab a pastry and eat it while you walk around the farmers market. The line was pretty long and we probably waited about 20-30 minutes to order but it was SO worth it. Got the two best sellers, the Salmon Pate Piroshky and the Beef and Cheese Piroshky. The salmon one was my FAVE, it was so good. I'll definitely be stopping by again next time I am in town!
Can't go wrong with Piroshky Piroshky!

I was walking through the amazing pike's place market and suddendly I saw see this tiny place with a lot o people in line. I was very curious about that. Thanks god for that curiosity of mine. It's an amazing place. Beef, Salmon are my favorites piroshky.
Great food.

I love coming here for the salmon but you have to come here early. The last time i came around this area , I've meant Miss Seattle.

Is there anything bad to say about this place (besides the line)? Everytime I go I pick a sweet and a savory one. I know, I know, serious artery blocker. My favorite is still the smoked salmon piroshky. I usually end up at the Market and just follow the smell. Seriously, a classic. Always great.

Very very busy, but for good reason. The piroshky have amazing crusts, and then filled with flavors such as salmon, broccoli cheese, and cream of mushroom, and sweet Piroshky such as rhubarb and chocolate. There seem to be different types of crust for different types of fillings. I find two savory and one sweet piroshky splits well between 2 people.You will need to stand in line, or go on a slow day (some weekday during the winter when the skies are dark). Then, there is not seating, so you will have to take your piroshky and flee to somewhere more comfortable. If you explore Pike Place, you will find that there is public seating available, or coffee shops you can occupy. If you go straight back and to the left of the Piroshky place, you can find some small amount of public seating, and if that is full, across the street there is a nice park (although someone tried to sell me drugs last time I went there, which might make tourists more uncomfortable).You might wonder if this hassle is worth it. I would say yes. The closest I've found elsewhere is savory pies, but never of the same quality. They are high quality, quirky, but simple, and very Seattle to me. Besides, sometimes standing in line with a bunch of other people excited to experience a place is what you need to convince yourself to pay attention to what you are eating.

I love Piroshky Piroshky! They are so awesome that they had to mention piroshky twice in their name. I tried two of their creations, one savory and one sweet. For my savory I selected the smoked salmon, broccoli, and mushroom. It was so yummy, I couldn't get enough of it! And then I tried the cherry and white chocolate piroshky, which was so decadently delicious! The people here are so nice. I love this place!
Where else are you going to get this kind of food for this price in Seattle?
Meat and cheese! Yum! Can't wait until I go back to Seattle to get this again.

OUTSTANDING!!! We almost were too full to make a stop here, ,but thank goodness we did! The food is outstanding, the service impeccable and the place is very clean. We ended up making two trips in two days...fantastic.
Yum yum yum, Salmon Pat Piroshky, yum yum yum..

This place is a definite try it no matter how full you are or no matter if you just ate five seconds ago. Try something here. Who doesn't like stuff wrapped in a light flaky dough. The smell of the place was what got me so enticed. The place is a tiny spot in one of the buildings of the market. The wife really liked this place at it reminded her of her grandmothers meat pies as a kid. So we only tried the one beef and onion, but we couldn't be happier. This thing was heavenly. Just one more bite was all I wanted and then when it was all gone, I almost ran back from the hotel to get another one. Will have to try another one before leaving town.
Delicious! Had the Salmon Piroshki.  So good.

How can you go wrong with fresh pastries? All the more if it's filled with BEEF & CHEESE???? It's impossible! You just can't go wrong!So, we waited in a long line that cleared out fast and the whole time, my mouth was watering looking at their pastries and trying to decide what to get. We tried the Apple Cinnamon Roll, Beef & Cheese, Chocolate Hazelnut roll, and their Potato Mushroom & Onion. Out of the 4, the beef and cheese was the best, BUT everything else was good. It's places like these that make me want to have a second stomach. Mark my words, I WILL BE BACK HERE...and will write love letters to you in the meantime while looking at a picture I took of you, oh Beef & Cheese Piroshky!

I dropped by my first afternoon in Seattle and the line was so long, I said, hmm, maybe later...But the smell was so good I found myself walking there in the rain the next morning to just catch a whiff of the baked goods. I was lucky, there is no long line in the morning and I got a wonderful apple cinnamon piroshky. The next day, I got the egg, cheese and spinach.It was a wonderful way to pack such great flavors into such a little pastry! Just remembering the taste makes me miss this place!!
Well, as a few reviews have already said before this one, everything that has to be said about this place has already been said. Freakin' amazing.

I think one reason why I love visiting Seattle is because of Piroshky Piroshky. This hole in the wall bakery attracts many tourists not only because you can watch them make these delicious treats, they are indeed melt in your mouth sinful! The Salmon Pate' piroshky is to die for! I can't name them all but most of what I've tried are awesome. Beware of the sometimes long line but it moves fairly quickly. This is a MUST visit when you go to Seattle.
Get the salmon filled one. Incredible.
salmon piroshky..SO DELICIOUS~!

This place is really unique. Pike's Place itself is an experience, but you never know if tourist spots will have good food. Piroshky's perogies are delish. The line is worth waiting in and moves fast. A perogie is a Russian pie. I had the salmon pate and dill perogie. It was piping hot and flaky, buttery soft. I would order these to have in Texas! For dessert I had an apple cinnamon made with green apples. It was full of big chunks of delicious fresh, apple. It was an affordable lunch for just about $8. Be prepared to eat standing up, unless you can find a bench somewhere around the shops.
Good, my favorite snacking spot in Pikes
I had a piroshky and it was GOOD. I even walked around the marketplace with it.
Light, Fluffy, Crispy, Fresh... DELICIOUS!!!
This makes me want to become Russian...
i could eat these every day.

The piroshkis here are the best I've ever had. They're fresh baked and come out warm and doughy. There are a lot of flavors to choose from. I was here on business and wish there was one back in California so I could go every day!

We NEVER go to the Market without stopping at Piroshky. It doesn't matter what you get, it's all good. My fave is the apple-cranberry.There's a reason why there's always a line out the door. Check it out. You won't be disappointed.
I am in love with you. I like to eat you. You are delicious. Fill me with your goodness.

theres a reason why people love these local of places of lore. the kind of places that have been made famous by their history, simplicity and loyalty to a product that is distinctly local in flavor. despite the fact that they have been washed over by waves and waves of tourists, these places are still able to maintain their sense of indivuduality by marketing to a uniquely regional appeal. when i first moved to seattle i went looking for that regional treat. that one comfort food that cannot be replicated anywhere else (read: philly cheesesteaks at geno's, wings at buffalo's anchor bar, bens chili bowl in dc). i and many others would believe that that place can be found at piroshky piroshky.purists can talk all they want about how close to the original recipe they may be, what resonates with these delicious russian treats is a taste of home, even if it isnt orignally yours. piroshky piroshky is a cheap, delicious treat that maks any day in the market all the more rewarding. for four dollars (5 with a cup of coffee) grab a warm, flaky, salty and fulfilling meat and cheese pastry and enjoy it at steinbrueck park while you watch the boats float in. nothing could be better on a lazy morning.
This place is Great! Always a line, but it moves very quickly. Delicious!

The food looked great, but it was just okay. The bread cost $5 extra and tasted like a metal frying pan, which was disappointing. The waiter spent more time outside and ignored us, but the location near Pike was beautiful.
great menu recommendations and kept smiling and giving great service even when we knocked a beverage all over the floor.
Jose he provides excellent customer serviceHe knows peoples needs in the restaurant a greatEmployee to keep employedEsperanza and Ricardo 206 799 7913

The restaurant had a nice vibe, and the staff was attentive. The pizza tasted delicious! The sauce on the pasta was flavorful, but the noodles were mushy. The fries were crisp and tender, yet overly salty. The patty in the burger was overdone: cooked medium instead of rare.
Excellent drinks and burgers with outstanding service by Katya and Anastasia! outstanding service by Katya and Anastasia! Would definitely recommend when you are in the area!
We ordered the bread with burrata, sourdough pasta with pulled pork, sliced fig pizza, buffalo wings, and...

Went to get drinks and food before a show. After waiting over 30min for our food, we asked explaining we had to leave soon. We were told it would be out shortly. After another 15 minutes passed, no food and we had to leave.They offered to comp us for the food, etc, but doesn't really make up for the lack of dinner and the long wait.On the upside, the drinks were good and arrived in a timely manner.

I told the male waitress that my drink was not right, and he mentioned that it was done right. He didn't check it out. French fries were cold with hot fish on. Most likely, I will not come.back. All (4) our mix drink was just heavy in scentric taste..
Food was not good at all. Drinks were great. I'll only come here for drinks. I was very disappointed on the food.

I don't want to write the review . This place should be my little secret but I also need to share and tell all what a great dining experience I had.Food was delicious, hands down, some of the best I've had and even better on the second visit.If you are coming to eat here Oh man, one order is not enough.

This place got spontaneously great service. It's chicken was fantastic and tasty too. It's veggies were outstanding as well. But honestly, the place was not so appealing and I think they can make their place more beautiful next time and I'm looking forward to it.

Muh. We were not too impressed with vons. I had not been for years, since they left their former location. The service was OK, the food was OK, lots of kids and crying babies which we thought was weird for a Sunday night. Overall seems not as fun as the old bar a little bit too corporate.
The way I would describe my visit is that it was a good overall experience. The service was great and the food was very good.

It was my first time here and it won't be my last either. Will return for other dishes. The service was good and friendly. We ordered Basil Almond Pesto Pasta and Original Mac and 4 Cheeses which were quit delicious. Next time will be back to try the pizza.

It is my first time here at Von's. I like the delicious pasta. I also tried the pizza which was flatbread and it was very good. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable. Will be back if I am in the area again.
Delicious food and good portion sizes! Really enjoyed the variety of in-house made pasta. Place tends to get a bit crowded especially in the evenings, so make sure you get some reservations.

Recently came here with a coworker for happy hour. I got the cuban sandwich and he got the fried chicken sammy. The happy hour drinks were incredible, I had mostly lemon drops as they were the special on the wheel and my friend had an smoky old fashioned. We shared a plate of nachoes as well that were incredible. The ambience was loud and fast paced as the place appears to be very popular which is the only downside, it's not quiet or a place to have a conversation.
Drinks are good but a bit on the expensive side. We like the overall vibe. Place could be a bit cleaner but overall a good experience.

The service was quick, super friendly, and tasty! The restaurant is located in a convenient area with cool spots worth checking nearby, depending on the time of day. The eggplant hummus is an absolute must! I had the vegan pasta and my friend had a cheesy chicken pasta. I can't wait to come back!

My girls and I traveled to Seattle and were on the search for a great happy hour place with good drinks. Vons did not disappoint. I started with the smoked cherry Manhattan and the salmon chowder. The flavor of the salmon chowder was awesome I thoroughly enjoyed it. The bacon chunks caught me by surprise but overall still a great meal. The cherry Manhattan was a bit too sweet for my liking but luckily for me the Monday special was traditional manhattans, so of course I indulged. The traditional manhattan was a crowd favorite and made with love. Highly recommend this place for drinks, ambience, and food. The service was also excellent.

A bit of a tourist spot, but the service was prompt and the food did not disappoint.They offer a menu with some interesting sounding cocktails and have an extensive amount of spirits promptly displayed as well.

Had a fantastic early dinner date at Von's! The sourdough pasta was a flavor explosion - so good! The service was top-notch, and the staff was super friendly. Couldn't resist eyeing the burger, it looked amazing. And let's talk about the Huckleberry Gin drink - a total game-changer, super tasty! My friend's date went for the pork fries and pasta and had a thumbs up experience too. All in all, a great time. Definitely marking this spot for a repeat visit!

My experience at this restaurant left me quite disappointed last night, particularly when it came to the drinks. I had high hopes when I ordered a specialty drink from their menu, with a simple request to substitute Bar Boss vodka for Grey Goose. However, the waiter's response left me baffled as he kept mentioning he would "add on" to the drink. Confused but willing to trust his expertise, I let it slide.When our drinks finally arrived, I couldn't help but feel like I was sipping on colored water. It seemed like my custom concoction had gone awry. My husband, who ordered his usual Hendricks gin and tonic, was met with a diluted disappointment. We're no strangers to this drink, and this one was exceptionally watered down. In summary, I would advise you to bypass the drinks altogether at this establishment. While the cocktails may leave much to be desired, the food is an entirely different story. We had the "bang bang chicken" and a serving of shredded pork fries, both bursting with flavor. If you're dining here, save your money for the delectable dishes and opt for tap beers or bottled drinks if you're in the mood. Skip the bartender's experiments
5th time at this restaurant, always they're very friendly and cooperative. Burgers, services and ambiance everything were very good. Price was very reasonable.

$26 Quatre Viande (4 Meat) Pizza....Torrid Wurst, soppressata, lardons, pepperoni, whole milk mozzarella, grated parm...its basically their meat lovers pizza, and we did indeed LOVE it! Von's claim to fame is their unique sourdough crust, which adds extra flavor and creativity to an already fantastic pizza! Where else are you gonna find a sourdough pizza? Its shareable for two people, but I was really really hungry I could've eaten the entire thing cause I'm a fatty!
Food is good, however it's overpriced, crowded and noisy. Not a relaxing atmosphere to me
Food was good. large enough to fit a party of eight, but not restaurant seating style. Would have been nice to sit outside or have a view. but overall service was good and food was good.
Little pricey but great macaroni and cheese

Delicious sourdough pastas and flatbread pizzas. The drinks are also fabulous. Pictured here is a delicious plant eggplant, sun dried tomato and kalamata olive pasta. Amazing! Sit at the bar on a Saturday afternoon and tell wonderful Bartender Jess I sent you!

Good food, drinks, and ambience. Great service.Went here for dinner as a group of 4 people. Even for a Friday night 9pm, the wait was minimal (5mins) which was a pleasant surprise considering this is a popular place. They have plenty of indoor and outdoor seating available.Ordered 6 plates of 4 different types of food items: burrata, hummus, bang bang chicken, chicken wings. The food was quite good. Nothing to die for, but good. Chicken wings could have been better. The drinks were fine as well. Some of them have additional presentation added like a mini firecracker (picture attached).Service was fantastic. With 6 food plates shared in 4 people, and 2-3 drinks per person, the total cost price was $70 per person (including tips taxes).
Love love love their salad with Salmon added. It's my go to when I'm in town for work.
Really good food and service was friendly.
Great food, music and vibe. Was in town on a work trip and Von's was a great, casual place to go for happy hour and dinner after a long workday. Loved their homemade pastas!

The ambience was chill. The staff were amazing and also the food was beautifully made. My friends and I really enjoyed the service there and would tell anyone to come dine here. What is simply amazing is that the place offers an opportunity to choose from a variety of dishes and desserts. What is more is that the establishment has a dancing arena. This is just cool. I recall how beautiful it was enjoying our meals and watching people dance to some good slow music. From my experience I feel that the place not only feeds the body but it also feeds the heart. Coming from the place I felt so elated and relaxed, I am surely looking forward to coming back to this place and bring more of my friends to live the experience.

Continuously an extraordinary time in here, the smell of their dishes simply lifts my disposition up. On the off chance that it were in my grasp I would simply stay here the entire day and direct my entire kind of work from here while making the most of my #1 bites. All comfortable in here .

I haven't been to the new location until very recently. I do miss the quirkiness of the previous place; however I think this location is awesome. They are doing such a wonderful job with the restrictions of COVID. Great drink selection as I remember and great food!Thanks!
As of the end of September, their happy hour is a great deal. The food portions are large and the drink specials wheel they spin is a cool idea. The house in Manhattan is terrible btw.
I enjoyed myself here, the foods drinks and staff are all great, Thank you Von's 1000 Spirits for your wonderful service!

Very very busy place. The food was AMAZING the drinks were AMAZING. Service was a little bit slow (because the place seems to be always packed) we really liked the food and drinks there but decided to leave after one drink because we couldn't stand how crowded it was

Great quality food and friendly staff, they carded my mom even though shes 62 and she didnt have it so they wouldn't serve her. I understand the laws but i have to say she felt embarrased to be carded at her age.
Great collection of foods including homemade pasta. Good selection of brews and cocktails. Good place for small groups and fun!!
Great food - minor mistake on the order but they made it right and covered the meal.

Our party of 2 made reservations for noon - but it was 12:30pm before we actually arrived at the restaurant as a result of a meeting delay. They seated us with no issues despite our delay. We each had a house salad and split a pizza - excellent lunch overall. I recommend going and making reservations as we were seated in a quieter area in the back which was better for lunch conversation.
Good service & helpful staff. Good food!

I used ton't venture too much into the menu because the first hamburger got my eye instantly! The Classic burger was awesome! Trying to be somewhat "wholesome" I asked for no bun and they set it over a fresh green salad...which was AMAZING! I tasted a few of the chips which were some of the finest I Have had in awhile. I saw lots of the pizza's coming out and while dining with my father we understood we should have mixed it up a bit and not gotten the same thing! Rave reviews were being discussed at the tables around us. Really excited about this new place! They make an excellent martini and it only has an excellent vibe!!
Tasty food and a huge drink menu.
The crab cake burger was delicious!
A great place to have a drink Service was good, would go back.
I liked the atmosphere. I liked their service. Food was rather excellent. I would definitely recommend to a burger enthusiast. A little too greasy, but that's it. Come on down, it's good!
Krystle was awesome! Plus a fantastic happy hour. Thanks for the great suggestions. Loving the new local spot.
Really tasty burger & delicious fries! We stopped in for lunch on a blustery day & this spot worked out great. Coba was a terrific server.

They really have like 1000 bottles of spirits. Happened to came here by happy hour, which is from 3 to 6 i reckon and the place is packed, but not too noisy. I tried the mango champagne magarita, which is lovely and refreshing with nice touch of tajin. Burger was so good with huge and juicy beef patties, brown sugar bacon and I love the sourdough brioche.

I had a fantastic time at Von's 1000 Spirits! The atmosphere is great, and the food is incredible. We tried a few different dishes, and everything was bursting with flavor. I love the variety of unique menu options they have, and the craft cocktails were on point.The staff was super welcoming and gave excellent recommendations.

Went there for a quick bite and beers. I got to say it exceeded my expectations by far. Delicious wings. Flavorful Crispy Bang Bang Chicken. And Mouthwatering Confit Fries. Delicious IPA selection. Highly recommended.

I stopped by Von's 1000 Spirits on a whim and decided to try their Seattle Classic Burger, and wow--it did not disappoint!The burger was everything you could hope for in a classic yet elevated experience. The patty was cooked to perfection--juicy, flavorful, and with a slight char that added a smoky depth. The sourdough bun (a signature at Von's) was soft yet sturdy, with a subtle tang that complemented the burger perfectly. The toppings were fresh and well-balanced: crisp lettuce, ripe tomato, melty cheese, and just the right amount of their house-made sauce.I also appreciated the side of hand-cut fries, which were crispy on the outside and fluffy inside--just the way I like them. Paired with one of their craft cocktails, it was an absolutely satisfying meal.The atmosphere added to the experience: casual yet stylish, with great service and a lively vibe. Whether you're a Seattle local or just visiting, Von's 1000 Spirits is a must for a great burger and an unforgettable dining experience.

Jess is amazing! Made is the best cocktails. The En Fuego and the smoked oak and cherry Manhattan were amazing. The selection of spirts is impressive. The food was from scratch and delicious. Highly recommend, sit at the copper bar and ask for Jess!

My boyfriend and I arrived at Vons 1000 Spirits around 6:30 PM, hopeful for a spontaneous anniversary dinner despite having no reservation. Luck was on our side -- after a brief wait, we were seated near the back line and welcomed by our server, Chris R.The restaurant was bustling, but it was clear that this place operates like a well-oiled machine. The energy was lively, and the efficiency of the staff was remarkable.Chris greeted us promptly with a warm smile and immediately made us feel at ease. He expertly guided us through the menu, offering thoughtful recommendations that showcased the restaurant's best dishes in a way that was both helpful and approachable.We ordered: * Sparkling Water * Brain Booster Mocktail * Hefeweizen Beer * Bang Bang Chicken (a playful nod to where we first met -- a place called Bang Bang) * Alfredo Chicken Sourdough Pasta * Roasted Mushroom Sourdough Pizza (served with hot honey on the side, per Chris's suggestion -- a brilliant recommendation)Every single item was incredible. The flavors were balanced, the quality was superb, and each dish left us wanting just one more bite.From start to finish, the service was top-notch. We even noticed a busser nearby who cleaned a four-top table with such impressive speed and precision, it seemed almost superhuman.Thank you, Chris, and the entire Vons 1000 Spirits team for a refreshing, memorable, and delicious dining experience.We will definitely be back! :)
Food and service was wonderful! Bit of a wait for a table, but well worth it! Loved Chris R. By far was my favorite part of my experience here! AL girl

This place is absolutely amazing! The ambiance is vibrant, the service was top-notch, and the food hit all the right notes. We tried the Bang Bang Chicken, the Double Smash Burger, and the mac and cheese--everything was delicious, but that chicken sauce was next-level. The burger was a standout too, with the soft, melt-in-your-mouth bread elevating the whole experience.As for drinks, the selection is insane--literally thousands of options! I think the bartender mentioned they have over 2,000 bottles behind the bar. I went with the pineapple old-fashioned, and it was perfectly crafted and absolutely hit the spot. Great food, great drinks, great vibes--definitely a must-visit!
Ron was our server and the service was amazing! Friendly, very quick and checking on us often. We were sat in the very back but our service was the best it's ever been.
Pretty awesome place for great food and great service. I would highly recommend scheduling some time to visit this place.

Von's 1000 Spirits is an absolute gem in Seattle! The handmade noodles and pizza are out of this world-so fresh and packed with flavor. You can tell they put real care into crafting each dish. The cocktails are a must-try as well; they're unique, perfectly balanced, and truly worth every sip. The service here is exceptional, with a friendly and attentive staff that makes the whole experience even better. The ambiance is very cozy, with lots of personality. They have so many different types of alcohol to look at (hence the name lol), and pieces of art on the wall. Whether you're a local or just visiting, I highly recommend stopping by Von's for a memorable meal and drinks!
Our bartender Richie was awesome! Great knowledge on all the spirits and very friendly and cool!

Vons is definitely for pasta lovers, offering an impressive selection of delicious dishes. The pasta is cooked perfectly, with a variety of sauces that cater to every palate.The drink menu complements the food beautifully, featuring both classic and creative cocktails that elevate the dining experience.What truly stood out was the service. Chris R. was exceptional--attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable. His recommendations were spot-on, and he made sure our experience was seamless and enjoyable.Highly recommended!

Katya- I recently had the pleasure of being served by an exceptional server who went above and beyond to ensure we had an amazing dining experience. From the moment we were seated, they were incredibly friendly, making us feel welcomed and comfortable. They were not only knowledgeable about the menu, offering helpful recommendations based on our preferences, but also patient and attentive to our questions. What stood out the most was how effortlessly they interacted with both locals and tourists, offering insights and tips about the area that were much appreciated. Their warm demeanor and outstanding service truly enhanced our experience, making the meal one to remember. I highly recommend dining here and hope you're lucky enough to have this server take care of you!Pedro is a hardworking and friendly busser during my visit. Throughout the entire meal, they were constantly moving, ensuring that tables were cleaned quickly and efficiently. Despite the busy environment, they always had a smile on their face and were genuinely friendly with both customers and staff. Their positive attitude and work ethic did not go unnoticed, making the dining experience even more enjoyable. It's clear they take pride in their work, and their efforts made a great impression!

Vons 1000 Spirits is a standout destination for anyone looking to enjoy a unique dining and drinking experience. The ambiance strikes a perfect balance between casual and upscale, making it ideal for both a laid-back evening and a special occasion.The cocktail menu is particularly impressive, featuring a creative selection of craft cocktails that highlight quality ingredients and innovative techniques. Each drink is beautifully presented and bursting with flavor, showcasing the mixologists' expertise.The food is equally remarkable, with a menu that offers a diverse range of options. From small plates to hearty entrees, each dish is thoughtfully prepared and beautifully plated. The emphasis on fresh, local ingredients shines through, making every bite a delight.The service is attentive and friendly, adding to the overall inviting atmosphere. Whether you're seated at the bar or a cozy table, the staff is knowledgeable about the menu and eager to make recommendations.Overall, Vons 1000 Spirits is a must-visit for anyone in the area. It's a place where great food and exceptional drinks come together, ensuring a memorable dining experience. Highly recommended!

Great place for lunch in downtown! Food and service were great. I had the salmon Cesar salad and my friend had the fish tacos. Everything tasted great. Fries and Guava Mule mocktail were also delicious. Would come back to try their homemade sourdough pasta or pizza for sure.
Out of 10 I'd rate this place a 9.6. It is phenomenal food and really great cocktails as well. The burgers are good but the pasta is better especially the Gouda pasta. Would highly recommend.
Christian was great, he was very helpful and made our experience incredible! The food was delicious and happy hour has some great deals.
Excellent meal, service was the best I've had in years! Christian was amazing and would love to come back to see him.

First of all - all of the food was amazing. Our group had the Mac & cheese, hummus, pizza, sandwiches, and more. Nothing was underwhelming. Our server Christian was great - he answered all of our questions and was able to make great recommendations.
Excellent food, great menu, fine service. What a find!  Christian provided great service.

I got to chill out on the patio while there was live music playing on the piers, so it was a pretty sweet setup. Our server was on the ball and answered all our questions. I went for the steak and garlic cheese fries. The steak was on point, but the fries were a bit too greasy for my liking--I couldn't finish them.I'm glad I made reservations, even for a late dinner midweek, because this place fills up super fast. I definitely want to come back and try more items from their menu. Though there weren't a ton of choices, but based on what I had, I'd say all their veg options are top-notch.Skip driving and just grab a cab. Parking around Pike Place is always a nightmare.
Great food, service, atmosphere, and location. The pieces are also fair. The "damn good wings" are my favorite item on the menu.

Von's 1000 Spirits in downtown Seattle is a must-visit! Their hamburgers are nothing short of awesome, packed with flavor and cooked to perfection. The pasta offerings are equally impressive, satisfying any craving you might have. The Staff will guide you to pick something perfect for you! But what truly sets Von's apart is their massive liquor selection. With 1,000 spirits to choose from, there's something for everyone. Whether you're a whiskey connoisseur or a cocktail lover, you'll find plenty to enjoy. The vibe is lively and welcoming, making it the perfect spot for a great meal and a fantastic drink. Highly recommend!

Great place to come for any occasion! The place itself is beautiful and the drinks were awesome. Wonderful service by the server who made sure we were comfortable throughout the meal. I had the Walla Walla burger that was delicious, but the pasta is absolutely to die for! We will be visiting here again soon!
food and service was fantastic!! Really enjoyed the pizza and the fish and chips. Joe was great.
We had excellent food, drinks and service at Vons! Shoutout to our server Christian who went above and beyond with service and our meal and drink requests! We'll be back!

Von's 1000 Spirits offers a delightful dining experience with its house-made specialties and welcoming atmosphere. The Original Mac & 4 Cheeses is a standout dish, featuring sourdough pasta made in-house, a creamy and amazing cheese sauce, and perfectly complementary breadcrumbs on top--definitely a must-try. The Quatre Viande Pizza boasts an excellent dough with a crunchy yet soft crust and savory toppings balanced by a subtly sweet tomato sauce. The Hass Avocado & Billionaire's Bacon burger is another winner, with juicy beef, flavorful bacon, and avocado that ties everything together perfectly. The Seattle Seafood Stew has a comforting tomato flavor, with flakey cod, well-cooked clams, and fluffy focaccia for dipping, though the stew's overall flavor is somewhat muted. For dessert, the Vanilla Ice Cream, served with a huge sparkler for my birthday, was fresh with a noticeable vanilla bean taste, though a bit icy in texture which I personally enjoyed.The interior is dimly lit and cozy, creating a warm atmosphere. It gets packed around dinnertime, which is a good sign because it means the food is good! The service was generally good despite the busy environment; the wait time was shorter than expected, and the staff was friendly and helpful, even if the waitress couldn't check in as often as desired. Overall, Von's 1000 Spirits provides a great dining experience with its delicious food and friendly service.
Ella was the hostess when we visited and she was amazing and so friendly! she accommo our large group with a smile!

This place is awesome, from service to food it for sure hit all the marks. Firstly our server Spencer was perfect he was so kind and funny really made our night special. The wings were tangy but not too spicy and the fries are delicious. The burger and the seafood pasta also hit the nail on the head. I had the pineapple old fashion and my girlfriend had a tequila guava cocktail of some sort we both really enjoyed those as well. We will be back for sure!
Woodinville. Sara E. is the best bartender in Seattle! Great cocktails and superb desserts.
We loved the food, drinks, atmosphere and staff. Everything was great! Will be back!!!!

Finally tried the Malaysian restaurant every Seattleite talks about, a bit disappointed. Wish I tried their original location. Most of their dishes were too salty. My favorite was the nasi lemak, had the right texture, balance in flavor, and nice plating. Would skip the pineapple and cucumber salad, mine had mainly pineapple and just tastes like tajin and fish sauce, can simple make at home. The fried chicken wings were dry and simple, would pass on that as well. Food portions were small for the price.Staff were friendly, checked up on us often and gave good recommendations. Their reservation system was convenient. Decorations were pretty and welcoming. A nice spot to take friends to.

Very busy, but we were able to sit at the bar. Great assortment of cocktails. The pizza looked delicious. We had a slice of the carrot cake. We would go back to try the pizza and a few other cocktails.

The fish tacos are crispy and tangy with the Jalapeos on top for a little spicy touch. Seafood stew has chunks of fish and clams with the tomato base soup. Dip the sourdough toast in there makes it a hearty meal.
Victoria was an amazing server! Very attentive and helpful. I'm from out of state and she made me feel very welcomed. If I lived here I'd be back!
Victoria was awesome sauce! super friendly and helpful! She managed our wild and crazy table with ease! The food was amazing too!
Ask Erick for the Monte Abernath. Mind blowing good take on an old fashioned!Food, also bomb!
Jason and Erick are awesome! I would notcome here if it wasn't for them. Honestly, they are the best bartenders I've ever encountered. Their service and drinks are top notch!
Thank you Mike. The service was amazing. The price was excellent. Very highly recommend thank you
Awesome food! Good service and large amounts of food. Would definitely recommend this place!!!
Place is great my son goes there , they're really dedicated with every aspect, all of the stuff is really dedicated
Kamryn was such a great server and gave us such phenomenal recommendation, highly recommended her to be your server
Delish I love this place I wish I had more room everything is perfect I really like it

Super delicious and excellent dishes! They have lots of options and everything has fantastic quality of food. The Classic Pepperoni Pizza has pleasant flavor and lots of toppings. The dough was great and well-baked. The pasta was one of the best too. Its so creamy taste so fresh. So many food options. The prices were amazing too.They have nice place and location. The staff were very welcoming. Perfect spot for any special occasions.
The best flatbread in seattle,The pasta is great too the deadly shot is a must try Great experience in overall
Jess is amazing and makes every day that I make it in better. Please give Jess ALL the stars. please & for real.
Amazing pasta and unique drink selection makes this a fun stop whenever we're downtown!

The King Salmon pasta is hands down the best food I've eaten in a long time. Each bite makes you say "mhmm" and melt into your chair a little more. The apple strudel for dessert makes my mouth water just remembering it. The quality of the food here is excellent!

Came in for a late night bite and were thrilled with the service, ambiance and food! Cody made fabulous menu recommendations for pizza and pasta -- stuffed full and happy as can be, we will absolutely be back. Thanks for the 5 star service Cody!

Let me tell you about the incredible bartending duo of Taylor and Erick at Vons 1000 Spirits - these two are like the dynamic duo of mixology, with a side of comedy! I mean, I've seen some impressive bartenders in my time, but these two take the cake (or should I say, the cocktail)!First off, let's talk about the happy hour - it was like a magical potion of joy and discounted drinks. I don't know how they do it, but Taylor and Erick managed to turn an ordinary evening into a fabulous fiesta! And the drinks? Oh boy, they were so tasty that I almost wanted to order one of each just to taste the rainbow of flavors. I'm pretty sure they secretly sprinkle a little bit of unicorn dust in every glass.Now, let's not forget the atmosphere - it was as lively as a pack of party animals on a Friday night! I don't know if it was Taylor and Erick's magnetic personalities or just the fact that they make drinks that are pure liquid happiness, but the place was buzzing with good vibes.Overall, my experience with Taylor and Erick at Vons 1000 Spirits was nothing short of amazing. They're like the Batman and Robin of bartending - except instead of fighting crime, they're fighting sobriety! If you want a good time, tasty drinks, and an atmosphere that feels like a non-stop party, look no further than these two maestros of mixology. Cheers to Taylor and Erick - you both were absolutely fabulous!!

Love this place, especially their remarkable sourdough pasta! The shape is cute! It's their homemade pasta. It's chewy and irresistible, yum We ordered pesto flavor, the sauce is soooo good! Rich but not too greasy.
Went with my friends here, very cozy place, nice place to enjoy with friends and even family....love the cocktails :)
Richie was a great server, and great food! He made sure that my food did not have any nuts or tree nuts which was very helpful.
WOOOOOW my wife and I loved this place. My kids had lots of pizza and pasta. Really great we had a great time. The servers were very nice to us too. Super recommend the place.
Good food and drink selection. Our server Traci was exceptional and had good recommendations. The place also had a great vibe.

I went with my kids and some friends and ordered a lot of things. It was fast, delicious and totally kids friendly.the servers were really nice as well.I can't wait to come back! Always one of my favorites places to go when I visit Seattle.
Taylor made a wonderful Manhattan and Jose was incredibly helpful. Thanks to both. Good memories for my birthday weekend.
We loved Ron! Great service!                        :)
My family and I came in for a burger and Nicole was great - she was so kind. Great service!

Always love the service and food. Our servers, Eli and Benjamin L. extended excellent service. They took the time to explain menu items and promptly provided everything we needed to enjoy our meal. Cheerful service from entire staff. We keep coming back and bring new customers with us!
I was in a few weeks ago Taylor was our bartender. She made me the BEST espresso Martini and made the entire experience amazing! Thank you Taylor! And for your tips around this beautiful city
The food was came quick and was very delicious. Very impressed by the overall service particularly from Taylor behind the bar who mixes a delicious cocktails.

Had such a great time here, Nate was the best server and Katie was such a good bartender. The atmosphere was amazing and everyone was so sweet and welcoming. And the food was amazing. I would come back a million times!!

Nate was super attentive and on top of everything! Made sure we weren't out of a glass and kept checking in. Also Katy served our cute drinks and was super sweet and patient with us trying to get our picture :)
Quick Service, excellent food, large portions, attentive and friendly wait staff, especially our waiter Nate.
great food and great ambiance our server Chris was so great my friend and I loved him! 10/10 would recommend!

I had an outstanding experience with my server Brittany! She was attentive, polite, and knowledgeable about the menu. Brittany's service was prompt, and went above and beyond to ensure my dining experience was exceptional. The pesto Pizza is an amazing choice if you're looking for something without meat. Great selection of beer and every selection of spirit you could imagine. Also recommend the sourdough pasta
Carnitas pizza and pork confit fries are my favorite, have been to both of the locations many times. always great atmosphere, Ainura always friendly and efficient.

We had Taylor as our bartender this Friday. She made us the best espresso martinis and gave us great suggestions for our stay in the city.  When you stop here, make sure to be served by taylor! Will def be coming back

Nicole was our server tonight and dinner was phenomenal!! They introduced us to the Agua de Jamaica mocktail and it was awesome!! Wouldn't have ordered it without that recommendation and I'll get it again next time! I love this place, favorite restaurant ever!!!
Food's amazing -Danielle suggested this meal with added goat cheese it was perfect! Sara served excellent mules . I can wait to go back for more
Everything was as classic as the location. Excellent chowder, to die for King Salmon salad and taste manhattans. Our servir Traci was also attentive and timely. Great time!
absolutely love Vons. make sure you ask to be sat with Taylor m when you come she has the best recommendationa of all the times I've been here. great drinks and better food
good food and service. thank you Becca Formela for taking good car of us vacationers.
Yummm! I love this place! Great food, strong drinks, and amazing servers like Taylor Mulhern!

We had the best time here! The drinks were top tier and we absolutely loved our server Taylor Mulhern. She was so knowledgeable and gave us great recommendations for our Seattle trip. I'd give them 6 stars if I could
Food was good and service was great from Taylor. I will recommend my friends to eat here.

I stopped by this week and had the most pleasant experience. Food was tasty and service was phenomenal! Taylor made my day!!! She helped me pick out an incredible pasta and a mind blowing drink! Just amazing!! Service is fantastic.

I was in Seattle for a business trip last week and I have been to Von's before, and because is so tasty I always return, I love their prosciutto and arugula pizza. I was very pleased to have Ainura serve me again, she was my waitress a few years back, went above and beyond to meet my needs. It was a great experience overall, great place and great vibe. Will definitely return whenever I can!

I don't normally write reviews, but this place is amazing! The food is unique and so so delicious! Drinks are even better. Thanks to our server Taylor and her recommendations, we thoroughly enjoyed our meal and have come back several times! The champagne mango margarita is my go to every time now! I also enjoy their appetizers (specifically the pork fries) and the pastas!! Wow! Thank you so much Taylor! We will see you again soon

The service was amazing, our server knew what to recommend and everything tasted so good. Taylor was very attentive and such an awesome server! This is a place that I will visit again, when I'm back in Seattle! I had the Pork fries and the Meatballs and the appetizers and the entree was the King Samon . So good fullOf flavor.

I came into vons with my girlfriends a few nights back, the food was stupid good and our waitress Rebecca was awesome. Knew all the right things to get and we were sooo full after. A bit speedy but you get a lot for what you pay for.

I came into vons a few days ago and our server was Rebecca. She was so amazing and everything she suggested was absolute fire! I gained 10lbs in one sitting but it was totally worth it. All the pastas looked so good and the pizzas are huge!

Wonderful way to spend our last night in Seattle! Loved the location! Dinner was excellent and everything was made even better by the service we received. Thank you Rebecca!!!! Hope you're still there when we return!
Amazing Service and food ... I'm very impressed! It's a wonderful place to bring friends, family and work associates to enjoy a great night out together.
Food and atmosphere were off the charts!  Our waitress Rebecca was awesome!  Highly recommend this place. Ask to sit in Rebecca's section great service.

Fantastic location, fantastic service. Our daughter recently relocated to Seattle and this restaurant was at the top of our list. Our waitress Rebecca was friendly, a lot of fun and took great care of our party. Will be back.

Stopped in for a quick drink before going on in the night. Our server Rebecca Pointed us to the Spicy Fennel Meatballs to have as a quick bite! We came here after a Seahawks game. It was crazy busy. The first server we had was ok but Nate took over and he was amazing! Super engaging with everyone. The food and drinks were good but the service was beyond expectation.

Just took a cruise and stayed in Seattle for an extra couple of days. VONS is a cool place to go after hanging out in Pikes Place. The burgers are great (a little pricey tho) The atmosphere is great and I love the spinning wheel for drink specials! I am not going to knock the slower service, because it was packed, but they should have more people on.

I love coming here. I always bring guests from out of town here whenever we are in the area. The food is always good and the drinks are really unique. The bar area is really cool with all the drinks along the wall. Really great. The service is outstanding. The food was out in a timely manner and she was great at checking to see how everything was.
Adam was an amazing server in an amazing restaurant. highly recommend. food was excellent
I love the Cuban here! That is a given. but honestly, service is everything and Taylor is awesome.
Ainura was one of the best servers I've ever had! She paid a lot of attention to detail and really made an effort to make sure I was enjoying my time!! Love Ainura and will come back just for her
300/10 our waiter was so amazing and friendly. The outdoor seating gave way to some amazing views and the drinks were perfect!
Food was excellent, service at the bar was Great and server very attentive. Will definitely return next time I am in the area
Fresh, fresh, fresh! Amazing diversity of menu with all made fresh daily ingredients. Great service. Very reasonable pricing. Friendly bartenders with wide variety of drinks. Left happy!

Von's is seriously so good. Everything I have ever tried on the menu has been delicious. For me, the king salmon pasta dish is my favorite, it's really one of my favorite pasta dishes I've had in Seattle. The sourdough pasta is very tasty and has a nice texture as well. Drinks, veggies, seafood, pizzas, and meats are all fantastic here. This is a great place for locals as well as tourists. It's not exactly a cheap meal but it's so worth it and service has always been very good.
Great food, great service and very accomadating
food was great good lighting good sevice
Great food. Great service. Great Atmosphere
Yesterday, I had the most incredible dining experience at this restaurant. The food was incredibly tasty, and the service was amazing. I can't wait to go back! Highly recommended!
It's one of our go-to places. Its also one of the most consistent restaurants. Love their pizzas and cocktails.
