Food was amazing always had drinks, really nice interior. First place I ate at in Seattle and it did not disappoint.
The food is delicious and the service was amazing! Kinsey was great! Highly recommend!!

During our week-long business trip in Seattle, we had an incredible culinary and leisure experience. It was undoubtedly the pinnacle of our trip! We were promptly seated at the bar and received prompt service. The drinks offered were not only imaginative but also incredibly tasty. Our food arrived with impressive speed. The bartender was exceptionally friendly and provided excellent recommendations for local attractions. Moreover, the other patrons in the bar were also warm and welcoming. The overall ambiance was delightful, delicious, and enjoyable. If I ever find myself in Seattle again, this will undoubtedly be my top destination!
This was not my only visit I've been wanting to try out this restaurant for about 6 months and I'm sure there will be plenty more visits

Von's 1000 Spirits is a hidden gem when it comes to unique drinks and a vibrant atmosphere. From the moment you step inside, you can feel the energy and excitement buzzing in the air. The extensive drink menu is a paradise for beverage enthusiasts, offering an impressive selection of creative concoctions that you won't find anywhere else.The mixologists at Von's 1000 Spirits are true artists, crafting drinks that are both visually stunning and bursting with distinct flavors. Whether you're a fan of classic cocktails or adventurous spirits, there's something for everyone to enjoy. From smoky and robust whiskies to refreshing and innovative blends, each sip takes your taste buds on a delightful journey.What sets Von's 1000 Spirits apart is not only the exceptional drinks but also the lively atmosphere. The place exudes a vibrant energy, with a crowd that's always buzzing and conversations flowing
Awesome restaurant, awesome staff, always a great time.
Taylor our server was great! Super quick and helpful. We will be back just to see her again!
I'm telling you right now people you can't go wrong at all with this restaurant the mushroom pizza is amazing. Patrick(the waiter) made us feel at home loved it
Great place ambience and staff were friendly.
I'm so satisfied with the food and also the good service. Great place ever!

I was in Seattle for a brief work trip and the hotel suggested Vons 1000 Spirits (which also happened to be about a block up the street~MAJOR PLUS). I came in just after checking into the hotel around lunch time and was surprised to find a full and bustling bar with the coolest kitchen and tons of cool stuff to look at everywhere! Josh, the host was warm and welcoming handed me menus and pointed me to the bar upon request. I was greeted with a warm friendly smile by Jess the bartender and a personal pitcher of nice cold water without first requesting. I was excited after reading the menu and asked Jess for some recommendations on a house cocktail and some lunch options. She suggested the old fashioned alternative they called "The Leatherbound," and after a lovely rundown of the menu I decided on the Tellicherry Chicken pasta dish, which came out in superhero time. I was blown away with BOTH my drink and my pasta dish. Sabrina, the other bartender, came over to check on me just after my food was delivered- there was absolutely nothing that could have made my lunch any closer to perfection. The atmosphere was rocking throughout the restaurant, everyone was smiling and the service was incredible! I unfortunately had to go off to a work meeting for the rest of the day followed by an early flight home in the morning so I couldn't experience more cocktails and what looks to be a fantastic menu. The only bad part was leaving this little treasure I had just discovered. Thank you for a wonderful, even if brief, experience. I wish there were more establishments just like this one!
Local bar, staff is super friendly and the wings are awesome. If you're looking for a sit down place downtown give them a try!

Straight forward, great service from Nick, our server. He was incredibly knowledgeable. Relaxed atmosphere, with a chill distillery vibe. Drinks and Every dish was super delicious! Would recommend any and everyone
Came in for dinner before the game and everything was amazing.Our server Rebecca was awesome. The Mac n cheese and patty melt are 10/10
Came in on New Years and Kinsey was the most amazing server! Very kind and on it! Classic
The food & drinks are great. Super delicious burgers, pizzas & appetizers. Had to visit this place twice during our visit
Wonderful Happy Hour! We were super happy when we left! Full plate apps! Great Bartender!
I'm a big pizza guy and this is fantastic pizza. Excellent service as well. Go early, there will be a wait.
Busy spot, service was great. We were served pretty quick. Every drink you can think of is available. Food pretty good.
Best such a great place been coming here since the othee location cabt go wrong.
BRANDON was awesome! He suggested the "SkinnyBitch" which was awesome and great service!!! Will be coming back
Delicious food and great staff with great service! The food 1-100 is a 1,000!! Will be back
Food and drinks were great. Skyler was very personable and helpful and conversational, and offered great recommendations.
Food is always delicious and service is great! Really appreciated Erick as our server!
Really cool place. Matt was awesome. The food was great and I tried a new appetizer called burrata. Cheese and bread. Super delicious.

Really nice place the staff is really helpful, I did not try the drinks lol but they look amazing as well, and the food is just delicious the first visit had to try the 4 meat sourdough pizza came back for a second visit to try their Cuban sandwich!
Very fun, would definitely go back. They have a great atmosphere and delicious food!
Matt is the bomb. can't wait to come back and visit him

both our servers, Josh and Becca were AMAZING! So very attentive and kind. Food, drinks and service top tier. Beautiful atmosphere. Josh made sure we always had new straws and napkins and everything we need!!! The food was delicious. presentation 10. Flavor 10. Adorable and fair pricing!
Go and you'll see. Amazing food there and very friendly staff. I can't describe the taste of the food because it's to good.
Everything is amazing! Of course, the pasta is our favorite. We would go here every night if we could. I highly recommend the cocktails as well. We are always seated quickly, even if it's very busy.
Great energy and atmosphere. Their food and bar offerings were all well executed
Holy cow! The Bolognese is as good as they said and the chicken pasta was to die for too. Open seating at the bar was easy even on the weekend or about a 20 minute wait for 2.

Friends chose this place to meet up and we are sure glad they did. Jess made the entire experience a great one with attention to detail, awesome sense of humor and excellent customer service.The Cuban is AMAZING and you cannot miss the salted Carmel warm apple yumminess at the end.We enjoyed it so much we will for sure be back....but only if Jess is working ;)

I just moved to Seattle from NYC and found Vons in my neighborhood. This place I'd amazing by itself because of their hospitality. However Erick and Chelsea makes this place such an amazing place to be especially for a Newyorker new to Seattle. They make me feel at home
My bf and i came here for appetizers and drinks, and we loved it. our waitress was Jordyn, she was super nice, very helpful, over all amazing customer service. 10/10 recommend, food was incredible.
Emma was great. She made my trip to Seattle more memorable. She remembered who I was after one visit.
Tasted great, recommend! Great service

This has been my favorite restaurant for a while now. I really like the place and the food is amazing. Lopita and Traci were very helpful and made our experience enjoyable, as long as Vons is open, I will always come back! :)

This was my first time visiting this restaurant and I was very pleased! Mikayla was very welcoming and energetic when she seated us. There were a few mishaps with a couple light bulbs breaking next to our table, but our waitress Traci was very understanding with our concerns. Great experience!

Our host Mikayla was amazing, kind and helpful. She led us straight to the table on the patio with thoughtful conversation. Our server Traci did such an amazing job. After some hiccups on the patio, she understood our concerns and was incredibly kind and accommodating for our needs. Our food was A+, will be back again. And will be asking for Traci.
First time here! Food was amazing and the staff was great! Our host Mikayla was super friendly and welcoming and our waiter, Traci was wonderful and personable. It all made for a lovely dinner.

I came here with my mom as I had simply saw it was the first thing that came up when I asked siri," What are the best food places in Seattle." Von's 1000 spirits was the first thing that came up and it didn't disappoint. The fresh pasta mixed with amazing seafood made for a stunning meal. My server David carried around rainbow pens and was super nice and funny. He would always serve us food with a smile on his face and make funny remarks while doing so. Not to mention the food came in about the blink of an eye. Definitely worth going to.
Went in for lunch today! Chad was our server he was great! Will be back! Food was delicious, so was Chad ;)
we had a wonderful time at vons for 21st birthday and TRACI brought us ice cream and a sparkle, she was amazing! will definitely be back. great food, great vibes!!
Pasta was fantastic. Drinks were great. Overall wonderful experience.
Traci was amazing, she kept checking up and making sure the food was great!
Excellent service David was a great server  and we really enjoyed our experience there.

Bomb food! Katie and Natalie were awesome and accommodating. Started with the pork confit fries and had to get another portion before entrees arrived. Traci was the best, you better hope you're in her section.
Erick was a great server. It was my sisters 21st birthday and he brought her ice cream and was very attentive. Would highly recommend this place.
If we could fly every weekend from Orange County to Seattle to eat here here we would . 5 stars over and over again

So glad I found Vons. In Seattle it is hard to find a full kitchen available so late in the evening. Katie and Natalie were pleasant at the front desk and even let me sit outside at 10pm! They had a heater and amazing suggestions. Traci was our server and she was training Rebecca. She had awesome banter but also incredible knowledge on the food. We settled on some pastas to share. The king salmon pasta and chicken pasta with pepper. I was so full and happy at the end of my meal. Thanks Vons! We will be back!
David was so wonderful and had the best energy! On top of all our drink orders which we desperately needed. Definitely coming back!
Love Von's!! Our server David was the best!! Had the best energy! Will come back again just to see him!
Erick was the best! Thank you for the amazing service!
Erick in the bar was absolutely great! Amazing drinks and service, thank you so much Erick!!

Visiting there was amazing!Katie & Natalie at the front desk was very kind and showed great service!And Traci was of great help, made things easier and smooth for us with picking food and drinks! Very high-spirited and awesome Server!!
The food was so incredible!! Natalie and Katie were amazing hostess and so kind when walking in and Traci was such a great help when it came to the menu!
Ainora is the nicest! She was attentive, answered all my questions, and made our experience enjoyable! We will back because of her! Cute, fun atmosphere! Great food and drinks!

So so good! I was only in seattle for a day and I stopped through here - so glad I did. My waitress Jessi was awesome and made me feel at home right away. Food and drinks were both delicious. Will definitely be coming back next time I'm in town!

I brought my grandmother and a good friend in for lunch. Great location near pike market and the water. We had the spiced fig pizza ( which was AMAZING and my favorite) , sweet and sour coconut prawn salad, clams and calamari. All the food was top notch and flavorful. Portions were a good amount and all the staff were pleasant that we interacted with. Server Jessi was extra upbeat and always smiling ( even through her mask I could tell haha) I will definitely be back in the future. Thanks for a great lunch!

Food was amazing! We had the smoked gouda and chicken sourdough pasta and it was so hot and fresh and perfect textures and flavor. We also had the 4 meat pizza and it did not disappoint. Cocktails were wonderful and great presentation on the Manhatten. Erick helped us out and he went above and beyond. There was a little bit of a wait but well worth it and they did hustle to get us seated.
Erick was dope! Will come back here just for him, but also food was dope too! Pasta was dope, pizza was dope, and smoked Manhatten was dope!
This server erik was unbelievable he pinpointed exactly what I was craving within 2 questions .
Our server Eric was great! 10 years really shows his love for the place and the food. I hope he continues showing top knotch service with incredible gusto

I travel a lot and this place was recommended. I couldn't be happier with everything, like literally everything from the time I walked in. Jessi is your girl to see, she was so good in fact I came back a second day and she killed it again, even though she was completely slammed. I had two of their burgers per her recommendations. This place is a great spot for travelers! Strongly recommend if you want food that matches the vibes.
Sooooo good. The wings were amazing. Pizza was amazing. We will be back!! Waiter was amazing
We had the best experience on the patio with David, as our server! He was outstanding and kept us laughing! so glad we stopped here on our travels! 10/10 recommend
This is one of my favorite restaurants in downtown Seattle. The pasta is fabulous the drinks are awesome good food and great atmosphere.
The bread is absolutely delicious here, good spirits too!
The happy hour is the best in Seattle!Our guy Erick was the best! Will be coming back.
Waiter(David) was amazing!!! I'm totally coming back!
Great place for burgers and beers
Yummy!! I really enjoyed this pizza. Very tasty. The attention was sensational. I really haven't eaten such delicious food for a long time ***** =)

5 stars for food, drinks, service, and atmosphere. Von's it's a must! I had their wings and Bloody Mary yesterday, absolutely delicious. Everything looks very tasty on their menu. Thanks to our server, Ainura for her professionalism! Keep up the good work!
Amazing mac and cheese. Whoa! Nothing like it. Kinda pricey. $25 for my favorite dish but once in a while it hits the spot.
Ben was a fabulous waiter. We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner and excellent service at Von's 1000 Spirits!The presentation of the skinny bitch cocktail was great too! A must order!

Our group had a great dinner and fantastic drinks. Highly suggest this restaurant! But the highlight of our evening was our host SHAUN. He is by far one of the best wait staff I have ever encountered. Engaging, funny, knows his stuff about the menu and drink selections. We thoroughly enjoyed our two hours with him. Trust me... go to Von's for the food and drink. Ask for Shaun. You won't be disappointed!
Vooooooons got to go here good food and they got all the booze you could want seats are close so you got to be ready to mingle . They got cool decorations too.
this is a hidden treasure for really great food. you won't be disappointed.
Lupe was great. Will definately come here again. She was fun and very friendly. The setting was nice and I loved the ladder.
Always consistent! Great atmosphere. One of my favorite go to restaurants in Seattle.
Wonderful service at Vons! Shane was great! Would definitely return and highly recommend!
Chris was amazing and very pleasent. He made amazing drinks and he had wonderful customer service.
Blake is amazing.  Thanks !!! Can't wait to come back!
Great pizza for lunch. Best Margarita ever using the own brew.

Erick and Chris L. have served me on multiple occasions, they're part of the reason I keep coming back! Exceptional service, incredibly friendly, and always make you feel like you're their only customer. Great place to hang out and enjoy your evening!
Ainura was the best! Service was excellent and food was perfect!
Unbelievable pizza!! Service was great and the pizza was delicious!!
Super cool bar with $5 martinis! Nuff said. Chris m. And Stephanie were really friendly and made the experience that much better!

Aloha, my visit from Hawai'i to Seattle was made to even better when I was brought to Vons by some friends which turned into my end of the day spot for the entire trip. I always requested or had the same amazing Care Facilitator her name was Elizabeth! I highly recommend coming to Vons for the Manhattans but make sure to get it from Elizabeth. She is Vons!! When I come back from Hawai'i to visit - she better have a salary raise or hourly! Mahalo nui Elizabeth!
This place has incredible Salmon Chowder!

Came here for some good snacks and drinks. Wasn't disappointed. The wheel was fun and a good experience. Our bartenders were Jason and Elizabeth who were both awesome! (Cadyn came in later and was great too & super knowledgeable). Jason & Elizabeth made us mystery shots, and they were fun. Elizabeth's was veryyyy yummy! And she was very personable & friendly. But definitely will be back, the staff and vibe was very good & love the set up of the bar/wheels!
Benjamin was awesome!! We loved his dinner suggestions , his friendly demeanour, and this has been the best restaurant experience in Seattle. Ps. Happy 26th birthday Ben!!! Sincerely Outback Team
Excellent food, one of my favorites in Seattle! Awesome service from Elizabeth at the bar!!
Brandi was amazing. So spunky and fun!! Can't wait to go back

Von's 1000 Spirit's is a haven to anyone looking to escape the mundane. As soon as I walked in the door, I was greated by a lovely young host. I think her name was Zia? She took the time to find accommodations for my group. There were 6 of us on a busy Friday night, yet she was able to find us a table almost immediately, to our delight. Our server, Elizabeth, was a wealth of knowledge on their spirit collection ( Yes they really have over 1 thousand) and was able to recommend each of us great drinks to try. Having already been impressed, to food left me speechless. Their "Mac n 4 cheeses" was decadent. The perfect amount of rich, not to mention how delicious their house made sourdough pasta is! My wife had Avocado Bacon burger and was equally satisfied. It safe to say me and my family will be back soon!

The hostess, Zia, was very welcoming and friendly. Food was great, and hospitality phenomenal. Because of this, we decided to come back two more times. The Sourdough pizza was the best pizza I've had!

I went to this place and loved it! The hostess Zia was very cheerful and accommodating. I was able to be seated at a table fairly quickly during happy hour. The food was very tasty, especially the salmon pasta. 5/5 stars.

You won't be finding any IMPASTAs here! Their sourdough pesto pasta was delicious! What I really appreciated was that our server, Traci, took the time to explain all her favorite key dishes to us when we were having difficulty deciding over the incredible menu choices.What really stood out to me as a patron was the care she took with our kids at the table. My daughter loves mac and cheese but there was no option for it on the kids menu. Without hesitation Traci said she could modify a kids pasta to make as mac and cheese. She did give warning that the mac and cheese would be a bit spicy but my daughter was elated at the idea of mac and cheese. Wouldn't you know it, as children do, my daughter changed her mind after one bite. Apologetically I explained the situation to our server when she came to the table after the food was delivered. Traci was more than happy to replace my child's meal with an alternative cream sauce, which my daughter loved, and the new dish was out within minutes of my request. As a parent it is always an adventure to go out with your children because you can never anticipate how long their attention will be kept before they are ALL DONE and want to move on. I was extremely impressed and thankful for the care and understanding our server took to make sure everyone at my table enjoyed their meal. Even though Von's has 1000 spirits and seems to cater to an older crowd I still left feeling it was a family-friendly restaurant as well.
amazing service. put together a table just for us. and was so attentive all throughout the meal. go. eat. drink. be happy.
It's everything that I could have wanted or imagined! With no pretense this is The quintessential cocktail bar. Get it. Chelsea made this experience for us and we appreciate her expertise!
Great drinks, great atmosphere great food great prices, friendly staff, knowledgeable bartender

This place was amazing. I originally made reservations for party of 6, that changed to 8. I called and spoke to Dan the GM and he meet our needs for a table of 8. Dan went above and beyond to ensure our table was what we wanted. Huge selection of spirits as the name says. Highly recommend this place. Ainura was our server and she was top notch. Prompt service and attention to detail was in point. Every 30mins the bar spins a wheel for a discount drink price. Our table had the following: pulled pork Mac and cheese (2 orders), pulled pork fries, salmon pasta, salmon chowder, salmon fish and chips (3 orders), and hamburger. The entire party would come back. My only regret is that we waiting till our last night in town to come here. PS. Don't forget to get the beignets. They are amazing.
Food and service is always great there! Sourdough pasta is a must must must.
Erik recommend a great cocktail. May be best bartender in all of Seattle
Great food. We went there twice for lunch during our visit to Seattle
Amazing homemade pasta dishes and the drinks are delighted. Highly recommended anything here since so many dishes are made in-house.

I can't say enough about this place ( i created a yelp account just to rate them...) I ate at Bobby Flays restaurant in Vegas as well as had the "famous" burger of Gordon Ramsay.. the burger here put both to shame. Best food I have EVER had ( I've eaten around the world, I did not expect to say that about Seattle). The atmosphere was incredible- unique and classy yet edgy, fun and chaotic without being boisterous, a mystery without being complicated. The staff (ask for Gabby!!) was beyond helpful as well as knowledgable, attentive without being annoying; impeccable service. The manager was out and about, the entire place was so genuine it was almost hard to believe. I would give more stars if I could, AMAZING experience. If you are in Seattle, ignore what the hotel puts in your room.... GO TO VONS 1,000 SPIRITS (gustobistro) you can thank me later :)
Great service, interesting cocktails
The best salmon chowder...ever! If you like chowder give this try, you won't regret it!
Great food, great service. I'll make a point to come back for more meatballs!
Reliablly tasty!
Great happy hour food, decent happy hour prices, huge selection of food, what's not to like. Actually, the food is really really tasty. Just what we were looking for.
Loved the sourdough pasta with salmon! A must have if you come to this place! :)
Great dinner. I had a sourdough pizza and my son had the sourdough pasta. Amazing....
Fun place for drinks and the sourdough pasta is AWESOME!!!!

Great place to hang out with your buddys. Its always nice to go where you see a lot of regulars having a good time. Been coming here for a little while now and they are so spot on with the drinks every time. If you need to get out and meet cool people this is the place.
Vons. What can I say?  The staff is so friendly and smooth.  They don't stress during busy rushes like some places. The Ricochet Rabbit is my favorite thanks to Kelsey.

I love this place. I drive all the way into Seattle just to go here which is about 20 minutes out. When I think about going to Pike's, I know Von's is waiting. I love the decor, the lighting, the food, the drinks..........AND, dun da da DAAAAAhhhhh, the beignet's are little cushions of happy. I was out and about doing some photography when started to get a little hungry, plus it was beer-thirty. The glowing sign peeked out and caught my attention. I went in to order a stout and the cinnamon sugar beignets and from that moment I was hooked. I knew, just from the menu, there was more deliciousness to come. I wasn't wrong.  They have an aged old eloquent selection of liquors on a lovely glass shelf with little cards that indicate what it is and pricing, plus a full bar, and nice beer on tap. They have really good cocktails and it's always fun to spin the wheel and see what you can get a discount on for the next thirty minutes. The staff is really nice and accommodating and I just have the best time when I go in there. The burgers are unique and good, the pizza is amazing, the pasta is delicious, and the salmon soup/stew with a nice chunk of sourdough soaking in the bowl is heavenly. I've ordered that twice. It's just great and I'm running out of adjectives to describe it. Just go in, sit down, and enjoy yourself.
Really enjoy the atmosphere of this place. Waitress was really helpful for my first time here.
Meatballs, the poutine, and the Vietnamese burger are awesome!

Always love going to this place. Went last night and had a more than wonderful evening. Our incredible waiter Joe was finishing his last shift before moving to Hawaii,playfully joked with us throughout the evening, recommending great drinks and entrees. We all left full, a littled tipsy and laughing. Perfect.
Artisinal. Handmade sourdough pastas. Who ever heard of such a great thing!

First time in Seattle and came in on a recommendation. Loved it. The wall of spirits was impressive. Try to Corpse Reviver cocktail - really good. We also enjoyed a Fric (sourdough pizza) which was also really good.

Great! We came in on a fluke, just walking by. had not seen the place before. The steak salad was yummy, and the fries were delicious! This place has a timeliness guarantee for lunch. Not too busy when we came, but key for a lunchtime rush. Recommended.
Kerri is an absolute pleasure!
Great ambiance. Mayahuel tequila is a must try. Love the new location. Mel gave excellent service and recommendations. Will definitely be back!!
Great drinks. Love the wheel for drink specials and every flatbread pizza on the menu is amazing!! Krystle is an amazing server!
Fun place! Great atmosphere for after work or tourists...will definitely come back! Thanks Erick for the great service!
If you are in the downtown Seattle area don't miss out on this place! Great atmosphere, great happy hour, great service, great food! The Pistou Chevre Sourdough Fric is amazing!
Best place for Happy Hour on a beautiful day!

The French Onion Burger was amaz-a-balls! Although, this week I attempted the Monster. Clearly, I was not going to finish this behemoth version of a double-double in five minutes, but was worth a try. The meat in all the burgers is well seasoned and a tender pink. I also recommend Alchemist Peanuts if you enjoy a salty buttery finish in your mouth. Just waiting for my Chocolate Cake on a Cloud and a larger pair of pants.

This place was so so horrible. The worst place I I've ever eaten at. When we got our food it was cold. They were greasy, soggy, and the lettuce didn't even look like it was edible. We also ordered fries, hibiscus tea, and churros. Not a single thing was edible. It was incredibly expensive for the items we good which again were not edible. We are physically ill and would never ever eat her again. I even tried putting the inside contents on the sandwich on toasted sourdough bread (since the bread was soggy). The sandwich was still horrible and gross. I'll probably be in the bathroom the rest of the night. Thanks Paseo!

Their shrimp po boy sandwich at nearly $14 is a rip-off. There are more onions than there are shrimp. The taste of onion overpowered other ingredients in the sandwich. Paseo was better under the previous owners, who opened their own sandwich shop - Un Bien - #2 sandwich shop in Seattle! Skip Paseo and go to Un Bien instead!

First they stole the namesake and recipes of the original Paseo, and now they open a store a few blocks away from Cafe Con Leche in SoDo (a Cuban-owned restaurant), which threatens to put them out of business. Ryan Santwire (the owner) is a prime example of an exploitive culture vulture who profits off of a stolen brand and cuisine. The food doesn't compare to the original, especially the caramelized onions, which are bland. I'd advice ya'll to skip this place and head to Un Bien, which was opened by the sons of the original owner of Paseo.

Being from Florida, this is an insult to my ethnic tastebuds.This is not Cuban food in the slightest. You can fool the people of the PNW into thinking this is Cuban, but not those of us that know the real deal.That being said, for a cheap imposter, if I completely forget what you're trying to be, it's tasty, but it's not what you claim.

Hey, Paseos! SLOW IT DOWN. That "Roasted Pork" is being cooked too damn fast. Its tough, not tender. No matter how much mayo you slather on that sandwich, you can't hide the truth. Braising pork takes time, I know you have to make a lot of it, but what is the point if you are just going to half ass it. Not to mention, nobody in that joint looks happy to be there. Whats up y'all, not paying your people enough? Hiring people who will accept your crappy wages and work environment over people who should get paid more and will make better food. Something isn't working, you guys, pull your heads out of your techie culitos and get with the programa. The equation isn't that hard.

Tried this spot for the first time after the original closed. I've had a few (to say the least) Cuban sandwiches in my day so I'm no stranger to what authentic should taste like.I ordered the press and a side of rice + beans. The meat wasn't marinated in OJ or spices at all and the rice + beans lacked flavor, tasted canned.A far cry from the original. Some stones are better left unturned and the reopening of Paseo is one of those.
Not the original Paseo !!!! former owners didnt' share the marinade huh !!! way overrated !!!!
Horrible experience! The food is pretty good. The techyuppie scum in the 70 minute line (sending Postmate delivery riders in their place) may burn in fucking hell.
This company gave me a quote $4000.00 over the average quote from other reputable companies.
Don't waste your time! Not good pizza, unprofessional attitude
I expected better quality and more quantity... I shall try somewhere else..

Yeah its just another Cuban restaurant now. The Paseo magic left with the original owners. Sure it is the same name, but, usually when a restaurant is purchased the previous owners teach the new owner's the recipes and techniques. This is obviously NOT the case. The new owner poached the place in the hallway of a courthouse auction. The food tastes like a Bellevue version of Cuban food - bland, dry, and lacks originality. We will miss you original Paseo. Yes, it was #2 with the previous owners. Definitely not number two under this ownership that purchased it in a hallway auction WITHOUT the recipes. Pathetic.

Stopped by there yesterday. Definitely not the same sandwich. It takes more than the same bread company and same meat vendor to be the original sandwich. I think it is also a joke of the picture of the ethnic people, how desperate is the owner to show past workers are returning. I went there a lot every week, I didn't recognize one face or person. This restaurant is now a joke and a disgrace to the Paseo's legacy. Too bad.

Told ya'll. They don't even pay their workers and also, none of them are even Cuban. And the naive of Seattle have been trying to raise 250k to keep them open. So dumb. They will run to Cuba without paying their dues here and live like hogs. Seattle wake up. Why does nobody in this town have any street smarts?
Whoa! Heep bad Karma happening here! Too bad...I will miss the incredibly friendly and efficient staff here and on Seaview Avenue, and the food!

Rude/Racist Behavior:My wife went with a female friend to the store this afternoon, and a male yelled rudely at them due to their religious dress, preventing them from taking a cart. He even approached them threatening them. When asked about his manager, he shouted at them that he is the manager (his name tag said "Bill"). My wife needed to call the police who asked her to leave to a safe place till they arrive. Upon arrival, her friend also complained that this is not the first time to harass female Muslims who wear Hijab (religious headscarf). The police filed a report against this manager.
hi

everyone raves about this place and there is a line out the door but i just don't get it. i have tried to eat here maybe half a dozen times especially since i use to live in the area and i just don't like it. sorry not sorry. that said.....everyone else thinks im crazy so you should at least give it a go.
king county sheriff ireland only sees what he wants to see, as long as he can still protect the criminals he's fine to deal with.

Ok, everyone knows the sandwiches here are the fucking best sandwich you can get for under $10. I've eaten here about 25 times already, and the sandwiches are always fucking BOMB!!! But I must say, service has gone downhill. Wait times have increased from 15 minutes (About 2 years ago) to now 30-60 minutes. The workers are slow as fuck. They look stoned to hell (Hey I use to smoke and work at fast food too) and are slow to take your order and don't really give a shit about you. The napkins and hand sanitizer wipes were empty when I was there recently, and I told them about it and it took them 15 minutes to refill them. It's like the owners of Paseos knows everybody loves their food, they're bringing in hoards of cash with their low overhang and endless stream of customers, so FUCK CUSTOMER SERVICE cause these PASEO ADDICTED FIENDS will ALWAYS come back for more.I also have a conspiracy theory on how they create artificial drug like demand. After 5pm, they usually run out of fucking bread. Tell me, how fucking hard is it to get BREAD!?!?! It's fucking bread. It's not some magic Cuban bread that falls out the sky when the Earth's hemispheres hits a certain longitude. How hard is it to send some 19 year old pothead to GO GET MORE FUCKING BREAD!?!? It's like they run out of bread purposely, so you get PISSED and return the next day ready to double your order to make up for yesterday's waste of time. And they know your succulent pork morsel addicted crackfiend ass will be BACK the NEXT DAY ready to order again.I'm starting to wonder if Paseos is owned by a Cuban druglord and his business is simply a front to launder cash....o.O*Disclosure* I went to Paseos today and they ran out of fucking bread. I'll be back tomorrow to get my fix you bastards.

The popularity of these greasy disgusting gut-bricks helps explain the obesity epidemic in the U. S. If you have any respect for your digestive tract, avoid this place like a pasture on a hot afternoon. If not, then eat a dozen Krispy Kremes instead--at least you'll get a sugar rush before the fat-induced depression sets in.
cambridgenailsspa.co.uk

That Paseo place is just ridiculous. If you just drove by and didn't know what it was, you'd think it's a food bank, seeing how many hungry-looking folks standing in line.Anyways, my curiosity got the best of me and I got in the long line and waited for 40 minutes, paid $9 for the Caribbean Roast sandwich and waited for another 20 minutes for my order to be ready. For a finger food joint, it's hideous, yo!!And it was a disappointing experience. To be fair, the pork was very good with a hint of soy sauce used in its aioli marinade. The caramelized onion gave good flavor and a nice texture to the combination while the lettuce provided an overall freshness. The bread was baked to near perfection. But the sandwich looked obnoxious. Because it's made from a stupid recipe. The hard bread a la French baguette isn't meant to be made into a sandwich, let alone with heavy fillings. That's why it's so messy to eat. The Vietnamese Banh mi, on the other hand, is made from a modified French baguette with rice flour added to the dough, and the bread and the fillings are rather light.   The Paseo sandwich is neither traditional nor authentic. It should be called the random sandwich instead, because no one can trace its origin to the Caribbean, Cuba or even Miami. There's nothing Caribbean or Cuban about the sandwiches at Paseo. For all I care, it can be called the Nigerian sandwich or whatever. It's a faux ethnic food item, just like the infamous fortune cookies. For some strange reasons, the joint has become quite popular here in North Seattle. But I'm not a masochist and I don't like waiting for an hour for a kid-sized meal, where ever the hell it came from. I wasn't impressed at all and I think the place is a fraud with all its pretentiousness.

Oh my gosh, this place is so nasty. No place to set, people are RUDE and the food is gross. I grew up all my life in Florida and am Cuban myself and would not dare call any of the stuff they serve Cuban. Please don't go, waste or $. Go to La Isla in Ballard, much better.

Not a review of the food. I went Saturday night: out of sandwiches. I went tonight. Sold out of sandwiches. 1 star for being really out of sandwiches = being really annoying. I asked about it and the guy, although kind of 'nice' wasn't saying anything other than "yep..sold out". It would have been nice had he pulled his head out and said " you know, we're out of sandwiches, again, I'm sorry about that...here's the deal...we just don't have room to store extra bread...or meat...or whatever" as opposed to just "yeah..we're out"...I know you're out, I'm more curious to know why after running out so consistently you don't prep for more sandwiches. Anyway...after I get around to eating one (it's been a year since my last go around) I'll write a proper food review. But until then...I've spent about $10 on gas just to hear "yeah..we're out"
Staff wasn't very friendly and the food at Un Bien is better.
Looks the location is good I am just not satisfied with the service.

The food is not the same under the new owners. Wish it was.Bought the place but not the recipes.
Food is alright here, came here few days back for a takeaway. Its a bit over priced. surely can find better quality of food else where.

Overrated!!! Messy sandwich with eh flavors. Gf and I were so disappointed. We read so many positive reviews so we're not sure if it was just a rare incident but at this point I would not recommend this place.Oh and we both had upset stomachs after eating here so be cautious.

Since I live three blocks away, I have tried five times to get the sandwich that I love. Too bad that sandwich no longer exist there anymore. I had eaten there four times a week for the last five years of my life, and I didn't recognize one face working the counter or the back kitchen. I wonder what returning employees they are always boasting about. If there was a returning employee, it wasn't someone high up in the back kitchen. Now back to the sandwich, the meat as others have posted was dry dry dry. It tasted like it was made three days ago and re-heated that morning in a watery broth. The sauce was less spicy and the bread was still pretty rock hard as usual. This all equates to someone who isn't Cuban and trying a feeble attempt at re-creating it. Yes, it looked the same with the big juicy onions but it lacked the execution, experience, and most important the love for the product. This an Americanized version of the previous sandwich. But, I feel this restaurant is not as good or the same as when owned by the previous family. I don't predict longs lines after their initial push when they opened.Also the guy working the cash register wearing the stocking hat is truly horrible. The look he gives you is sort of condescending, like I'm lucky to eat there. I guess it is probably all the tourist that don't know any better, or all the Seattlelites that only ate here once a year and can't really remember what the original version tasted like. I won't be going again for an overpriced sandwich at $12 dollars for not even half as good as it was before.
It's just not the same. Sadly.

This will sound like blasphemy, I know, but I ate a sandwich at Paseo recently, and it wasn't a particularly good experience. I'd been there a long time ago, so I thought I knew what to expect, but still. It was a rare hot day in Seattle, so I decided to hang out in Fremont for the afternoon. The line at Paseo was extremely long, as usual. I waited in the hot sun for about 30 minutes before getting under the shaded awning of the restaurant. The line started moving, and as I made my way to the front, I saw the dreaded sign: Cash Only. I cursed myself for forgetting they were cash sticklers, and that I was out of cash. By this point I was at the front of the line anyway. I mentioned it to the guy taking orders, and he said that he could take my order, and that I could run up the block and get cash from an ATM and come back. Not ideal, but I agreed. I ordered a scallop sandwich, then took a walk to the grocery store up the block to get cash. Twenty minutes and a $3 ATM fee later, I was back. I gingerly made my way to the front of the line again, explaining to the people who I was passing that, no, I wasn't cutting in line and taking the spot that they had waited a half an hour to claim, and that I was simply picking up an order. I paid my $10 (including tax) for my prize, handed to me rather unceremoniously in a warm plastic bag. (Side note: Aren't they banned now?) I briefly considered waiting for one of the three tables in the restaurant to clear out, but that wasn't happening. Instead, I took my sandwich down Fremont Ave., looking for any spot to stop and eat it. No park benches or appealing curbs, so my choices were a bus shelter or a dirt-covered ledge in a public park. I chose the ledge, and there, yes, I finally savored the sweet taste of victory. I sunk my teeth into the sandwich, and it was as delicious as I remembered it. For a brief second, it was all worth it. But then, the sandwich basically disintegrated on me, and on the dirty ledge where I was eating. Caramelized onions, cilantro, the garlic tapenade... they all schlooped down my hands and onto the ground. The whole thing was over in under five minutes. And there I was, stooping in a wooded park, my face and hands covered in some weird Caribbean sauce, $13 poorer and a good chunk of my afternoon gone. Honestly, it doesn't seem like a good way to spend one's time. Of the hour and a half I spent procuring, financing, and eating this sandwich, less than 10 minutes of it was pleasant. To me it's just not worth the bullshit. I would be interested in going back if they ever expanded their space, but as it is it's mostly a novelty that's best experienced once.

I am not sure what is so good about this. Long wait, cash only, OK food. I don't mind waiting for long time or even slightly iffy feeling of "cash only" business, but the food itself was not very good. The buns were too tough, too much meat, and extremely greasy! Yes... literally I had to go through whole roll of kitchen towel to wipe my greasy while/after eating. I won't go back there as I am not very fond of the food they are serving.The flip side is the price is good as long as you stick to the sandwiches.

Not as good as the original Paseo, but it isn't bad. The tofu sandwich has always been my favorite, and for the most part it tastes the same, but it is a little off. I really hope they are able t keep working and changing it so it tastes like the old Paseo. It used too be ridiculously good!

Such a perfect level of grease, 5 star spice that rocked my world and despite the crowd the staff was quite well behaved. A must if you're in Seattle!

My friend took me here because he recommended the #2 and that it was a significant amount of food! He was right! The sauce is delicious and the pork is cooked perfectly everything was way better than expected for such a small place!

What a line but man was it worth the wait, for the most part! The atmosphere was absolutely great, everyone was excited to get in and get the food ordered. I got a Cuban sand which and it was amazing. The only reason I gave 3 stars is because it too about twice as long as normal.

not bad. Thanks

I have been chasing the opportunity for a Paseo sandwich for close to a decade like a dog in heat and I finally rode the Paseo orgy train this weekend. It felt like I was handed someone else's sloppy seconds fermenting in a dirty loincloth. The unpleasant sight of my eating a Paseo sandwich ranks as one of my relationship milestones among being able to shit in your presence, comfortably talk about vaginal blood clots, and a gesture of endearment equates to nightly dutch ovens. If you are still attracted to your significant other after watching them finger-bang a Paseo Press lubricated by a jug of grease, I would consider that a real avenue of love. If one is going to fetishize a sandwich, at least have the decency to fetishize a sandwich that demonstrates immaculate culinary skills and whose bread isn't a gigantic crouton. Luckily, we came in early enough to avoid all of the other thirsty asses. Had we arrived any later, I think we would have spent at least 30 minutes waiting in line for an under-seasoned, overcooked sandwich. I would rather asphyxiate myself with plastic wrap. Dare I say that the Paseo Press and Caribbean Roast both had overcooked, chewy pork and terrifyingly under-performed in regards to flavor and taste overall. I am stunned at how something can be so freakishly oily and awfully bland at the same time. The only ounce of flavor I tasted was one pickled jalapeo that fell out of my sandwich, as with everything else to the point where it deconstructed itself. Customers ought to file a license in order to be in public with an unconcealed weapon that is the bread of a Paseo sandwich. Shit's terrible as sandwich bread, it's super dense and hard to chew. The pressure you have to apply to gnaw at the bread forces the pork and other insides to fall out. Stupid. I did prefer the Caribbean Roast far more than the Paseo Press because it had the lettuce and mayonnaise, which counteracted the pork jerky. Paseo is running on a fine line between a tolerable sandwich stop and an overrated fartbag. I am going to give Paseo the benefit of the doubt because it might have been an off day for whomever prepared the pork in the back; however, it seems that they are consistent with inconsistencies with either service or the food. I would hardly worship the grounds on which they erect their 10-person capacity shacks.

The spicy fish sandwich was tasty and messy. Really, really messy. Messy foods always tend to be quality and good. However, the need to stand in a long line and wait to get this sandwich is lost on me. It's just not a trend I can get into and it really hampers my enjoyment of the establishment and its food.
Not the best Vegetarian sandwich restaurant. Excellent for meat eaters.
Their delicious Caribbean Roast sandwich was almost worth the hour-long wait, and that was at 2:30 on a Thursday. Peak hours must be a nightmare here.

for the money those guys want from you - they better do something extraordinary, but that's not really the case. I recently had the pleasure of trying the Caribbean roast sandwich at Paseo and I have to say, it was one of the juiciest and most flavorful sandwiches I have ever had! The combination of tender roast beef, tangy Caribbean spices, and fresh vegetables made for a truly unforgettable taste experience.The sandwich itself was generously sized, and the bread was perfectly toasted to add a nice crunch to each bite. But what really stood out was the incredibly juicy and tender meat, which was cooked to perfection and bursting with flavor.Unfortunately, I can't give the same glowing review for the wings I tried. While they were decent, they were just ordinary and didn't quite measure up to the outstanding flavors of the Caribbean roast sandwich.Overall, I highly recommend giving the Caribbean roast sandwich a try if you're in the mood for something truly special. It's a definite 4/5 stars in my book!

What popped at me initially was the menu. I despise basic breakfast/brunch foods. Being a home cook, I want something a bit more original and complex that I haven't made at home a million times.The setting is in a perfect location. Fremon t a nice walking yuppie area where everyone pretends to be yoga/pilates experts in their Lulu outfits they may or may not have actually worked out in. It was beautiful weather so I asked to sit out front, but the place is SO light and airy inside that I would have gladly sat in there instead.A couple great bloody marys, some avocado, and perfect size portions and we were done! Would love to explore their regular menu as well. Flavors were simple yet complex enough to be interesting and satisfying.The only drawback of a lunch h is the "lunch crowd". The most painfully basic conversations about their cliche night before, drivel about the pointless rest of their day, or people practically making out with random dogs walking by. Among the greatest sandwiches I Have had in Seattle. This caribbean hole in the wall smells so great that when we walk by I smell phantom odors- even when they're not open! All sandwiches come with jalepenos, however you can request them to take them away. It's not quick food so it takes a little while and the seats is restricted, but I do not hear anyone whining! I favor the chicken, sans jalepenos.

My standards are high for sizable sandwiches since I'm from New York, but Paseo really handles its pork well. Not big for onions, but anyone who loves caramelized onions will love most of these sandwiches, since they're packed with them. Gets quite messy, but worth it for this apparent Seattle landmark
The flavor is so good, but the bread cuts the roof of my mouth every time without fail. It is also the messiest sandwich of all time. But it is so delicious.

Calling this the best sandwich ever may sound like faint praise, but this is one of the best meals ever as well. The roasted pork is a piece of heaven on a crunchy roll. I came here for lunch at 2:15PM on a Friday, assuming it would be empty; I was shocked to find a long line out the door, even with the threat of rain looming.Obviously, this place is well-known, and for good reason. We ended up waiting about 45 minutes to order, and another 15-20 to receive our food after that. The line went fast enough, and the cashier at the front was very courteous, unlike what I would expect in a similar situation in New York City.I got the Caribbean Roast sandwich, which is their specialty. I have to say: it is the best sandwich I have had in my life to date. I was hard-pressed to think of a sandwich that was that close, honestly. The famous cheesesteaks of Philadelphia were no match; only a deli sandwich from 2nd Ave Deli in NYC is close, but no cigar.There is so much going on in this sandwich. The pork is sopping with juice and flavor. The aioli adds a pop, and the caramelized onions add some sweetness and complexity. Add some cilantro and romaine for a little bit of balance and a lightly toasted baguette and this thing is damn close to perfect. Keep in mind, though: it is near impossible to eat without making a tremendous mess. Be prepared to be covered in sauce, but you won't mind.
Had my usual pork sandwich. Good but not quite as good as the old days. Next time I'll try something different on the menu.

Ok, I finally got to taste the #2 and am reviewing a couple of months after the fact. It was very good and craved for another, but at the time I went back a few weeks later, they were closed for a vacation. Yikes! A coworker told me about a sack lunch box lunch whatever delivery company that they had ordered from in the North called Eclectic. I was weary, because who could compete with Seattle's best sandwich? I gave them a call and they said that they would deliver to our company the following day (24 hours notice is required for all orders). Holy $%#! Their Cubano was a taste that lingered in my mouth! It wasn't Paseo's #2 but more along the lines of Paseo's press, (but not pressed) with ham and Swiss, succulent pork and actual caramelized onions! I wish they had a storefront! If you're ever in the mood to have lunch delivered to you or your company (and can call ahead), their Cubano is other-worldly. They have other stuff too, like Chinese humbao and Vietnamese Bah Mi sandwiches, but we all ordered the Cubano and didn't regret a thing! All there items come as combos, didn't bother to ask if they sell just the sandwiches.

If you have not eaten at the OLD Paseo's yet? Ask yourself what are you waiting for? I discovered Paseo's when I signed up with yelp last year. It would be the most recommended restaurant for weeks. Like a hit song in the Top 40. I got the pirate to take me to lunch here. So we had the Pork Sandwiches since that was the Only item that did not sell out. We were lucky. They only served 6 people after us. They ran out of bread. The food here flies out like Planes out of Seatac. The sandwiches were memorable. He rarely dishes out $8.00 for something exotic. Being from the backwoods of Michigan he rarely eats anything ethnic. He usually is a cheap skate kind of guy. He really likes the $5 Subway sandwiches. So if I can get the pirate to try something new and he treats, its a win win for both parties. And like Mikey said "He likes it !!"If your new to the area take a tip from the many locals who review restaurants online. You gotta try this place at least once. Drive, fly, crawl stand in line with the throngs of people and wait patiently. Your time will be well spent.

Well... the reality of it is that you can't walk out of this place without a foodgasm. I'm not sure who coined that word but it probably has something to do with Paseos. Their Midnight Cuban sandwich is to DIE for. Be prepared to bring cash and you might have to wait to get a seat as the actual eating section of the establishment is rather small but for the love of God please do not pass this place up. The food melts in your mouth and their sauces are spectacular. Writing this review made my mouth water. Drop everything and find your way here. It will definitely behoove you to do so.
Crowded and busy, but the Midnight cuban is delicious. Get there early, don't go with a big group, and if it is nice day roll down to Gasworks and enjoy your sandwich.

Ok, I admit I was a bit dubious after hearing all the reviews that any sandwich could be that good. But it was! I got the chicken (last one of the day -- they ran out of bread) and it was awesome.

I had a sandwich the other day and I have to say it was good. It's always hard with a restaurant because so many things can affect your perception of the place. I have to say though, as objectively as I can, my meal was good. Real good. I think people get a little crazy with the five stars around here. They start handing them out like bread loaves at a soup kitchen. A five star hotel is a place you stay that makes you want to not go home to your wife and kids. A five star meal is a dinner that makes you want to cut out your tongue afterwards so you don't have to suffer a mediocre meal ever again. This place is a solid four. You won't be amazed but you certainly won't be disappointed...
One of the best sandwiches i have ever had. Please visit if you are ever in Seattle.

This is one of the best sandwiches I've had in my life, especially the scallop one. Fresh and generous portion. It's no fancy restaurant but a true hidden gem in a residential area. It can get really messy but who cares when it comes to good foodd Highly recommended!!

McMinnville Toyota Review at Yelp.com  03/23/2015A Good Used Vehicle Buying Experience at McMinnville ToyotaI searched for a reliable and affordable used Toyota Tacoma pickup for several months before finally finding one in March, 2015 at McMinnville Toyota in McMinnville, Oregon . It was a 2004 1-owner Tacoma TRD with 64,424 miles for less than $16,000 and had good Carfax and Autocheck reports. It also had the following features I was looking for: four wheel drive, automatic transmission, V-6 engine, TRD/SR5 road package, locking rear differential, and 2-door cab.The pickup was first listed online on March 17. We called the salesman, Mr. Curt Ritter, that afternoon and bought the pickup the next morning.  My son (who is a knowledgeable and experienced vehicle buyer) assisted with a preliminary inspection and we took the pickup on an extensive test drive. The vehicle's condition and performance were completely as advertised. A subsequent detailed inspection by an independent mechanic verified that the pickup was in very good condition with no problems. During the entire transaction, Mr. Ritter dealt with us in a friendly, straightforward, and honest manner. I would be glad to purchase another vehicle from McMinnville Toyota at any time in the future.

Ashley Furniture in Tacoma really was great. I called all sales people were with other customers. The receptionist checked stock for me, Not her job but she went above and beyond her job description. We went in and purchased, drove to the warehouse to get the TV console. The warehouse people we polite and helped us right away. After we put the console together the top had some flaws in the varnish. Called customer service and was on hold for over 30 minutes. Called Tacoma store was given an email address and asked to send a cc to the Tacoma store so they could follow it up. 3 days latter, a tech came out, revarnished the top. What could they of done better? Nothing that I know of. The console was just packaged to soon before the varnish was cured, problem taken care of. Thank you Ashley Furniture. Debbi

Precision Dental of Seattle has taken care of my dental needs for over 15 years. They are efficient,courteous and on time! I have noticed that I take better care of my teeth when I know what is going on. That may sound like a no brainier but it has really helped me. I bought a new car at South Tacoma Honda. Even though it's been a few days since I purchased it, I am still amazed at the professionalism and straightforwardness which isn't something your ordinarily associate with car dealerships.I have been researching the car I purchased for over 6 months and I knew the price I wanted to pay. I checked with over 20 Honda dealer who all flatly turned me down. I recently got an email from Nick Cruthers telling me that he could come very close to the price I wanted to pay. I sent his offer to all the other dealers - not one of them said they could even match it, let alone beat it, and a few suggested that Mr. Cruthers wasn't being entirely honest with me.I drove out of South Tacoma Honda having financed the car at exactly what I wanted to pay. They didn't try to force me to pay any other fees, etc. Of course they offered accessories and other stuff, but I refused everything - and they still smiled and treated me like a king. I am pleased to tell you that Mr Cruthers has my ringing endorsement. He couldn't have made the process easier.

AUGH THIS SANDWICH PLACEEEEEEEEEEEMy friend and I spent a few days visiting Seattle and staying in Fremont, and this is the first place we went to after we landed and checked into our hostel. Mind you, we were so hungry and tired, the walk from our hostel to Paseo was a little longer than we expected, we waited about 20 minutes in the long line to order and about 20-30 minutes more to receive our order, walked BACK to our hostel to eat because there was no seating there, AND IT WAS STILL WORTH IT! SO DELICIOUS! We got the Paseo Press? Their most popular pressed sandwich that takes a little longer to make. It was seriously delicious. The meat, cheese, grilled onion, and whatever sauce they used went PERFECTLY together. Paseo is a MUST TRY when you're visiting Seattle and want to stop by the cute little Fremont area.

Unhappy with the demeanor of one of his employees, I had placed a bad review here before. Couple of hours later John gets in touch with me to apologize and gives me great news. He's willing to do my timing belt, replace my water pump, and fix the power window at no cost. It's exactly what we expect from a professional in this type of situation. No regrets to have driven my car to the Pacific Rim Automotive at all. I'm here to testify that they will work hard to get the job nicely done no mater what. I strongly recommend the Pacific Rim Automotive for your Subaru Forester. Ask for John that it can't go wrong. Cheers!

My boyfriend and I visited Seattle for my birthday in December. Before I left Arizona, my tattoo artist made sure to let me know about Paseo. "Remember Paseo! That is all!" he said in complete seriousness. So I did.My boyfriend and I got to Fremont around 9:00 a.m.--too early because nothing is open, apparently. We started at Fremont Coffee Co. and walked around a bit, then headed down to the water to find the Troll before Paseo opened at 10:30. We walked all the way up what felt like the tallest hill in the entire world before arriving at tiny Paseo around 10:00. A line was already forming, and we made friends with a gentleman named Terrence who said it was also his first time, and he would be grabbing sandwiches to-go. Everything I've read told me not to take it to-go unless you plan on wearing most of it.I intended to get the full experience. My boyfriend and I both went for the Caribbean Roast Sandwich. It took all of three minutes to get, and we even got a table! We sat, unwrapped the steaming pile of pork and went at it. It was the most satisfying greasy mess I've ever had the pleasure of wearing all over my face and hands. The jalapenos scattered throughout offered the perfect kick to the mild flavor of the pork. The baguette was crisp and stayed that way!I looked around the room and noticed not two people eat a Paseo sandwich the same way. While we opted for the "face first" method, one man had grabbed a fork and taken off the top part of the sandwich, scooping sauce and pork in single-bite increments. Another gent had used a fork entirely. Some a bag, already slightly spotted with grease, to-go. It was magical to see everyone so satisfied!It turned out to be a good thing we walked a hundred blocks up a gigantic hill to get to Paseo because we were absolutely full to the brim after. I would walk up that hill a million times over just to get to that sandwich. You have quite the gem, Seattle!!
possibly the best sandwich i've ever had

You know, I've been going to Paseo quite a bit because it's been hyped up and highly regarded by both Seattle people and tourists. When friends come into town to visit, this is a place I try to take them to. And at first, I didn't get it, it was just a sandwich that tasted normal. But the more I have it, the more it sticks out to me. Fair warning for those having it the first time, this is a greasy sandwich so load up on napkins. I usually go for the Cuban Roast, as it's what they tout as their most popular. Comes with HUGE slices of onions, a leaf of lettuce and some juicy savory pork. Can't figure out what the sauce is either, is it just mayo? In any case, the bite goes down so good and the jalapenos add the heat that I look for in any great sandwich. I would consider getting extra jalapenos next time.A tip if you plan on heading there is call in an order beforehand. After about half an hour, you can walk right in and pick it up instead of waiting in line. I've waited for an hour and half before.

Just had a fantastic time with friends at this pub! The food was absolutely delicious, especially the Steak Bites, Fries, and Crispy Brussels Sprouts. Strolled in for brunch midday on a Saturday, not really knowing what to expect. I had previewed a brunch menu online that looked like it was on point, but I was really sold by the fact that they take online reservations for brunch - unheard of in Seattle - and all I really wanted was some good food in a decent atmosphere without the hours long wait that generally trademark brunch in this city.While this is certainly one of the many dinner/bar locations that brunch offerings are clearly their second line of business, with "brunch" written on a chalkboard for diners to take notice while they are in for a drink on a Friday night, I was pleasantly surprised at the airiness of the place with the roll-up opened on a nice summer day.Service was great - timely, thoughtful, and kind. Mimosas were generous in the champagne department and were mixed with fresh oj. And the food - THE FOOD! I ordered the beef short rib chilaquiles and the hubs ordered the fried chicken/waffle. The chilaquiles were delicious! Topped with radish and cilantro, a side of black brand with cotija cheese, and served with crme frache, a lime wedge, and green "diablo salsa" - just the right amount of heat. The fried chicken and waffle were also amazing - the chicken was juicy on the inside and had perfectly crispy skin, and the waffle was sprinkled with pecans and bacon and topped with a cardamon butter that was to die for! The perfect sweet/savory brunch item.If you're looking for a fabulous brunch without the wait, re:public is now definitely on the top of my list.
Only been here from lunch and drinks.  Not bad, but not great.

i like this place a lot. a couple of weeks ago i wound up here twice in one week. i really like the bread and butter dish. i recommend asking for extra salt to bring the butter up to that special zing level. i think it's either $2 or $3.i met up with a friend to give him some water bottles for his future STP ride. they are massively late. parking is a hassle around there. i found a couple of douchey guys sitting in their douchey cars, talking on their douchey cell phones, taking up valuable free street parking spots. hope that doesn't turn into a hot new trend. i would go back again for the good beers and i'd try the food too.

SNARF!Re:Public is a new cute little cubby looking joint straight ILLIN' in the midst of SLU. The red letters on the sign make it that much more magical. Anywho, we had a private company event here and I definitely indulged. The ambiance was very romantic so I could definitely see myself cruising here for a nice glass of vino on a weekend or weekday with a sweet lil' thang.I had the crab puffs as an appetizer and they were quite scrumptious, some amazing lasagna and pasta for my entree. After I was almost all the way full I tried their rib eye and was immediately blown away. This place wasn't too pricey so definitely worth your time if you're in the area.Bonus info: This is about 1 notch up from Joey's in SLU. It's more expensive so I would recommend Joey's if you're just having drinks and/or a light appetizer and Re:Public if you want a higher class menu and ambiance.

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE! This has become a monthly treat for me and a couple co-workers. Fantastic wine list, amazing food, small portions but worth every penny. You just have to get a little wine-drunk first and savor each bite. I wish I had done a review when this was still on the menu, but I am going to mention it anyway...foie gras creme brulee. Yep, most amazing thing I have ever had in my entire life. I couldn't tell if I was eating a meal or a dessert, omg, if you guys are reading this please, please bring it back! I have only sat at the bar, but service is always attentive even when its busy. Until last week I was only in on weekday nights, but I stopped by for a martini by myself on a friday and it was packed! Definitely a fun scene on the weekends if you are looking to meet people or come in with a group, probably not as good for a date seeing as it was super loud, but good for them for being busy. A+

the food quality was not special to pay $115 for 2 people. the pasta tasted fresh but the chicken tasted like a box of sand which is very sand, dissappointing in my opinion. the desert wine tasted i literally yacked two. the desert was very decent but again over pricedthe ambiance was really extraordinary i would say that but other than not visiting seattle because of this

I recently visited Purple Caf and Wine Bar in Seattle for the first time, and unfortunately, my experience left much to be desired. While the ambiance and drink selection were noteworthy, my overall impression was tainted by uncomfortable seating, lackluster food, and an unpleasant aftermath.Let's start with the positives. The restaurant's ambiance and wine selection create a cozy and sophisticated atmosphere, making it a suitable spot for drinks and socializing. However, when it comes to the dining experience, there are considerable drawbacks.The seating arrangement was notably uncomfortable, detracting from what could have been an enjoyable evening. The chairs lacked ergonomic design, making it difficult to relax and fully savor the dining experience.Turning to the food, I ordered the chicken, expecting a premium dish given the prices. Regrettably, the reality fell short of expectations. The chicken was disappointingly dry, reminiscent of a budget BBQ chicken one might find at a grocery store. The lack of succulence and flavor left me questioning the value for the cost.Unfortunately, my disappointment did not end with the underwhelming meal. The next day, I experienced persistent gas and an upset stomach. While I'm not quick to attribute these symptoms solely to the restaurant, it does raise concerns about the quality of ingredients or food handling practices.In light of my overall dissatisfaction and the subsequent digestive discomfort, I believe the establishment should consider refunding my purchase. A dining experience should leave patrons satisfied and comfortable, and unfortunately, Purple Caf and Wine Bar fell short of these expectations.

I used to love this restaurant for their wonderful service and Sommeliers.  The last two times I have been there in the last two months, the servers just seemed to be checked out and going through the motions. There is no passion in their work, and they are no longer trying to create an ambiance or a dining experience, and when I drop 2-300 for a dinner for 2, I expect more. I went there this evening, and again the waitress comes over with a nice bottle of wine, but where is the sommelier? Have they gotten rid of this program where the Som comes over and decants your wine. I loved talking about wine with the Som, and thought it added a nice touch. Guess Harvest Vine and Luc will now get my business. Goodbye Purple Cafe. My filet mignon was not medium, and even though I told my server, she didn't really seem to care, and I am not one to send food back unless she felt it should return to the kitchen, and she didn't say anything. The filet came by itself, so I found myself hungry afterwards and ordered two cheese tastings which were nice as always. There just isn't anything special about Purple any longer........it's just get the customer in, and get them out...............I can feel a better energy and have a special dining experience elsewhere. Seattle has some great restaurants. Sorry Purple........won't be back. GC
Horrible place and the worst manager ever.

If you haven't noticed by now, I'm huge on customer service. This place had some of the rudest, most pretentious @$$holes I have ever met. So we went in late on a Tuesday night after a Mariners game, as my buddies sister and friend were in town from the East Coast. After ordering a shot and a drink, we were content for about 45 minutes. My buddy ordered a drink and about 20 minutes later hadn't received it. When he finally received his drink, I ordered another, and jokingly asked him if I could get it in less than a half hour. Turns out we didn't look like the crowd they prefer, so he decided that my joke meant I was intoxicated and didn't deserve to be served anymore. It was my 2nd drink in an hour, AND we had ordered food. After speaking with a manager, he agreed that I did not look intoxicated, but they don't undermine the "judgement of their staff". Maybe my joke was in poor taste, but I was trying to be lighthearted, not offensive, and if you work in a bar, you should be ready to deal with garbage from rude patrons, and a little banter at the bar shouldn't be handled like that. 0 stars is what they deserve,, and I guarantee I will never return to this place. I will say I was digging the atmosphere of the place before that whole thing happened.

Purple Cafe has been one of my favorites for the past few years and I have celebrated many birthdays and other special occasions there. Last night I came in excited but was very disappointed with the service. After waiting for some time to get our food, my table was finally served except for myself. Unfortunately, many of the pastas cold upon serving. I had ordered the purple chopped salad which was okay once I got it but that wasn't until 20-30 minutes after the rest of the table. By the time I was starting to eat the rest of the table was finished. Not even an acknowledgment from the waiter or an apology was given. I understand mishaps occur but I'd expect some sort of acknowledgment of it by the staff so I was not left waiting.
I thought that the food was pretty average. It was definitely over-priced for the quality of food. It was not bad, but it was not worth the price we paid.
Wines are over priced and list is not well put together.  Food ok but once again you can get better across the street
The food was so-so at best and our waiter had an attitude. Definitely won't go to this place again next time we're in Seattle. Thank God we were with good company!

This restaurant is a real deal! It is the place where you can find the real food at the real price. Worth paying for it trust me! See you soon! Highly recommended!! Prices are fair for most items and the food is delivered to your table in a reasonable time. They have the best service in town.I can't wait to come back here!

food is great. of course the wine is yummy but it is pretty loud. came in with a group of girls (7) and sat at a table and couldnt hear eachother talk. good for a casual meal but not if you want something more intimate i wouldnt recommend.

Ate here for dinner. Muslced the door open to a nice restaurant inside.The food was great, good selection of wines,had a great red, but don't expect me to remember what it was. Would be a a nicer atmosphere if it weren't so loud. Couldn't carry a conversation. Overall, satisfied.
Foods are ok, not sure this is American or Chinese, but it has many selections.
This is a nice place with a really nice atmosphere. If you make sure to order anything in particular, order the lobster mac and cheese. Very nice!
Good atmosphere but this place is definitely more style than substance.
This place was cool
The atmosphere was lovely, a GREAT wine list and amazing service. However, the food was a little salty. I will definitely give it another chance. Perfect location for a girls night out!
Outstanding selection of wine and a great atmosphere.

Like a model: gorgeous on the outside, vacuous inside. I adore this convertion of a bank's big windows to a chi-chi wine bar with a spiral wine column in the middle. But was I surrounded by celebs or something? I don't think I had spinach in my teeth!!!!! Pay attention to me, please. Nice full flavored cup of soup. Looks like great wine flight options. PUHLEASE though .... I am not invisible even though I wasn't showing cleavage.

Meh. That pretty much sums it up. The food was meh. The atmosphere was meh. The service was meh. Even some of the wine was meh.We had a few things off the tasting menu and a couple of that evenings specials. It was all so unremarkable that I really don't remember what any of them were.While parts of the interior are cool, it felt like a cafeteria in there (albeit a nice one). It's like they were going for European Courtyard and instead got Food Court At A Reasonably Nice Mall.My wine flight was good (I guess I chose well), but my husband's was not (I guess he didn't).It was a totally passable (if not far too pricey) evening, that I won't be hurrying back to repeat. But if I end up there again somehow? Whatever. I'll eat, I'll drink, I'm sure it will be fine. But..... meh.

Came for a date night, ambiance was among the best. Food was good although I think we got youelr typical dinner burgers & fries. Service was acceptable. Would go again for memorable nights. Pricing was fair.
Everything about this restaurant is very good. It's a large open space with comfortable seating and great service. The food is quite good.

We came here for dinner and made a reservation immediately. It's a huge cool place, and the decor is beautiful, however I think they could happily use more lighting when the sun goes down it feels really dark and difficult. I think they have an intimate feel but it's completely dark.We ordered appetizers, which came out quickly. However, it takes a long time for us to heal ourselves after being cleansed. The food was great; I enjoyed the burrata and calamari appetizer, but found the duck a bit dry.Overall would get it here but again due to cheap service.
Love this place! Large selection of wine and exquisite hand-crafted cocktails. Every appetizer we tried was fantastic, but the Gorgonzola dates are by far our favorite!
Food was delicious, service was great. Great date spot. Close walk from the water. Sit at the table or bar and you're in good hands.

The food was prepared well and everything was simply in the perfect spot. The lighting is sufficiently dim to set the disposition . My beau cherishes the spot, we come here consistently to have our dinner. The staff is warm, inviting as well and they got you covered for every one of your necessities.

I don't live in the city so when I do get to go to the city I have a list of restaurants I want to visit. This spot being one of them. I thoroughly enjoyed my experience - from the food, to the service to the atmosphere. Come here if you want a great time and great food.

I love the downtown Seattle location's atmosphere! The only issue is that it can be a little busy and sometimes the wait is long between check-ins from the server. The food is incredible and, of course, the wine is amazing. Would recommend for a nice date night!

I had lunch with my coworkers there for the first time. The atmosphere was good, really like their wine case. The food was good - I ordered the Spaghetti and meatballs - so so good. The only complaint I have is that the wait time was too long. I was there during the peak lunchtime, so I think this could be acceptable. Also, they have great dessert menu. I had the Creme Brulee. I definitely will be back to try them all haha.
We had a party of 6. Service was prompt and our server was very knowledgeable about menu items.
Pretty good food and a cute place.
Amazing pizza! The wine (of course) is amazing as well. I'll be back again soon.
