Could have been a 5 except for the screaming kids. Don't go here for a quiet dining experience.
The food, wine, service and atmosphere were great. Had a great girls night out here. Will definitely be going back.
Pleasant place for weekend out! Parking is a little inconvenient though.
I love the sandwiches and salads but they are very expensive. Salads will run you close to $15 not including drink or anything else.
we really enjoyed this place. great food and great ambiance.
Ambiance is lovely. The food here is delicious! I'm a huge fan of the baked brie. Will come back for more!

This is always a restaurant that I get excited to go to. It can sometimes get a little loud, but the food always makes up for it! I had a special of theirs a while back that was a steak and risotto dish, and I still dream about it! The service is almost always good, and the food is amazing, but I'd highly recommend making a reservation!

This is the place to go for great wine sampling. Whether you try a flight or taste by the glass, the selection of wine here is extensive. They have really great small plates and happy hour prices as well.

I just had a 20 person party in one if the back rooms at The Purple and the staff, food and wine were amazing. The pairings were superb. Anna and Tyler did such a great job, I remember Anna from another very positive dining experience there. I so appreciate her style. She was attentive and handled the crowd with such professionalism. I would highly recommend The Purple!
The food was incredible, the staff was super sweet and the cocktails were perfect. If only I was wealthy, I'd go all the time..
Went there for dinner last night before a show. The service was excellent and the food was amazing!
Great place to visit.
Really good, nice ambiance.
Good food, good service and comfortable seating! Loved the layout and different options for dining and drinking here. Also a bit pricey.
Great food but service can be improved!!!

I always get something from the tasting bar including the wine pairing. I am never disappointed here; try the duck liver pate or the curry lamb empanada. The atmosphere at the purple in downtown is always good and waitresses are super nice. It is noisy, so get ready to have a loud conversation.
Great Happy Hour in Kirkland. I like the Beef carpaccio, not for the vegans, but I love it especially when it is washed with some Pinot Noir
I ordered the pesto pasta...delicious! My favorite dish we tried...goat cheese topped with cranberries appetizer. yes...yum!
Just amazinggg... Great service, nice cocktails..

I was contacted through Yelp, by the Manager, after I left my previous review. He offered apologies and wanted to try to make things right. His apologies were greatly appreciated. It says a lot. I will be back.
Fun wines and cheeses!

If you go to Purple, take your time and settle in. Enjoy a flight of wine and cheese pairing or something else before you order. I'm definitely not a wine buff and my wife is no expert, but we enjoy the ability to have a relaxing conversation and enjoy some new wines we normally wouldn't try. The staff is very helpful in recommending combinations and they don't make you feel out of place if you aren't a wine expert. The entrees have all been quite good and very reasonably priced, with the exception of the lobster mac' n cheese (although it is well worth the $27). My only complaint is how cold it sometimes feels. I would love to see a nice fireplace added to warm things up in the winter.
My favorite lunch spot downtown. One of the best wine lists in Seattle
Tha experience was amazing as always!
Coolest place ever!!!

This is such a cool place. I just found them for the first time. The decor is amazing and reminds me of something you would see in LA. The food was so good. For the prices they charge I thought they should have given you larger portions. It isn't a place I would go all the time due to the cost but it is really nice for once in a while.

Great environment to bring a friend and drink some wine! Don't go there if you want to have an intimate conversation because it's loud. All the hard surfaces make for a loud environment. Loved the food and enjoyed the Rafanelli 06 zin for $75.

Purple is a wonderful place. We did the cheese and wine pairing and it was delightful. They are only missing 5 stars because my customer service experience from the male bartender was not good. Everyone else was great though. Ill be back for sure.

Just had a group business lunch here and was impressed with the decor and the taste of the food. Service was solid and the wine list was very deep. We ate upstairs in the balcony the space is small but quite enough during the lunch hour to carry on conversations.

I love their lamb burger and sea salt caramel desserts. The pork sirloin was so-so. What was that they put over the meat? Caramelized sweet radish? It just doesn't go well with the meat. Service was good and the atmosphere was lively.

Great wine selection and a very cool decor. The wine markup isnt so bad, but that should be expected at a wine bar. They have a great wine list and good options for tastings of wine and cheeses by the flight. The bar doesnt know how to make a martini, but once again they are a wine bar. If anything, I would say they should simplify the food menu. I found it to be too many choices, found myself spending too much time reviewing the menu, but I went there for wine and appetizers, not for dinner, so I may be biased.
DInnerFood was good
Lobster Mac n' cheese. that's all i got to say.

Purple Cafe and Wine Bar is a fantastic spot that deserves five stars. The pasta was absolutely delicious, bursting with flavor and perfectly prepared. The ambiance was lovely, creating an inviting and elegant atmosphere that made the meal even more enjoyable. The service was standard but efficient, allowing the food and setting to shine. Overall, it's a wonderful place for a great dining experience. Highly recommend!

We had a wonderful experience at this restaurant! The food was absolutely delicious as was the service. I ordered the grilled lamb chops and my wife had the dungeoness crab pasta. Both were amazing. We also ordered the spicy prawns which had a kick but were so tasty. And finished it off with the vanilla bean creme brulee.

Lovely service - the waitress was kind and accommodated a table of our choice. The place gets loud, so best to take a table or two away from the crowd if you can. Food was great - we had the calamari and pasta and both were great. Cocktails were top notch and no complaints.
Very very good indeed This is the perfect date or group dining spot.Absolutely fantastic little spot in downtown Seattle.

Purple Caf and Wine Bar in Seattle truly delivers an exceptional experience. The ambiance instantly captures you, creating a perfect backdrop for the exquisite food. The wine and cocktail selection is top-notch, perfectly complementing the culinary delights. Highly recommended for those seeking an unparalleled dining journey

Food was great, and surprisingly they weren't busy at all for mothers day when we got there. No complaints except i wish they had checked on us a little more. I had to keep looking for someone when I needed water, or napkins or to order.Kid-friendliness: They do have a kids menu and were great to my kiddo for mothers day
Love it, amazing service, amazing ambiance, foods amazing don't know what else you could ask for.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Purple Cafe and Wine Bar and I have to say, it was an absolutely fantastic experience from start to finish! From the moment I walked in, I was struck by the elegant and inviting atmosphere. The decor is sophisticated and stylish, with plenty of seating options to suit any preference.The menu is full of delicious and creative dishes that are made with high-quality ingredients and cooked to perfection. I especially loved the cheese and charcuterie board, which was beautifully presented and paired perfectly with the wine selection. Speaking of wine, the wine list is extensive and impressive, with a great selection of wines from around the world to choose from.The service was also top-notch, with friendly and knowledgeable staff who were always available to answer questions and make recommendations. The attention to detail was evident in everything from the presentation of the dishes to the quality of the stemware used for the wine.One of the things that really stood out to me was the emphasis on sustainability and locally sourced ingredients. It's clear that the restaurant takes great care in selecting the best possible ingredients, which adds an extra layer of quality to every dish.Overall, I would highly recommend Purple Cafe and Wine Bar to anyone looking for a memorable dining experience in an elegant and sophisticated setting. Whether you're celebrating a special occasion or just looking for a great night out, this place is sure to exceed your expectations. I can't wait to come back and try more of their amazing dishes and wines!
Good service, good food, highly recommend!
Beautiful atmosphere, delicious wine. Stopped in for a quick drink on our way to a show.

Wow-what a great time we had at Purple.There were 6 of us. We had drinks, apps, entrees and desert. All of the food was exceptional.The service was top notch too. The server was always there.One other positive is the restaurant was not loud and we could actually hear each other from the other side of the table. In some restaurants, its so loud you cant hear the person next to you when they are yelling in your ear. Not here!Highly recommended!
This was a great place. Great wine selection and food.  Service was very nice and informative.

I've been to this place two years ago for my husband's birthday. The interior has a cool vibe and there is an impressive wine display. The staff were friendly. I loved the bone marrow appetizer and the seared scallop main course. This place is on the quieter side for a wine bar. I'd recommend this place.

This place is perfect for a lunch date or dinner date. The atmosphere is calm and soothing and let's talk about their meals! They're well done and absolutely delicious! Dessert was a bit dry but I generally loved the whole experience. The dcor is poetic from the choice of color and accessories in the establishment. The special service offered for a romantic date is just on another level. I think it would be had for any person to turn down an engagement  or wedding proposal that is made in this establishment. More to the service and the dcor, the accommodation facilities befit loyalty. Spending a night at the establishment is an epic experience. I would definitely come back for a second date at this place and recommend it to my friends with a lot of confidence.

OK, so I am writing this about pre-COVID Purple, in the hopes that soon we will be back to normal post-COVID Purple.It's one of my favorite places for a date night, from the ambiance, to the amazing food, to the fabulous wine pairings.A wine flight at Purple was always a wonderful trip. I am holding the vision of doing more of them sometime soon....viva la Purple!
Amazing restaurant! Great staff and excellent communication
nice place, nice people, good prices

I always enjoy the service and food at Purple. I've been here before multiple times and liked it. The food and wine are always consistent. Our server was fabulous and made the whole dining experience remarkable.

I found this place by chance. I found the food excellent, and the wine list was impressive. We had the cranberry chicken salad and Lobster Mac & cheese. We enjoyed our meal so much.Everyone was incredibly friendly & helpful.
Yum yum yum! This is one of my favorite spots up north and the wine list is amazing! Try the lobster mac and cheese and you won't be disappointed :)

Delicious food and the wine selection is AWESOME. I don't know if they have it on the menu anymore but awhile back they had a lobster mac and cheese which was FANTASTIC. I hope they bring it back to the menu.
Love this place! Been back several times. Everything is great, but especially the cocktails. Delicious.
Located downtown seattle. Great food and ambience.  The service was amazing. Our server was on top of it and extremely helpful. High quality food. The place is beautifully decorated. Highly recommend

Wow, SUCH friendly service! And the view is great. I have nothing to complain about here at all, I'll be back for sure! I had a great cabernet that I forget the name of, I hope they remember what it is haha.
Fantastic place! Food was incredible coupled with excellent service. Very nice wine selection.
It was simply amazing. Everything was great. The Brie is amazing and the mushroom soup.
Good food and really great staff.

So good! We came on a Tuesday night around 7pm, and they were already packed! We ended up waiting about 15 minutes for some seats at the bar. The ambiance is great -- dim lighting that worked seamlessly with the high ceilings & impressive floor-to-ceiling wine tower. The wait staff was extremely friendly, and made great food recommendations! We tried:- the Riesling -- sweet and fruity!- baked brie -- no need to elaborate, just get it.- seafood stew -- recommended by our waiter, and it was so good! Will definitely be back if I'm ever in town again, but perhaps with a reservation next time.

I am not usually someone who leaves reviews but i was so impressed with Purple Cafe that I thought I should! The following was excellent 1.)Making a reservation over the phone2.Being welcomed at the door3.)Service 4.) FoodFood was off the charts. I impressed my entire family. Thank you for making a special night perfect!
Love, love, love this restaurant! I've never had a bad meal here. Our sommelier last night was so attentive, and helpful. He made our night.
Great service. Food is delicious. Very crowded. Make sure to make reservations before going in.

We went here for lunch, everyone at the table ordered a glass of wine and salmon with rice. Great atmosphere, business professional setting. Excellent waiter! I highly recommend this location and we will be back again.

We got a table for four almost immediately. The service was friendly and the staff very attentive. We REALLY Really enjoyed our meal here. Probably one of the best corned beef hash I've had. The corned beef was tender, flavorful; potatoes perfectly fried; delicious rye bread and two fried eggs on top. My friend had the fried egg sandwich (provolone, bacon, egg, greens) which he thought was great. We had a vegan with us as well and the server said the chefs are really good at accommodating food requests. They made the Espanola vegan by replacing the eggs with more veggies and avocados. Everyone was satisfied. Great service as well. Facility was clean including the bathrooms. I can confidently recommend Purple Cafe to others!
This place was amazing! The atmosphere was perfect and the food was unbelievable. The staff could not have been nicer!

Purple Cafe was highly recommended, and exceeded my expectations! The decor is elegant and modern with an interesting wine twist. The menu is varied and satisfying. However, the true highlight is the staff... They were warm, charming, and so knowledgeable about their products & features! Janice, the Sommelier is elegant with a fun spirit, and will guide your wine journey like a true professional. This place is legit!

Love so many things about this place. Great wine selection and lovely small plates. I also had one of the best soups I've ever had here--it was the soup of day so sadly it isn't there all the time. I've been here several times and it's always good. Even nice if you are flying solo and just want to sit at the bar.
One of my favorite downtown spots for wine. Vast selection and very good service. I also recommend the lamb sirloin or crab cakes here. They're ******* outrageous.
I work near by and decided to check it out after work. So good!!. Came back two days in a row because i was so in love! Definitely a new after work unwind spot. Love it!

Went to Purple caf with my fianc on our first anniversary and it was perfect date!!It was so beautiful inside(especially the wine tower) and the service was good, food was great.Everything was perfect and even our server gave me a wine for free when I told him that we are here to celebrate the anniversary. I would like to visit again!
Walked in based on yelp review and we're not disappointed. Amazing!! Every dish was a culinary delight.
Love love love this place!! Amazing food to die for and an even more wonderful wine list! This is a must go spot for everyone!
Great atmosphere/food/wine, easy parking

We just had tapas and drinks. Everything was very tasty. Decor is modern/eclectic. Service was very good and helpful with suggestions. Oh yeah, desserts were great... try the chocolate caramels with sea salt.
Great food, ambiance and service. Worth every penny!!!
YUM! The pizza special was soooo good! And, they have great wine too.
This is by far my favorite resturant, everything on the menu is absolutely fabulous! Great for happy hour!
Great, creative food. Loved the wine flights! Made me want to take a vacation to the vineyards! Waitstaff was very pleasant, patient and helpful. Cool ambiance too.
LOVE!!
Nice atmosphere...service is excellent...if your in downtown Seattle. You should definitely stop by and grab a drink...will not be disappointed..lots of attractive women around...
Everything was perfect. Food was amazing!!! Service was great. Price was right.
This place is SO good, and gets better every time!

I love Purple Cafe! Their baked Brie is to die for. And, I am in love with their lobster mac. Did I mention how much I love their baked Brie? Warm right out of the oven, melting all over the plate, fresh cut grapes on top with fresh baked rosemary flat bread. #mmm
Great small plate menu
Amazing, from start to finish!

I recently had the opportunity to take my girlfriend here for her birthday. I wanted to take her somewhere nice and make it memorable for her. She's a wine and cheese lover so I knew she'd appreciate this place but I also wanted to take her here so she could try something new as she doesn't have a very adventurous palate.First off, the ambiance was nice and romantic. She loved the tower of wine and spiral staircase in the middle of the restaurant. We started off upstairs in the lounge with a drink while we waited for our table and then headed to our table where we chose from the Tasting Bar menu.She was feeling a little adventurous so we had the the Duck Liver Pate and the Ahi Tuna Poke which were both spectacular. For our entrees, the lady chose Duck Confit and I had Filet Mignon. She LOVED the Duck and couldn't stop raving about it.After the numerous bottles of wine and all the delicious food, I'd say we had a pretty sexy evening.
Amazing!
Love it. Really nice place. Try their salty caramel chocolates :)
I went with my boyfriend last night for a "date night" very classy and ultra hip and modern.

Took my girl here for " date night" and they did not disappoint.The atmosphere is perfect for a nice semi classy date. They had great food options beautiful selection of wine choices.Try a few different wine flights, its a better bang for your buck kind of thing.You will not be disappointed. Oh and save room for desert!
Great Place great wines!
SO AMAZING! I had the lobster mac & cheese and it was to die for!
Great place for lunch or dinner. Definitely worth a try!

Five of us sat down Saturday for a last minute 10pm reservation and we started by asking the waiter for an exciting, well priced, bottle of Pinot. Naturally, we got the look one gets when asking for exciting pinot and a "Well, pinots are usually more mellow than exciting," yes we said, exciting but mellow will be fine.That interaction managed us the sommelier who came, chatted, and quickly returned with a few fist fulls of bottles and glasses and our dinner for 5 turned into a wine tasting for 5. We all learned something, and chose a bottle, which was great. We dared not ask its cost though we had asked for "value." A few "tasting" rounds of apps, some salads, and some great entrees, I had the pork, done nicely, and the to die for deserts..... we picked up another bottle. The check arrived and our new favorite was only $30, very nice Purple, very nice.But what blows me away about this place is the size of the space. It has got to be one of the biggest, openest venues in seattle with the giant wine rack spiraling up the middle. I think you just feel really good here, you feel out and alive as you look at the downtown buildings though the two story windows. Just go already.....
Do yourself a favor and get yourself a cheese plate with a wine pairing. DIVINE! Great Atmosphere and great booze. I'll be back

I'm usually not that big on salads, but theirs are fantastic. The roasted red pepper & goat cheese one is something I have cravings for from time to time, and the apple, walnut & stilton salad is great, too (it comes with a light, sweet, interesting champagne vinaigrette).Mondays are half-price bottle night. Recently, I was here with two friends and we shared a cheese flight to start, then we each had an entree and dessert, plus we shared a great bottle of pinot noir. It worked out to $33 each, including tip. You can't beat that!Their sorbets are always creative, fresh and delicious, and I love their sea salt caramels (you can now get an order of sea salt caramels to go, by the way! They make a great hostess gift).I love the decor here, too. Service is a tad slow, but knowledgable and friendly. When my husband and I went to lunch here as a little celebration on the day we picked up our marriage certificate, they brought us out champagne and sea salt caramels--on the house!We go here five or six times a year, and every single experience has been great!
If I could, I'd fly to Seattle just to have dinner here. J'tadore, Purple.
BEST wine bar hands down. Killer Filet Minion!
We were there for our anniversary and we love it! Our first time and certainly won't be our last!

What can I say. I loooove Purple. The General Manager (Stephanie) is wonderful and always makes sure we are well taken care of. Their spectacular daily Risotto specials rarely fall under 5 stars. And they have a few nice selections of wine..hahaha.
It is a great place, in my opinion the best overall restaurant in Seattle. The service is excellent, the food is good enough and the setting is just perfect.

DO NOT PLACE AN ONLINE ORDER!  They had technical difficulties, didn't fulfill the order, but charged us anyway. The manager, Natalie called me the next day to see if we wanted the order filled still. I said no and not to charge us for it or refund us the money. I was charge and never received a credit. I tried for over a month to get it credited. Called every number (there are 3 different numbers listed on google, their website and the credit card stmt 206-584-2998, 206-206-1838, 206-420-3831 and none of them will get through to a person! I finally went in person to get it resolved and spoke to Natalie face-to-face. She remembered me and the technical problems. She took copies of the receipts and apologized that none or the phone numbers worked and she didn't know why the credit hadn't been issued. She gave me her personal cell and said to call her if I still didn't receive the credit. I called her 3x over a 2 week period. Not a single returned phone call and STILL NO CREDIT!!!!
Customer service at Capitol Hill location is getting worse and worse !The owner and manager should fix this ASAP.

The food here is amazing. The management has fallen hard over the last year. "We don't have eggs" After we ordered online and paid for it. "We didn't see your online order, we will put it in now and it will be ready in 20 minutes". *Standing at the front door for over 5 minutes before greeting*. Orders are wrong about 25% of the time. It's as if they don't care really. Good thing there is a new ramen place that just opened 2 blocks away.

I grew up in Chiba Japan, and ramen is a part of my life...firstly, it is too expensive for a bowl of ramen. and their ramen is nothing special. I am sure they know they cannot survive even one week in Japan with their quality and taste. I have to say this, however, but employees were wonderful! But sorry, to me, ramen is not about how friendly employees are... to me, ramen must be all about taste but nothing. fancy interior is not important at all.
Used to be great. Now slow and poor drink selection.

The host is unwelcoming. He should be replaced.The ramen was not good at all. The amount was small. I ordered extra noodles but I received it on a plate. I dumped the extra noodles in the bowl. There wasn't enough broth. The noodles were overcooked. The water was disgustingly lukewarm. None of the waiters knew who had what...I never recommend restaurants where waiters ask who had what. It's your job as a waiter to deliver the food from the kitchen to the proper person. That's the core task of being a waiter. Get it right. Four waiters came out with our food. It wasn't even timed properly. All four waiters asked 'who had what'.It was simply annoying.We were a party of eight and paid 18% gratuity for this poor service.

This place used to be fantastic, but their service has taken a nosedive recently. Lately, I've consistently waited an astonishing 20-30 minutes (no exaggeration) for the check. They rarely check on you for additional drink orders or refill your water, and there's often a frustrating 5-minute wait at the host stand before anyone greets or seats you. While I understand staffing shortages, it appears that there are just as many employees as before, but their coordination has seriously deteriorated. It's disheartening because this used to be my go-to neighborhood spot, but after my last five visits, I'm seriously considering not returning.
Relatively mediocre food compared to other places in cap hill. If you have a choice, other ramen places are probably a better bet. Edamame was undercooked, ramen was okay...service was good.

In Seattle staying at a hotel. We ordered for delivery. We didn't receive our potstickers. I asked for soy sauce and red chili sauce. Received neither. I asked for an extra empty bowl so we could share, because I told them we were two people. Got the bowl, got only ONE spoon, even though I clearly stated we are 2 people. I asked them to send the ramen hot since there is no microwave in this hotel room. It arrived cold. And even after I located a microwave 30 floors away from us, the ramen was terrible. I called the listed restaurant number numerous times and nobody answered. I've emailed them and waiting on a response.

Noodles are too soft... I thought ramen was supposed to be firm has bite. This reminds me of more like Chinese noodles. or just mistake?? I arent sure since it was my first time to have ramen here. Maybe I should try one more time. Though they had great service.
Ramen was good but forgetful; service was terrible and unforgetful.
Cramped. Very small and over priced. Will not be coming back here again.
So-so ramen
Good ramen options but not as many without pork and beef! Chicken tan tan is great option
Good value and yummy noodles. Try the Gonzaga. Casual, bustling atmosphere and good takeaway

nice ramen in seattlei always order Uber Eat for this oneit taste very goodbut i ordered 5 times uber eat for this restaurantthey sent me the wrong food twicefor examplei ordered miso ramenbut they gave me the other ramenbut anywaykizuki is still a good restaurant
was not impressed with the taste and quality of the food, even though received a good quality service. Don't think I will go there again.

First time at this restaurant, nice decor. The food was okay they have food that suits most diets. I was a bit uncomfortable because there was a staff group of 5 people standing in the middle of the floor just talking and staring, and I mean the stares where they don't look off when you notice them. Other than that food was fine, nothing crazy good or that flavorful.

Food here was great, although dish was not really clean. The lady who served our food had her finger almost dipped in the broth which I found it gross. We ordered spicy ramen, karaage don and house salad. Everything tasted good.

It was pretty good ramen and it was a slightly dimmed seating area that i liked. I spotted a lipstick mark on my water cup but i couldnt seem to flag down the wait staff until i was done but it was busy so thats probably why.

The ramen was delicious but I prefer the low sodium because I nearly finished all my water and was full before I could even finish it. The service was amazing, the waiter brought extra condiments for the ramen that he suggested. And the ambiance was beautiful and very clean. You can see the food being made through the kitchen/bar.
Popular place with pretty good ramen.

This was my first time using this restaurant. I wanted a specific restaurant and they seemed to be the only ones delivering for them now. Everything went well. Driver was fast and courteous. Wait time was a tad longer than I thought it should be. Will use them again.
We tried few Ramen places in Seattle. This is the best one.
Great food!I like how they have mouthwash in the restrooms!

We've been to a couple ramen puts in Seattle, and this is unquestionably one of my new top picks. I requested the garlic tonkatsu stock with pork tummy and kale noodles, and it turned out consummately. The administration was quick and the staff is well disposed and pleasant. The air is extraordinary as well, and in a decent area.
Good ramen. Rice dishes are okay.
Been here twice. Great service and good ramen
Broth was really good. Only one slice of pork meat but everything was done really well.
Great place to get some quick noodles and/or tempura. Would definitely come back.
My family and I enjoyed it, but certainly not the best ramen in town.
Not bad. But not as good as expected.Well decorated restaurant.

The wait is reasonable on Friday night. The price range is also reasonable. The food is good and the slice of pork the have with the ramen is actually pan fried a little bit too, you don't really get that in other ramen restaurant.
yummy
A little piece of Japan in Cap Hill. Worth a try!
Nice place to go. But not as good as I expected, but worth going!
Really great flavors! Lots of menu options as well. First time here and we will be coming back.
kizuki is the most consistent ramen I've ever had. It's always delicious and the staff are always kind and friendly!
Really great place. Food was great, servers were great. Loved it so much went back two days later. Highly recommend.

Server was very nice, sat us down quickly. At Kizukis servers are very nice. Helped out with our crying children and gave them coloring books. The food was amazing. The Garlic Tonkatsu was very flavorful. The Pork broth is very good. The noodles are cooked to perfection and it all around was an amazing experience. Would come again.
amazing food, love the service. the ambiance is nice too. I really enjoyed the ramen. Its in my top 10 for sure
The food here is amazing with super kind and fast service ! Absolutely no complaints :)

Kizuki Ramen offers a delightful dive into authentic Japanese flavors. The broth is rich and flavorful, with layers of umami that feel both comforting and indulgent. Each noodle slurp perfectly balances tenderness with a satisfying chew. Toppings, like the chashu and seasoned egg, are prepared with evident care, adding to the overall symphony of tastes and textures. For those in search of a genuine ramen experience outside of Japan, Kizuki is a must-visit.
Great place. Wouldn't recommend elsewhere presentation of entrees well enjoyed. Will be returning back.
Radiooooo Emory identify pogo hacks
Great food and fantastservservice'
Love the ramen is amazing and Dillion!!!
Good food! Love the place, gives a great and tranquil vibe
Dillon and Danielle were excellent!!
Phenomenal staff, phenomenal food. Very quick and courteous service. 10/10 would recommend to anyone.

This Ramen is mouthwatering delicious and flavorful Japanese food. I highly recommend this place to anyone who loves traditional Japanese food and the staff is very helpful and friendly here. I love eating here and enjoyed my lunch here at this 5 star Japanese restaurant.
Both the food and service was amazing! Love this place. My new favorite spot

Just stumbled across while wondering the city. Shoyu ramen is light refreshing broth with nice katsuo flavor. Silky noodles that slurp down, the fried pork and togarashi pepper elevate ramen to next level. Along with the soft boiled and tender Chashu, and crunch from Chinese broccoli. This Shoyu Ramen may be the best I ever had.

The place was Excellent with its good ambiance. The interior was innovative, spacious with great lighting. One of the best Ramen in Downtown. The service was fantastic, thoughtful, prompt, and knowledgeable.Amazing ramen that will serve traditional and low sodium. Got their light sodium option for most ramen except veggies and miso. The portion was just right enough to fill you comfortably. The appetizers were great. I can't wait to come back and try more.

ATE THE PLATE OF GYOZA in 3 minutes!!!!Just landed in Seattle from a bumpy flight...and knew exactly what would fix that! Ramen. From the reviews this place gets busy. Walked in a greeted warmly by the service staff. My server recommended Pork Gyoza (which I could get anywhere) but what the heck. It was pretty perfectly cooked, crisp and carmelized on one side and soft on the other. The dipping sauce was tangy with a bite of spice. Could be maybe the best Pork Gyoza I can remember having. Sooo good I ate all 5 pieces in about 3 minutes!!! That must be record time! No shame here...and I sipped on the dipping sauce. I am sure not the only one who does that?!?! For my ramen I had the Yuzu Shio. I will be honest with you I'm a Tongkatsu black garlic kind of a girl. But I think I have changed my way. The Yuzu Shio was simple, flavorful and hit the spot. Pork was so tender and perfectly balanced by the french sea salt. I would be all wrong it I didn't mention the soft boiled egg. You know you're giving 5 STARS when most of runny YOKE ends up on your upper lip as you slurp up the brothly goodness. Kizuki thanks for doing it right!!.
Food was excellent, there was a bit of a wait but it was definitely worth it

Kizuki was absolutely amazing. I'd been craving ramen all day, and it was everything I hoped for. I ordered the garlic tonkotsu ramen, which was savory, garlicy (of course), and had delicious, we'll-balanced flavors. The egg was soft-boiled to perfection too. My girlfriend ordered the vegetarian ramen, which was delicious and flavorful as well. Hers was packed with tasty, well-cooked veggies. This place is great, and I highly recommend it for anyone in Seattle who's looking for ramen.
A very busy location. Can be over an hour wait near lunchtime if sitting in, or 20 minutes if to go. But the wait is worth it as the food is delicious. Some of the best ramen in Seattle.

After multiple locals suggested this place, finally put my thought of ramen aside. Ended up having to wait about 1 hours for a table, but it was 110% worth the wait!! This place exceeded my expectations by far! Great food and great service. Definitely suggest the pork belly steamed buns and the spicy chicken ramen dish. Both were to die for!! If your thinking, it's just ramen...your wrong. I haven't had them since college, but I could eat at Kizuki Ramen & Izakaya everyday!! Yummm
Nice interior and ambiance!
First time trying this place out and it was amazinggg. Probably one of the best broth that I've consumed and the ramen was al dente
Amazing ramen! Almost as good as in Japan
This is a place where I hang out during my off days I love to go here food is good and service is good too

This is a very popular place because the ramen is so delicious! We each had a different ramen and came away so happily satisfied. I love Japanese food but have never really wanted to eat ramen. We were there in January 2016 and it was cold and snowing. Ramen sounded so good and so we drove over there. It's near my niece's college (Seattle University). Parking was a bit difficult but I found a little pay parking lot through the GPS and it was a few dollars and was in a safe area. Lots of students and office types at the restaurant. The food came out quickly. My daughter couldn't get over the delicious half cooked egg that came with her ramen. She had never tasted anything so delicious and she always talks about it. Not only was her egg delicious but the soup was wonderful too. We would highly recommend this place.

I am not a huge ramen fan, but this place is sooo good. The ramen was amazing, the texture of the noodles was excellent. I have a severe craving for this place and have put it into my rotation of places to go on the Hill.
Garlic Tonkotsu, you taste sooooo good
Best ramen in Seattle! The broth is really rich and flavorful. Everything you can wish for in a ramen!
I love this place!!!! the food and service is outstanding!

First of all this place is amazingly clean and fresh...my server Tina was extremely attentive and helpful. Food came out maybe 4-5 min after I ordered and I don't think I have to say how delicious it was.. They kept on refilling my water and tea. And unlikely other most fast food/ fine dining places they don't rush you out of the door ! Great atmosphere and awesome decoration . My favorite ramen at kukai is Garlic tonkotsu low sodium and even thou I choose to get a lighter broth it's still very rich and flavorful. Professional staff with great attitude . Absolutely be back here another 18492047193 times probably .
Visited to get some fresh pasta, however our pasta noodles were uncooked, dry, hard and cold.

For the price of this joint, it is not worth it!! The pasta had a bitter taste and the noodles were hard af! I rather have gone to Olive Garden! That should tell you! Also the parking here is ridiculous ! 15$ fuck that.
Not worth the price! Came because of yelp and left very dissatisfied!!! The pasta was hard and tasted sour and rancid !! Save your money ppl believe me!!!

Looks pretty and the ingredients are very fresh. However, the pasta here is so salty that it is almost impossible to eat it. I forced myself to eat it because I was hungry, but my partner left half of her food. I drank 2 and a half cups of water...

As my first Italian dinner in Seattle, Due Cucina promised a tantalizing experience that left me with a taste of enthusiasm, albeit tinged with a hint of disappointment. My friends' and my culinary journey encompassed an array of classic dishes, including Spaghetti bolognese, Mushroom & White Truffle Oil pasta, Carbonara with Campanelle, and Braised Beef Ragu. Unfortunately, the Carbonara with Campanelle failed to meet the lofty expectations, as it lacked the richness that I had anticipated. However, it was the Mushroom & White Truffle Oil pasta that stole the show, surpassing my expectations with its fragrance and flavor. While the unique sausage in the dish showcased the restaurant's creativity, it didn't align with my personal preferences. Lastly, the Braised Beef Ragu' emerged as a satisfactory choice but it wasn't mind-blowing Considering the price and the hype surrounding Due Cucina, my overall experience left me moderately enthusiastic in spite of the nice staff and the warm ambiance.
I had pasta with chicken, lemon and pistachio. The fresh pasta was really good and cooked al dente. The sauce, however, was flavourless an very salty.

The mushroom and truffle oil healthy pasta has an excellent flavor. The noodles were well-cooked. They have a good selection of foods. The oxtail ragout was so tasty and has pleasant flavor. The menu was extensive and lots of options. Great quality of pastas. TSo amazing drinks, cocktails were so cool.The restaurant has nice seating. It has great ambiance inside. Worth the price!

One of my most favorite Italian restaurants! This place is very casual. Perfect for a quick group meal. Their pastas are made in-house, and my most favorite is their campanelle which I always pair with their kale pesto pasta. This place to me is like comfort food and their prices are unbeatable for the quality.
Really tasty dishes and I like the specials they offer. The chefs here are quite talented and offer really unique options. A bit pricey but worth it

I have been in the health kick for a few months now and came across this joint in Cap Hill. I was hesitant to try it but it has received great reviews. I'm glad I did. The pasta was simple, fresh and delicioso!

Due Cocina Italiana has great food, with fresh ingredients and tasty dishes. The service is excellent, with friendly and helpful staff. The place has a cozy and welcoming atmosphere, perfect for a casual meal. Even though it's fast food, the experience feels high-quality and enjoyable. Highly recommended for a quick and delicious Italian meal.
Great food, fun staff and fast service whether you're picking up or sitting down. Thanks always Due'

Consistently _great_ pasta that reminds me of what pasta is actually like all over Italy. I love the concept, I've been all over the menu, I will eat here again and again. Also they have a reference-quality Tiramisu.

Cozy atmosphere, a tasty, wonderful experience. First time dining in after my parents recommended it. Our server was awesome with perfect service. My husband had the Braised Hen & Citrus; the sauce was flavorful. My Traditional Bolognese was the perfect texture and had ample serving. Also, everyone was nice and very accommodating!
Food was amazing. The Cashier Sam was so welcoming and helpful thank you so much for that drink recommendation I am obsessed.
I love coming here totally worth the drive from Tacoma. The service is always great and the food is amazing!
Awesome place. Chicken Alfredo was amazing. Service was great! And they even gave an awesome bday cake for my boyfriend!
The most flavorful pasta in Seattle! Will be back again and again and again and again and... :)

An upscale Italian restaurant sitting right here in Capital Hill, Seattle. All ingredients are fresh and all the pasta is handmade, you cant get more authentic then this. I recommend having the lamb meatballs with bucatini noodles.
This has got to the most amazing place to eat the food the service 5 Wow come see for yourselves.
Yum! Great white pasta options. I like their caprice too. If you like Italiana, stop by here!

I loved the pasta and the pizza from this pasta restaurant. Especially, their pesto pasta, the taste was so heavenly.  The waiter was so pleasant to talk with and accommodating as well.  The food was served well plated and quickly. This place is indeed great for a fancy night out. It feels like. I'm dining in a 5-star restaurant.

One of the best Italian restaurants in Seattle. I've mostly gone for Seattle Restaurant Week - this year they provided their entire menu which couldn't be better. The ambiance is nice and romantic, the service is exceptional and the waiters/waitresses I've had are always very educated on the menu. Most importantly the pasta is amazing! Highly recommend!
Five star for sureSuch a great place Can not love it moreSuper super delicious food and sauce

This shop has a pasta that is so good! the sauce is very tasty and the way they cooked it is just right. I enjoyed it while I am watching my favorite movie. I will order again to share it with my friends.Thanks, Due' Cucina Italiana!
Fresh made pasta. Simple delicious menu everything fresh. Love it because it's awesome and it's fresh
My and my best friend's favorite restaurant. Everything we have tried is incredible.
Honestly how can anyone hate on pasta. This place is fantastic.
Great food great service ....!!!
I appreciate the napkins here. The Lasagna Bolognase was 7.5/10. Service and experience was 10/10.

Went to dueminuti with some friends this evening and we had a great time! The casual atmosphere of the restaurant that serves great, healthy, inexpensive Italian food left us full and happy. My favourite dish from the restaurant was the pasta with oxtail ragu, and the spaghetti with tomato sauce. Having less carbs in their pasta also meant that I didn't leave the restaurant feeling bloated, I am still feeling full now after a few hours instead of feeling hungry again, which usually happens with normal pasta. There were 8 of us and we ordered a few dishes to share, the bill came up to just over $80.

I went to this store with my friends last Friday. I love this place! I had basil pesto and my friend had ox tail. My spaghetti was perfectly al-dente that you would usually have to pay $20 or more for this quality of pasta at other restaurants in Seattle BUT theirs was only about $10. I think their pasta is the best quality and best price in town.

I have no word other than "fantastic"! Sounds like the owner is an Italian man and firstly they had great service. But that wasn't "fantastic" part of this store. Their pasta is the best in town. I must come back soon.
Definitely the best restaurant in town.My family tried to find a good restaurant to visit every week.This restaurant is my pick of last week.Thank you for the service.

Everything about this place says that this is the future of pasta! Healthy pasta (made with 9 different grains as explained by the chef), a herb wall (hello urban farming), house-cured or artisanal meats and sauces made from scratch. The food itself is fresh and honest! The pastas have a rich, nutty flavour and a great texture and the sauces are bold, flavourful and tastes like.... real food! I ordered the basil pesto (the best I ever had) and my friends got the artisanal sausage with broccoli and Amatriciana. We couldn't pick a favourite. I never thought healthy food could taste so good! Oh don't forget to try their homemade sourdough too! It's the real deal!!I'm giving 5 stars for the food, vibe, price point, friendly staff and cleanliness!
Food was ok and owner was rude honestly won't be coming back would rather go somewhere else.

Always skeptical of hyperbolic, overly warm & fuzzy reviews (especially those that refer to staff by name) but thought I'd take a chance anyway. No luck this time. Food was edible yet nothing at all extraordinary. But the service, staff, ambiance (cold, loud, uncomfortable furniture) completely failed. So who is writing all those verbose, glowing reviews? I think I know.....
So a nice surprise. Can't remember how I heard about it but the food was great. The owner was around and was a nice personable guy. Will be back!
Always a fun spot to stop in and grab an interesting hand made drink and fun small plate.

The staff were super nice especially a new waitress who said she'd only been working there for an hour I think her name was Griselda the atmosphere was fun and they had a string quartet playing French music with a French singer.

Inside was a good amount of seats and a long bar. Rows of bottles on both sides of the wall. Outdoor patio dining as well. Great setting. The owner was friendly and helpful. Happy hour drinks and food every day. Food options were so much more than just bar food. Since there were only two of us, we will come back to try more of their menu. The fried chicken entre came with three pieces and sides of creamy coleslaw and Mac salad. The chicken was so crunchy on the outside and tender, juicy inside. No wonder theirs won the best-fried chicken in WA in 2020. The dipping sauce that accompanied it added sweetness.
Hand down the best fried chicken in WA!! So lucky to live close by to them now. Definitely be back to try more dishes
Drinks are amazing and the spicy chicken sandwich is insane. Service was also excellent
Good people Good food.  Ambiance is great as well. Try the soup. You won't be disappointed.

My wife and I have been tempted here by Seattle Restaurant Week on different occasions between the two of us. A small restaurant/pub for that amazing Creole food.Try the fried chicken entree, gumbo, and bread pudding dessert meal investment. The fried chicken is very crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. Chicken breast is especially juicy.Hush puppies and Brussels sprouts are also great sides.For drinks, we got Dolores and Strawberry Surfer. The drinks were delicious!The server and owner were very nice and the service was fast.

Hands down the best gumbo in town and a rustic chill vibes. Awesome fermented cocktails and a great friendly customer service. Loved it and we will be back with our friends. Thanks Rodel & crew. And best wishes!!!
Best chicken sandwich! The spicy was perfect! The staff was amazing and made sure we had everything we needed:) Will visit again for sure.

The food here is always top notch. Definitely not a one hit wonder. The vibe is super easy going and chill. Their craft cocktails are truly craft as they make their own fermented brews. This makes their margaritas impossible to beat. From oysters on the half shell to Fried Chicken or Nachos, there is something here for everyone AND they are totally Dog Friendly!!
I'm a huge fan of the burgers, first time here and was very impressed.
Spicy chicken sandwich was amazing!
Chicken is fantastic! Definitely will be coming back to try other items on the menu. Highly recommend to visit more than once!

Don't be fooled by the lies given by the "owners" of this restaurant. Stolen recipes, restaurant, and ownership. This restaurant was not brought up by these guys. I, was a loyal customer with the real owners. I wouldn't trust my credit card information under these crooks. They fail to follow health code procedures. Food isn't stored properly, even watching the video on their site: mojitoseattle.com/Mojito you see the "sous chef" handled raw meat before touching ready to eat food that will be served to consumers. Unless you want to leave with food poisoning, or salmonella poisoning i recommend staying clear of this restaurant.
Food is not very good, and, you won't believe this, I found a bug in my food. They just change the part with bug and that's it.The service is very very slow!!

We live only a few blocks from Mojito and SO wanted to like it. Unfortunately our one try at dinner last year was awful.We started with mojitos. Blech. A couple pieces of mint, some sugar water, and crappy rum do not a good mojito make.I don't remember the exact dinner items we ordered but each of our meals came with three or four items. Between the total of six or seven foods, the only edible one between us was the tostones.To top off the bad food and drinks, this place was pricey, annoyingly loud, and offered horrendous service. While we were two of only six diners the staff seemingly forgot about us and we went without water refills or the chance to ask for sauces or anything else that might have improved the meal.Mojito was a terribly disappointing experience and it's doubtful we'll ever give this another try.

It's OK but you really should go elsewhere. I echo the other reviewers who question the 4 star status- how???? The food is OK, the service is OK, the drinks are OK- that's it. Did i get sick after eating here- no. Could I have gotten better food for less money elsewhere- yes.

I'm sorry to say that I didn't really like this place too much. I wanted to like it, but it was loud and crowded, and the food was dried out and flavorless. I liked the sides, but the pollo I had was pretty much baked beyond recognition.

I think I came at a bad time. The yucca fries were pretty good. My Cuban was ok. Too much mayo and my cheese wasn't even melted. Pork was dry and a little blend. I'll try it again in a few months to see

The place is cute and family oriented, The cooker is Salvadorian, the manager Colombian and the waitress Mexican. Is not a Cuban Restaurant is more Venezuelan cousin, such as arepas, pabellon, etc.. The vaca frita is like a glorified pabellon but nothing like the Cuban vaca frita. The fried fish is not entire fish, is like a filet of a fish.So if you are looking for a real Cuban restaurant in Seattle this is not the place.PD. the Flan was super the best vanilla custard in the United States.

The place is cute and family oriented, The cooker is Salvadorian, the manager Colombian and the waitress Mexican. Is not a Cuban Restaurant is more Venezuelan cousin, such as arepas, pabellon, etc.. The vaca frita is like a glorified pabellon but nothing like the Cuban vaca frita. The fried fish is not entire fish, is like a filet of a fish.So if you are looking for a real Cuban restaurant in Seattle this is not the place.PD. the Flan was super the best vanilla custard in the United States.

The place is cute and family oriented, The cooker is Salvadorian, the manager Colombian and the waitress Mexican. Is not a Cuban Restaurant is more Venezuelan cousin, such as arepas, pabellon, etc.. The vaca frita is like a glorified pabellon but nothing like the Cuban vaca frita. The fried fish is not entire fish, is like a filet of a fish.So if you are looking for a real Cuban restaurant in Seattle this is not the place.PD. the Flan was super the best vanilla custard in the United States.

The place is cute and family oriented, The cooker is Salvadorian, the manager Colombian and the waitress Mexican. Is not a Cuban Restaurant is more Venezuelan cousin, such as arepas, pabellon, etc.. The vaca frita is like a glorified pabellon but nothing like the Cuban vaca frita. The fried fish is not entire fish, is like a filet of a fish.So if you are looking for a real Cuban restaurant in Seattle this is not the place.PD. the Flan was super the best vanilla custard in the United States.
Food was ok but the service rocked

Mojito I wanted to give you 5 stars. I like to support small local businesses, but I think you could benefit from a few improvements!Pros:-Owner is very nice and friendly-Vaca Frita had the best flavor and was well balanced-Colorful decorCons:-The dining area was cold and drafty -The music was a bit loud for lunch-The menus could use a wipe down (the cleaner everything in the dining room the cleaner the kitchen should be)We had the:-Mojito Platter: yucca frita, tostones, and maduros (needed more seasoning)I liked the maduros the best because they naturally have more flavor. -Vaca Frita: best dish for balanced flavors-Lechon Asado: bland and sides did not seem fresh or hot from the kitchen-Cuban Sandwich: great! would get againRecommendations to future diners: ask for the sauces on the side if you do not like raw garlic (it is super healthy for you, but has a strong taste)Mojito I will try you again!
I like it, its nice small, but the food does take a bit too long. IF I didn't have to wait so long it would be a 5 star for sure.

Looking for some delicious Cuban/Latin American food with a cute and lively atmosphere? Look no further. This place has a friendly staff, amazing food and yummy cocktails. Not a huge space - don't recommend rolling in with a large party.
Pretty good food. They have black beans which is a plus!!!
Under the radar, underrated spot. recommended.
we love it here we come once a week and they know exactly what we want its such a nice place

Mojito serves some of the most authentic Caribbean food in the city! Excellent food and friendly service. Beautiful restaurant, multiple great dishes to order. Not a genre I run with often, but damn it was good! The owner or waiter/chef was super nice and inviting.
Great little place. Food was amazing fresh and delicious. Service was also great. Will be back!!

I used to lived in Venezuela for a couple years and wanted to try out some of my favorite Venezuelan food here. They had a great arepa and awesome parchita(passion fruit)!! The restaurant is a very cool atmosphere too!

Came here to try something new and i was impressed! The food was delicious, i got the ceviche and a mojito drink and the mojito drink was really good!Overall i think we found our new "go to" place.We will be back to try some more.
The food was on the pricey side for the amount they offer. But it tasted good, and it is close to where I live I would go again once in a while.
love this place

as long as I have lived in the Lake City area I have always drove right by Mojito. not knowing what I was missing. The food is crazy good...so much flavor. I was not disappointed in any of our choices. and of course great drinks! the Mojito being THE BEST! If you are in the area or if you are not...Mojito is a MUST!!
Very tasty! I would definately go back. Only downside...place is very small.

The lunch menu here is better than the dinner menu, but what really stands out is the service. They were all super friendly, made us feel like part of the gang. The lunch sandwiches are excellent and the plantains are great any time.

Hooray! I was finally able to try Mojito! I've had this place bookmarked for months and at long last I was able to sit down and savor the flavor of the Caribbean! I was surprised how small it was! I mean, they have over 400 (mostly rave) reviews and maybe nine tables! That means that they have a steady stream of hip and satisfied customers. I had the roasted pollo (that's Spanish for "chicken"). I have to say that while I found it very flavorful, it was a little dry. Good thing they had so many really tasty things to pair it with. The first bite of their black beans and a little carnival started inside my mouth. The flavor was so deep and complex! I also liked the rice. Nice and simple. And I can never find anything wrong with fried things. I was afraid of the yucca, but like I say, fry it and I'll like it! I especially enjoyed the fried plantains! The creamy sauce with which they top it is out of this world!One more word on the service: Great!
Went with a group of 6 on a Friday, pretty early so no wait, delicious drinks (lots of lime) and delicious food, even got the chance to play the drums! (Poorly) would highly recommend
I've never had such a heartwarming experience. The food was absolutely delicious and I'll never forget the amazing and personal service. Such a cute place. 10000000 Stars!!!
Very very good!! Super impressive. I'd go again. If you are in Seattle make it a point to stop by

We are so glad we have chosen Mojito for a farewell lunch! The server was very nice, friendly, and funny. He gave us appetizers and added meat on our salad on the house because our colleague is returning to her home country. I am not writing a good review because of the food on the house; it made this special occasion even more special. And, the food was delicious! We had Mojito Platter, Arepa, Ensalad Palmito with steak, Veca Frita, Pescado Mojito, and Pescado en Guiso. The steak had wonderful citrus flavor. The meat in arepa was also very flavorful, and the "bread" part was so good. I particularly liked Pescado Mojito--white wine and cinnamon may sound unusual, but you just have to try it. The desserts (on the house, too!) weren't overly sweet, which was nice. Thank you, Server, for making our last lunch together unforgettable.
Great spot for all the delicious food and alcohol you could hope for, special shout out to Victor!

Many people recommended this place to me, and oh boy were they right! The service was great, the food was fantastic, the music was great, the paintjob was great. The owner came in and was very friendly and sociable. Will be coming back as much as possible.

Mojito catered my son's 1st birthday party for ~20 people and it was AMAZING! It was a last minute request (less than 48 hours) and Luam made it so easy - he threw together an amazing spread of salad, empanadas, plantains, rice and beans, and two platters of shredded beef and roasted pork - sooo delicious! Everyone kept asking where the food was from and helped themselves to seconds (and thirds)! We live in the neighborhood and Mojito has been a trusty staple of ours, and we will definitely be using Mojito for more parties in the future! Thank you, Luam!!
Get the Hotter than hell! Then do it again! Rinse with whiskey as needed! Repeat until full!
Absolute fire food. Great and friendly service that went above and beyond. Owner made the experience great. Serving sizes are great for the price
The food was good, and great cervez

At least once a month for Takeout Thursday, we head to Luam's Mojitos. The food is delicious, even for a "take away", and the personal attention from Luam, Victor and the rest of the staff makes us feel like we're part of the family. Actually, I think we are!
I love you guys the food and the service was great will definitely recommend this restaurant
We love the food here and the owners are so sweet. The food is always super tasty and never disappoints.

I ordered Mojito for myself and my coworkers, and it was a HUGE hit!! A variety of items were enjoyed by all of us, from the Cuban Sandwich to the Sauted Eggplant to the Vaca Frita. We ordered vegetarian and meat dishes/sandwiches, and all were wonderful. Victor and the chef (I am sorry I didn't catch his name!) were timely and accommodating for the large order - they wrote what was in each box and had everything nicely organized upon pick up.We will definitely eat here again!Thank you Mojito!!
The Foods are very wonderful, the way they cooked is just right. I'm going to order you to share it with my friends again. It is highly recommended!

Had dinner for the first time last night at mojito. The owner, who is easy to spot from his outgoing and affable personality, was one of the many highlights of this restaurant. - the food 10/10- the mojito was delicious- the restaurant itself was a really cool set up with a nice patio, which I can't wait to go back and sit down at.Great spot.
The food is always amazing, and the drinks are really great. Service is outstanding, there super friendly and helpful. We will definitely be back!
Amazing food and drinks!! Love the atmosphere too. The owner and staff are so friendly - great service! This place is a must try! We will be back every time we visit Seattle
great food great service and very legit. Bravo
Best Cuban sandwich in Seattle. Mojito. I highly recommend. Food was delicious nice and hot. It reminded me about back home.

Hands.Down.The.Best.It.Can.Get. I'm not sure what else to write here. Luam, the owner, is a hoot, and so welcoming to everyone that walks into his restaurant. I hear they also cater all the visiting Mariners teams, thats some high praise if I've ever heard anything.
This place is great I got a bottle of rum and destroyed it and then it destroyed me is so tasty

Luam is an amazing chef and host! The food here is unique to most flavors in our city, and they serve delicious Mojitos! The layout is quaint and cozy, but everyone that comes is friendly and just happy to get the best Latin food in the city!
Both dishes we tried were excellent. Wait staff was attentive and friendly. Would definitely go back
I loved this place. The entire experience was wonderful from the Food, to the service to the great prices. Do yourself a favor and visit them right away!
Great Food, Great People! Love The Vaca Frita & Mojitos.
Great restaurant, great food and drinks! Glad it is close to where I live. I keep coming back and back and am never disappointed.

Mojito is one of our favorite places to dine for lunch or dinner. The owner is a wonderful guy who is super friendly and does everything he can to make sure you are enjoying your time. The food is OUTSTANDING. The flavors jump off your tongue! Their salad with avocados, onions and tomatoes with a mango dressing is superb. The mojitos are obviously delicious-half a lime in each with tiny crushed ice. So if you're looking for a cute little neighborhood restaurant with healthy, fresh, and flavorful food check out Mojitos! And try and save room for the Tres Leches!

This is by far the best restaurant in all of Seattle. Everything about this place is delicious and authentic. It is a little small for the winter, but in the summer it would be the best date spot. It is not overrated like Paseos. It is GREAT food at great prices. Also they have a good happy hour.
This place is great. It's our first time here and we will certainly be back. Great drinks, amazing flavorful food, and fun atmosphere.
Love this place! The owner is very hands on and makes sure you're experience is amazing. He is very proud of his food and his passion for what he does is evident in the meal you will get here!!!

My first time I had Cuban food. I was not too sure when I got there since the place is very small. I ordered a Caribbean salad and a pescado of the day. They food was delicious. I am definitely going back there.
Literally the best place on earth.
Who doesn't love Caribbean food on a cold and rainy day? The food is always fresh, light, and relatively healthy, the environment is always welcoming and cozy, and you'll always leave wanting more.
love this place, the food is great, and the staff and owner are great too!
Great place, great service, great food, great drinks. Great.
Amazing food and friendly workers :-) The prices are really reasonable and it's so delicious.
Food: amazingStaff: amazingOwners: amazingDrinks: amazingThis place is fricken amazing

A friend and I went into this little place that has all of 8 tables in it. I had passed by it many times. But we were told we should try it and OH MY! We were greeted and seated right away. Our server was very nice and took the time to explain what some of the menu items were. We had a shredded beef that was so mouth watering delicous! we squeezed lime on it and it came with a rice adn black bean mixture adn plaintains that were simply incredible. 2 thumbs up on this one!
Still the best Cuban cuisine and service in town.
Very good food.
Went here with a couple buddies, the food was amazing. AUTHENTIC tostones! later into the night they bumped up the music and it turned into an awesome dance party. A little crowded though.

WOW- So glad we just found this little diamond in the rough. I have driven by this place tons of times and never had the chance to stop until the other day. SOOOOO Glad we did. The food here is craveable and such a nice change from the standard fare in Seattle. If you are looking for authentic Cuban food you need to make the trip to mojitos. We had the Caribbean Salad, Cuban Sandwich and another pork dish. The caipirinha's were pretty delicious as well and the have crushed ice :)
ONE WORD! Delicious.
Always treated like a queen when I go here, also love the food!
Wonderful little place with great food! If you make it later in the night, you might get to play some bongo drums! Food is outstanding, and service is next to none. Love it!

Daaaaay-ummmmmmm! This place is the shit! I don't know if it's authentic, all I knows and cares about is that it's slammin' good! I've had the Bistec A Caballo and the Vaca Frita so far and they do make a mean mojito. It is a small little weirdly shaped place, but that's part of it's charm in my opinion.

I used to love this place but I was utterly disappointed by the food I received today. I returned to this place after a few years with high hopes but I couldn't even finish the food after a few bites. It was way too doughy and the sauce was tasteless. It's as if the ownership changed. It did not taste anything like I remembered.It's sad to see such a great restaurant has gone down but I will no longer return to this place.
Tried to go here order noodles, they are out of noodles. What? You have noodles in the name. Ordering machine is confusing. Only selection is no no noodles?
Staff there are really rude. They don't let us sit in empty seats, even there is not busy at all.

Not happy with this place. After reading all the hype about it decided to try and didn't have a good experience. The cashier that took my order went to vegetable station to add my side order of mushrooms and used his bare hands to put it in the bowl and take it to the kitchen. I couldn't believe it. If they are so unsanitary in front of customers I can only imagine what's going on in that kitchen. My order was steamed chicken with noodles. Mushy noodles with bone in chicken not tasty. Won't be back!
The floor is dirty and the entire place is like a mess. Food there is so so. One more thing is I got alimentary infection after I had the cold noodles there.

People, please read the owner's responses. She is so rude to her customers. Instead of taking feedback and taking the proper response, she completely humiliates her own customers. This speaks volumes about how she runs her business. Buyer beware!Anyways, my review (I can't wait for her response): I'm from Brazil on vacation. After this experience, I had to create a Yelp account today. I decided to try various places yesterday. I'm a great fan of Chinese food. I was visiting a friend at UW and I decided to try this restaurant due to the Yelp reviews. Worst.Mistake.Ever. Do not eat here. The cashier is rude and the "servers" are even ruder. I agree with others: the food is too salty. When I ordered the Tingly Beef, it smelled...like smelled rotten. I think that's why they salt it so much - to hide the fact it's rotten. I had one bite and I spit it out. I think I know why they call it "Tingly beef"...it makes your stomach tingly with pain. Terrible....so terrible!!! I truly don't understand how they have so many 5 star reviews. "They must be fake" - I put this in quotes because the owner always thinks any negative reviews are fake. Anyways, enjoy at your own risk!
No good. too greasy. Salty. Resturant not clean

OMG We found a SPIDER and the waiter KILLED it in front of usPlease shut it down when you have a clean restaurant!!!!BAD SERVICE: waiter dropped the spoon and kept asking whether we were done or not REALLY HOT IN THERE because of open kitchen and poor fan

super melting:The inside temperature is at least 10 degree higher than the outside. they do have fans but the kitchen is open so the fans are not working well. I don't understand why the government would let this restaurant open given such a bad design. awful service: everyone is busy and we have to order first. The waitress does not have the time to care about you.Please raise your bar on taste. If you have tried Xi'an authentic noodles, there is no way that this could be compared. I normally would not do Yelp BUT this restaurant is very disappointing. Please think before go!!

The owner harassed meThe Biang Biang noodle was too bad compared with what I have in China.The burger was ok but not authentic taste.Don't recommend based on my appetite on Xi'an foodI got a message from the owner privately on my comment. Your noodles need improvement you need to face the problem not begging for good comment or warning the customers The owner said she would report my comment to Yelp no matter what u do. You and your restaurant suck
Quality has gone down in the past year. Not sure if the owner changed or due to something else.

Ordered a take out and not really impressed by the food. The spicy oil dumpling is sub-par. The filling is bland and the gravy/ soup is very salty. The spicy lamb cumin noodles is less than average. Shredded lamb makes their presence very insignificant and the meat has near to zero fragrance and taste. The noodles and sauce is of average and has zero spicy taste. Overall, a pretty disappointed meal.

The food was good. You have line up at the counter to place your order, like other fast food restaurant.They bring the food to the table. They put 18% tip over my bill.I think they should let me know before hand.

I recommend that you order a hot tea and a vegetable side dish when you come here. The food is delicious, but it is very oily and spicy, and having tea would help wash it down and balance out the flavors more.Parking is not too bad since it's pretty up north from the campus. The service was okay.
Dumplings aren't spicy enough :(((, but I guess I'll try again! Light up the heat on those dumplings!!!

Just ok, well kind of good. We went here during a Seattle Washington rainstorm, my friend said it was a good spot. I like noodles and like to try different noodle joints when I am traveling so I went to Xi'an Noodles. Got the Pho vegetarian broth and they put the carrots, sprouts, cucumbers, jalapenos and cilantro on the side and also onions. The tastes of this Xi's different options for Asian foods, wow!!! love it, go here :). The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because I was nervous walking to the restaurant, there were a few suspect characters hanging out outside
I love their noodle dishes. They do traditional thai food pretty well too.
It was tasty, though a little different from what I was expecting. Decent prices. Good experience.

I'm extremely excited about the customized noodle bowls! I can eat noodle soup for breakfast, lunch, or dinner, and this place is right up there on my list, along with Noodle.They have a wide array of options. I ordered Tom Yum base soup, enoki mushrooms, vermicelli, been sprouts, and wontons. My husband ordered spicy soup base and it really is spicy! Will be back!

And I'm back again. This is probably my 4th time visiting this restaurant since it opened. I love the food so much. If you're looking for a great Chinese food with endless noodles, this is the place. There's an option to make your own noodle soup. Otherwise, you can choose from there Myriad of dishes. my favorite is the tingly beef and sauce as well as soup. Also if you need to add some veggies to your diet or are vegetarian, definitely get the garlic cucumber salad.
Great hole-in-the-wall noodle place. The hand-ripped noodles were so good, and the soup was flavorful and the perfect level of spiciness. Wish I could have gone back a second time.
The noodles are no joke. The hamburger was okay but treat yourself to the noodles. Second to none

I am very skeptical of Chinese cuisine, but this place fit the bill. My sister recently moved to Seattle and recommended this place. I was impressed by the authentic dishes. So nostalgic and delicious. I recommend this place!

Xi'an's pulled noodles are a true culinary delight, offering a unique and flavorful experience. The skillful artistry of noodle pulling is evident in the perfect texture and thickness of each strand. The diverse range of dishes showcases a harmonious blend of spices and ingredients, transporting diners to the heart of Xi'an's culinary traditions. The casual yet inviting ambiance adds to the authenticity, creating a welcoming space for noodle enthusiasts. Xi'an's pulled noodles stand out as a must-try for those seeking an exceptional taste of traditional Chinese cuisine with a focus on the artistry of hand-pulled noodles.
Noodles are great. Can't complain.
Best noodles I've ever had and they're my favorite food. Will always go back whenever I'm in Seattle
Got some take-out from here a few weeks ago. Everything was great! Some delicious noodle dishes.

Best western Chinese food in Seattle. My friend and I had the lamb noodles and shrimp/pork dumplings. We loved how thick the dumpling skins were and how long the noodles were, had to pull them apart to be more edible in a bite and had a good laugh.
Delicious. Absolutely awesome. Try it
This place is amazing. Everything on the menu is five stars!! Can't wait to be back. Both locations are delicious.

I ate in this restaurant very often. They have interesting menu. And my favorite noodles that I had ever ate. Differently I and my friends recommend. We will come back soon. Thank you for the care about yours customers.
One of my favorite places and one of my favorite dishes! I would definitely recommend the noodles yum!

Ugh, this place is so good. Literally so good at making noodles. The must-get is definitely the spicy cumin lamb noodles, Xi'an makes them so well, but honestly, any of their noodles are worth getting.
LOVE this place. Can't wait for them to open back up!
Enough has been said about this place. One of my two favorite places for a delicious and quick meal.
I loved their noodles. The food was served very fast which was also very nice.
This restaurant has good food. The waiters are kind and let us sit at a reserved table. Also the food comes quickly.
Hidden gem for some of the best Xi'an food in Seattle. The spice level is great and noodles are freshly made. Beef shank salad is great!
The cumin lamb hand ripped noodles are my go-to comfort food! Nice portion sizes, quick service and typically no waiting time.

This place makes me feel like I am home. The noodles are the best around. I come here often as it is close to my work. Absolutely love this place. And remember to get the sauces as they make the meal.
Small place, noodles are not cheap but great taste!
I eat too many Xi'an food. This is the best food, the best price.
I can't get enough of this place. So yummy. Go for the tingly pork, it's delicious. Go here.
Good food, good service i will come often

Perfect little hidden gem on the hill. I'm never really sure what I'm getting because I don't know this type of cuisine that well but everything I've gotten has had amazing flavor and they're good portion sizes. It's usually pretty Busy during nights but right when they open it's not
I very much like. Xian noodle however some Chinese people find it unreasonable to disregard their own food
Very delicious!!and the service is good
Food is fire. Prices are cheap. Yum.
Excellent hand pulled noodles. Not very spicy. Pretty much everything is excellent. Worth the trip.
I love the condiment bar!! Can't wait to come back again and again to work my way through the menu!
If you are in the U district you have to visit here! So good and I can't wait to go back! The tofu was amazing!

This falls under the "hole in the wall" label and I'm glad it does. The food is phenomenal for lack of better terms. From the hand pulled noodles to the broth, the flavor and spice blend is just right. The texture of the noodles is firm and stays firm throughout the meal instead of loosing it's hold and disintegrating into the broth. The broth has a very bold flavor profile and yet not too oilly as you would expect with Chinese cooking. I've personally always gone for the noodles with soup but either choice never fails. Xi'an noodles are hard to explain, it's a perfect soup dish when you want noodles but you're not feeling pho or ramen.
It's great! Worth of coming and sharing with foodies.
Love this place so much. Food is authentic and delicious. I feel like I'm back in China.

Overly priced mediocre Italian food. They didn't have garlic bread but a loaf with quality similar to Safeway with a homemade pesto butter that barely had any flavor. I ordered the penny vodka and I honestly could've made better. The staff however was kind. But really, with how expensive the plates were, I expected alot better.

Came here on a Friday evening at 5:30PM with Pomodoro being empty. The ambience is quite nice if you don't mind the soapy smell alongside the head beams from vehicles exiting the lot outside hitting you if you're sitting by the window. The waiter was unable to strongly recommend anything, and no one approached me throughout dinner to ask how was the food.

I really dig this place. I met up with a friend on Monday here and it's super cute. Easy to find and there's ample parking in the back (even though it's street parking / something I despise)! I ordered a mocha and it was awesome, one of the better ones I've had in awhile. I also got a almond poppyseed muffin, the girl behind the counter told me she had just put them in the case, so they were fresh. I wasn't a fan of the muffin, it was really dense.
