That being said, I am still interested in trying some of the other pastries they have and trying other drinks. Weirdly, after I parked my car and started walking to the Cafe, I swear I saw my dads car....and then I realized MY DAD WORKS NEXT DOOR. I felt like a shitty daughter. Maybe I can redeem myself for stopping in to see him from time to time before my stops in and out of Cafe?
Waiters are so nice, and the environment is also attracting. But the waiter will hurry you for the bill. It's bad :(

Found this place while looking for a late night meal! Can't believe I've missed it this long! Warm, welcoming atmosphere, great staff, outstanding food and wine selection! I really enjoyed myself here. Thanks and I'll be back soon!

Excellent dishes! The Linguine Alla Carbonara Con Pancetta was really delicious and very tasty. The noodle was great and the sauce has a balanced taste. I was delighted with their food. The portion was great and well-prepared food. The restaurant was big and amazing interior with great ambiance! Reasonable price and so worth it.However, the service was not good for me. My food served late.
Tasty Tiramisu. It was fresh (not frozen and reheated) like some restaurants. The cream was light on the tongue, and just perfect on the coffee dust.
The owner and chef will come to your table and explain menu items. Small intimate bar. Nice conversation place at this Spanish restaurant.
When you get inside, you can smell the goodness of their dishes. And their foods were good. Even though the waiting was not too quick but it's all worth it.

Came here with my girlfriend for our anniversary dinner. The space was great and the setting was upscale and classy. The bartenders, servers, and hostesses were all very friendly and professional. We ordered the paella and seafood experience, which were both delicious. We each had two drinks, I had champagne and she had Grey Goose martinis, and our total bill after tip was about $80. awe had a great time.
Great local place that's been around for years, my fall back place which never disappoints. Consistently excellent pasta and salads.

I lack the words to describe the quality of food here more aptly satisfied grunts may do the trick. The food is the best Italian I've had in Seattle, the ambiance is intimate and friendly, and the complex foods being cooked only a few feet is the real reason to tell everyone you know, regardless of what you order the garlic and olive oil scented delicacies will be dancing with you all evening long.
AMAZING! such wonderful food and staff. Everything was so flavorful and perfect. 10/10 would recommend
We had great food and great service. Everything from appetizers, to dinner, to dessert was great!
Pomodoro has superb desserts, can't wait to come back!
Incredible food with great staff! Whenever I'm with a group, we order family style to try all of the dishes and I haven't had a dish I didn't like. Definitely a favorite!
Deserts here are fabulous! Very delicious, and I would definitely recommend stopping by!
Some of the most delicious desserts in all of seattle!

First of all I wanted to thank the owner of the restaurant. He created something incredible. I came here with my wife and daughter. The waitress came to us, she advised us the best dishes for her taste. she was nice and friendly. Our order included Gnocchi con Salsiccia e Fungni, seapod paella, Caesar salad. the sun was incredibly tasty, all the products were fresh. We also liked the amosphere. thanks for a perfect evening Pomodoro!!!

Lovely Italian restaurant at Eastlake. The owner served us himself, and he is very nice and funny. He wanted us to tryout his special hot sauce and it was great! He also gave us a piece of tiramisu because it was my friend's birthday. Delicious.Most of their pastas are great, and I love the ambiance within. It is a place that I will be going back 100%.
Very good food. Big portions  Excellent service. Small restaurant, personal service. I will be back again.
Excellent menu and very attentive staff. Don't be afraid to try something you never had before
We had a blast here for my girlfriend's birthday.
Amazing meal. All the sauces and almost everything is made from scratch and the freshness of the ingredients used was very apparent.
Amazing meal. All the sauces and almost everything is made from scratch and the freshness of the ingredients used was very apparent.
SO GOOD. Just go... GO! I would say it's more $$$ than $$. About $20/entree. With that in mind... GO!!!!
Excellent dinner, excellent ambience, a lot of attention to detail. Delightful!

Wonderful meal and very friendly staff. Really loved the Fettuccine Alfredo! By the looks of those around me, everyone enjoyed their meal. Say hello to the owner, he loves Seattle and has a great story to tell.
I LOVE this place! Excellent food, excellent service. One of my favorite restaurants.
My kind of place. The food was great. It is the people that make the experience. These people are wonderful. We will be back!!!!

I have been to this place twice since I moved to Eastlake and both times were simply excellent. The Lemon Drop I ordered before my meal was made to perfection with fresh squeezed lemon; and I consider myself something of a Lemon Drop connoisseure :)  Most recently, I ordered the Gnocchi con Salsiccia e Funghi with portobello mushrooms added. The Gnocchi was perfectly cooked, which as some of you may know is difficult to do, and the dish was absolutely delightful, a masterpiece of complementary flavors and textures.The first time I came, the restaurant was close to empty and the atmosphere was relaxed and pleasant. The courses were spaced out and my friend and I had time to enjoy our conversation and take in the overall experience. The next time, my boyfriend and and I came for New Years Eve and although it was packed and hectic, the staff did an excellent job paying attention to the costumers and balancing the aesthetic of slow-paced European style dining with the fast-paced demands of the New Years crowd. And boy were some people demanding :) The table next to us seemed quite rushed and rude, even when they were brought a Tiramisu for the woman's birthday. Hey, I had to pay for mine! Not that I minded; I would have gladly pay double for that fluffy morsel. Alas, such is the nature of a busy restaurant. Overall, I could not be more pleased by the experiences this restaurant has afforded me and I will certainly be back very soon. Buono Appetito!
Great food! Outstanding service. Highly recommend.
Amazing!
Great spot! Totally un-assuming. Food and service have always been great.

they don't answer their phones and apparently they don't do open sitting but no where on their website or on their phone's automated message does it say that, so... feels racially motivated so i'll never be back

This place is a JOKE. Let me warn you they FORCE you to pay a 20% tip. The food is nothing to be proud of. It's a short menu with plates you cant share. Your rude waiter will tell you that you can share them lol. Stay away. Typical Seattle food trying to be better that what it is. And the people in there are f9cking loud and drunk and old.
Overrated! The decor and ambience is nice, but food is bland and uninspired.

Average place compared to others nearby. People are not super friendly (they are not rude either, service is ok), I tried steak tartar, which was ok. Feel free to go, other items might be better in the menu, but I probably won't go back, too expensive for average food & service.
Meh. Boring, kind of pretentious. Nothing new here.

Went to this restaurant for a second time and disappointed for a second time. First time had to wait about 40 minutes even though I had reservations for my anniversary dinner (made me feel a fool). This time was terrible for different reasons - many of them...First, got seated next to their huge booth, which somehow echoes and amplifies all the noise coming from it. Multiply that by wine-drunk women sitting there.Second, the food was no good. Got bread and the olive oil/vinegar dish. The bread we got was soo tiny that it was a joke. My date commented that they must have accidentally put a crouton instead. Asked for a larger bread and got it. I get that this is artisan-type bread. Their oil-vinegar presentation was terrible. They used some little deep dish that had vinegar on the bottom with a deep layer of oil on top. Problem is that there is no way to get both on the bread, so basically we were sopping up oil with the croutons.Their salumi plate was even bad - served on a gross cracked and discolored cutting board that should be tossed in the trash. Don't know why but the eats all seemed like they were dipped in oil.The ravioli fell apart. The two sides didn't stick together.Epic fail.

meh. i'd heard the hype for about a year, prior to visiting HTCAW, and couldnt have been more excited to finally have the planets align, for a first date there! upon entry, the host was friendly and welcoming, however, the music was not. paula abdul, turned up to "make your parents angry" levels made the 30 minute wait nearly unbearable. i had to ask the host to lower the volume, which he reluctantly did, but only by an undetectable amount. next we were treated to "miami sound machine", and i started to think that perhaps it was a cocaine theme restaurant. i'd never heard of such a thing, but i'm adventurous, and usually willing to try anything once. ;)when we sat down, it took exactly 17 minutes for a server to take our drink order. i asked for a rootbeer-tini, half salted, half sugared rim. well, the bartender salted the entire rim, and i barely detected any gin. the taste of rootbeer schnapps was overwhelming, and sweet. far too sweet. when our waiter finally decided to stop playing angrybirds on his ipad, and come take our order, i specifically asked "how DO you cook a wolf?" he had no answer for me. additionally, there was no wolf to be found on the menu. apparently they'd sold out of the slow-cooked wolf shoulder by 8pm?? plan ahead, people! i opted for the chicken fried steak, with eggs three ways. it was cooked perfectly, i must admit. however, the side order of rutabaga chipotle dumplings was cold and uninspiring. dessert was the shining star of this meal. my date and i shared a molten chocolate bread pudding with whiskey sauce and vanilla ice cream. i told the waiter it was my date's birthday, (it wasnt!) and he gladly added a candle and got a few members of the wait staff to come out and sing happy birthday. if it wasnt so drafty, i'd give it another star. bring a sweater, and maybe eat before you come.
Food was weird and not memorable at all.

The atmosphere is great. Warm, local neighborhood eatery. Very noisy though. All the food was good, but nothing really stood out as being exceptional. All in for a total of $120 including tip (for 2) it really fails to make the grade as a restaurant I would repeat visit.Tilth and Crush are still my standouts for high end dining in Seattle.

We went here for a date night recently. The ambiance is inviting, and the service was attentive, but the food fell short of expectations. The Ahi tuna pasta, while inventive, was a bit of a miss for me. The concept of tuna in a red sauce pasta sounded intriguing, but the flavors didn't quite harmonize. It felt more like an experiment than a cohesive dish.Overall, it's a decent spot for the atmosphere, but the food could use some improvement.
Burrata was deliciousSpaghetti Nero was ok but overspiced.Service was mehAmbiance- lack of decor
Food was just ok. Service was good.
Very small. Interesting small dishes. Very tasty. Fun for groups of people who want drinks and appetizers.
Nice place, food was good, small place.

I wish we had had the great experiences people on this site describe. The service was okay, but not great. There was not wait as we went early on a week night.I hear that the menu changes a lot, and it must have been a good day for us as the food was great, but it was pretty expensive given the economic conditions.It's like Italian tapas, so we did as suggested by the server, and ordered six dishes for four people: Olives, panini, sea scallops, baked polenta, angolotti and spaghetti with wild boar bolognese. And wine. It cost $300.The portions are pretty sparse for the prices. I think $14 for four little scallops is exorbitant. They were good, but not worth the price. Ditto on the panini (it's a GRILLED SANDWICH) or the polenta, which were $9 and $13, respectively. I loved the spaghetti, though, and there was actually enough for all of us. For me, it's really a value thing. I'm still searching for that elusive Seattle restaurant that has top-notch food for reasonable prices.
I know many people love it, but I cannot get over how the place looks and the food even though good does not make up for it.

How to Cook a Wolf in Queen Ann Seattle is an absolute gem featuring Italian small plates and a robust cocktail & wine menu. The cuisine is rustic, bursting with flavor and texture. Each item was unique but was part of a larger culinary journey.

Had a wonderful dining experience here in How To Cook A Wolf.My family had dinner here because we were intrigue of its name, it sounds interesting. The ambiance is great. I'm impressed with the interior design. It made the place comfortable. The staff is friendly and welcoming. The food here is as interesting as the resto's name! We had their Sea Wolf Sourdough, fresh and tasty. Gnocchi is exquisite. Beets Salad is delectable. Plum Cake is simply delicious. We're going back here.
glad to see wolf wasn't on the menu. Food and service was good.
great ambiance, great pasta, great rose!
great ambiance, great pasta, great rose!
Very good place to get some tasty pasta!

We came down from BC on a family getaway and were really excited to try this place! The service & atmosphere didn't disappoint. They were still vibrantly busy at 9pm mid-week, and our server had great knowledge about the menu items & their preparation. Their service was warm & welcoming, and the bathrooms were spotless. The only reason I didn't give them 5/5 was because I was actually quite disappointed with the menu - it was tiny, consisting primarily of small plates & pasta. In addition, they were out of one of the pastas, so it was even more limited. The Bucatini pasta, while tasty, had so little sauce that it was barely discernible. All in all we will be back next time, but maybe just for late drinks & a small snack.

The decor in this place is great, and the atmosphere is very upscale, oh and the food tastes great. My favorites are the scallop crudo and the baby octopus, they had a perfect texture and a smokey flavor. As for a main course just go for the pasta, or whatever else sounds good on their menu because the menu is not very big; but everything on it has a big flavor. The only downside is that it can get very busy and when it gets busy it gets extremely loud, like you will have to shout at your boyfriend in his ear to be heard loud.
very good place , just loved it.
The good was great. I liked how our server explained all of our dishes to us and gave us time to slowly enjoy our meal here. Would definitely come back soon.
Food was excellent, and staff was extremely professional, friendly, and helpful to boot...
Holy Hamachi Crudo. Most. Delicious. Evar. Zomg.

I really enjoyed the 5 times I've been here. Always a little bit of a shock to my wallet, but well worth it. Quality of the food is superior, and the service was excellent. I would not consider this a family environment as they only have 2 tables that fit 4 people.
Good food and service.

I went here on a first date and it was an overall good experience. The place is tiny, but the atmosphere is still good. We sat at the bar and got great, friendly service all night. The menu was a little intimidating. Even though I consider myself pretty experienced in the kitchen, I didn't recognize half the things on there! They don't have a huge selection either, which was actually a breath of fresh air from the usual novels you see at chain restaurants. You know they must change their menu often and the things on there must be chef favorites. Their servers were really great about answering our questions and giving us suggestions, too.Like some other posters have said, the portions are small and the prices are a little high, but I think the experience outweighs that. I suggest getting some wine (recommendations from the bartender are always helpful), a couple appetizers and a couple entrees and just sharing everything. You might not leave stuffed, but I think you will leave satisfied. My favorite thing from the night was the honey potato gnocchi. Cooked perfectly with just the right amount of sweetness! I do not recommend the chocolate gelato, however. Maybe venture elsewhere for dessert :)
I liked it. I would go again.

After search this place on the internet, went there on busy weekend night. the staff's good and explain me well about food and drink. the drink and food'er really good. fresh and flavorful. I would recommend their fresh purciato and somethings with yellowtail, going well with wine.I and my wife love their food so much. thanks for perfect meal. I'll be back soon
Great place for scotch and pasta.

My brother brought me there after he heard that I had a good time at UNION.Before going, my brother already hyped up the place so I must say that I was pleasantly surprised that the food and decor actually lived up to the "hype".My only complaint was that the food was "smallish". Drinks were excellent and the service was efficient.I would recommend it.
The wait sucked but the food was amazing, very talented chefs here.
Loved the food, drinks, service and atmosphere! We could not get enough of the watermelon mocktails. The marrow and ricotta cheesecake were also highlights.
Excellent food. Not economical, but a special place for amazing quality in a cool chic environment. Will definitely be trying out other Ethan Stowell restaurants after having dinner here.
Amazing restaurant, I have been coming here for a while and always have a good time.
I can confidently say that it's the best restaurant I've ever been in town
Yelp is asking me to give more details...Its really friendly environment and the food is really good. If you want to enjoy your afternoon you should probably visit it.

This place is a gem! It is small, so plan ahead and make a reservation.  We were greeted with complimentary Prosecco and our server Robert was delightful and attentive.  There is a short list of handmade pastas that are pure artistry.  The chef went off menu for me and pulled together a beautiful vegetarian gnocchi with butternut squash and pepperocini. Can't wait to go back!
Tapas were amazing! Each & every one. Can't wait to go back & try out more of the menu. Also loved the space.
My new favorite restaurant - everything is amazing!

Such a terrific restaurant and a great eating experience every time. One of Ethan Stowell's best. Great food cooked with fresh ingredients creatively used. Great food for vegetarians as well. The service, detailed but not intrusive. Thanks :-)

Perfection! My husband and I celebrated our wedding anniversary at this beautiful spot on Monday and I honestly am so bummed that I haven't been here sooner! As soon as we arrived through the front door we were greeted with an amazing energy from the staff. So many hellos and smiles to accompany the grace this restaurant has, was just the beginning of our experience. Our hostess was the epitome of perfect! Her eye contact and welcoming demeanor was such a breath of fresh air. She took the time to say congratulations for our celebration that evening, offered us a better suited table of we wanted, and explained everything to which we could understand. Thank You! As i sat across from the small intimate table from my husband, I observed every patron thoroughly enjoying their experience. Laughter could be heard, clinking of glasses echoed off the walls and the sunlight bouncing off the decor, was a picture perfect beginning to our night. Our waiter was fantastic! He really took his time with us! He explained the options we chose to start our night out with, and provided us with champagne that was pre ordered for our celebration. His authenticity and fabulous aura, was such a nice welcoming feeling. Now, the preparations of the menu items.... I swear, I have never tasted anything to heavenly in my entire life, minus my husband's home cooked meals (since he is the executive chef at Grappa and brother to the owner) every ounce of thought placed within the flavors were matched to Perfection! Every last bite I had was a mouthwatering as the first.. I couldn't get enough!!! I am so beyond thrilled to recommend this amazing gem to everyone and anyonen that is looking for a nice night out or just to be taken care of with grace and great attitudes! To those that worked this past Monday, I salute you to my and my husband's experience, making it one we will never forget. Till next time, Cheers!
This was a great dinner!! Loved the atmosphere. The service and food was wonderful.

my friends have been telling about this place for a long time. finally decided to try it. make sure you make reservations. i love this place. food and ambiance was wonderful. definitely coming back. great wine selection as well.
We love our date night spot! wouldn't change a thing! Thanks for a great experience always.
amazing food some of the best I ever had!
Phenomenal. Favorite restaurant in QA. Highly recommend.
Great service, great food. Don't miss it!
Awesome food, unique & great service
Nice food. I like to eat this place every time. Excellent services also.
great place, a bit pricy, bit food is fantastic!

It has taken me forever to sign up for yelp but this has to be my first review! Though very close to my house, I hadn't been until last month. So delicious, great service, great wine! Some of the vegetables at my table seemed over salted, but the beef was cooked perfectly!
Neighborhood gem
This place is fabulous! Everything is always excellent.

Loved what I had, decor was fun, and the place has a tiny intimate feel. My food was simple and well prepared, I don't like too much messing with my food so this place was right up my alley. Drinks were just OK, but food made up for this. Will stick to the wine next time.

Well, I have eaten at How To Cook A Wolf three times, and I have loved it every time. In fact, one of the times my visit was one of the best restaurant experiences that I have ever had in Seattle. I do love that place.

I went to Wolf late on a tues with a group of seven and must have had the luck of the Gods as we were seated almost immediately (we knew we were taking a chance on the wait). I adore the interior- I felt like I was in a ships hull all be it the nicest ship and the most modern hull. The wine list was LOVELY. I worked in wine in NY for a few years and although most of my knowledge has drifted out of my brain I certainly am snob enough to know a good Italian lineup. This is where my review gets boring. I loved all of it- from the wine to the food- the food was thoughtful and elegant. The staff was available, considerate of our needs and knowledgeable.  And they were playing PRINCE.  It might have been a little loud but it was still awesome. We danced in our seats. And we had a diverse crew- a wee 24 to a wise 55 and everything else between. I have no idea why this nugget of gold doesn't have a fiver on this site.

We had a faulous time. We went down the street to have cocktails while we were waiting. It was so worth the wait. The wait staff was very helpful in making suggestions and we really enjoyed ourselves.
Wonderful! Great! Fantastic! you must go... find out yourself!!!!
Excellent food, great service. Tapas style.

I had a great experience here a couple of weeks ago. I could go over all the menu items, but I would rather keep it pithy. All I can say is that the food was fantastic and the server was perfect. On top of that, I love small restaurants and this one is not only small and quaint, but also beautiful. I dine out quite a bit and I absolutely love this restaurant.

**Restaurant Review - Poor Service from Waitress Wenjie**I recently visited this restaurant with high expectations, but unfortunately, the service left much to be desired. My party was placed on the waitlist, but after waiting for quite some time, we noticed that tables around us were being called and seated, yet we never heard our name.We approached the waitress, Wenjie, who was managing the waitlist. Wenjie insisted that she had called our table, but her voice was so quiet that no one in our party, nor those around us, could hear her. Instead of acknowledging this possibility or offering any sort of compromise, she doubled down and insisted she had done everything correctly. Her lack of flexibility and unwillingness to apologize made the situation even more frustrating.While the food may be good, the experience was overshadowed by this poor service. It's unfortunate that a lack of communication and unprofessional attitude from staff can ruin what could have been an enjoyable meal. I hope management addresses this issue to avoid upsetting more customers in the future.

I heard many good things about Haidilao and decided to give it a try with my friends. Haidilao is well known for the service, but to be honest, we didn't receive any. There were two to three groups of people ahead of us yesterday at lunchtime, and we lined up for over 10 minutes without anyone greeting us. No one was there. I don't know how long the previous group waited, but we all left. My friends and I were HANGRY. We finally turned to upstairs DinTaiFung. DinTaiFung had two hosts serving us, and we got seated right away. Does Haidilao open the store for self-check-in? I don't know how the well-known service is, but it was a terrible experience for me. We will never be back to waste more time...... and money.

You got many other choices... How did they get the 5star reviews??? I didn't write many reviews especially with low stars but for this one, I must give it one star at most. When I first got into the restaurant there was nobody serving us. The receptionist later came and was told I was on the waiting line (actually no one was waiting. It's empty.) her attitude was pretty unprofessional and I felt her unwillingness to serve us.
Honestly wasn't really good had to do a lot of work and still wasn't full in the end. It was our first time and we didn't know what to do waiter didn't help understand at all.

My bf and I LOVE hot pot, and our go to spot is usually Happy Lamb. We've been hearing about the dancing noodles and just how delicious Haidilao is, so we had to try. The service was pretty good, everyone was pretty attentive. Overall, we thought the prices were too overpriced for what it was, but at least the dancing noodles were good! The milk tea was pretty good as well, but we thought for what it was, it wasn't worth it.

This Haidilao store is the worse location that I ever visit. It seems busy, but we don't get any essential service. When we arrived at the store, there was no greeting person at the front. We have to walk in and ask for the table. Then the host brought us to the front again, and we had to step out to check our reservation. We are here for the noodle show, but the show is perfunctory. The sauce bar was dirty, and some ingredients were gone without refill. Not worth it to pay extra for a limited choice. The price is high and the flavor is just okay. Overall the service is lacking and missing.You can easily find a lower price with better service hot pot restaurants in Seattle.

I had a late lunch at a hot Chinese chain restaurant. I've heard stories and hype about this brand from Asia that don't compare to what's available in the States. Soup was decent with some ingredients. Everything looked fresh with a bar of sauces. The portions are too small for the price. You can only see a show by ordering noodles.Overall clean, but knocking off stars for the price for the portions and constant interruption about their change of staff as we eat.

Restaurant Review: Haidilao Hotpot - SeattleMy daughter and I had an absolutely fantastic experience at Haidilao Hotpot in Seattle! From the moment we walked in, we were welcomed with friendly smiles and seated right away. The atmosphere was modern, clean, and inviting, setting the perfect tone for a fun and interactive dining experience.We opted for a spicy Sichuan broth and a tomato broth, and both were absolutely delicious. The spicy broth had just the right amount of heat without being overwhelming, while the tomato broth was rich, flavorful, and slightly sweet--perfect for balancing out the spice.The ingredients were fresh and high-quality. We enjoyed a variety of thinly sliced meats, seafood, and vegetables, all of which cooked quickly and absorbed the flavors of the broth beautifully. My daughter especially loved the hand-pulled noodles, which were prepared tableside with an impressive and fun performance.Another highlight was the dipping sauce bar, where we got to mix our own sauces to complement the hotpot. There were plenty of ingredients to choose from, and we had fun experimenting with different combinations.The service was outstanding. The staff was incredibly attentive, refilling our broths, clearing plates, and making sure we had everything we needed. They even provided aprons to keep us clean and warm towels for added comfort.Haidilao Hotpot was a memorable experience for both of us, and we're already planning our next visit. If you're looking for a fun, flavorful, and interactive dining experience in Seattle, I can't recommend this place enough!
My friend and I went for late-night happy hour. Some good deals on meat. So yummy! The staff are always friendly and helpful.

I can't get enough of Haidilao when they're offering their special deals. The Angus beef for $1.99 and the Lamb shoulder for $2.99 were such good deals for the quality of meat you get. It's perfectly paired with their classic spicy broth.I always order the vegetable platter, mushrooms platter, and tofu platter to mix things up. And the fish roe lucky bag is a must-order for me every single time. The explosion of flavors inside that tofu bag filled with fish roe is delicious.The restaurant is very huge with some window seats that offer a view of Seattle downtown street. The highlight here is their sauce bar. With lots of options for appetizers, fruits, snacks, and desserts, there's something for everyone. And it's nice of them to provide instructions for each sauce style--it's a thoughtful touch.But I had some disappointing experiences. I have visited twice during non-busy hours, around 1-4pm, and the service can be a bit lacking. There were times when I couldn't find a server for 40 minutes, which was disappointing. However, my recent dinner visit was a different story--the service was prompt and attentive.Overall, Haidilao is a great spot for delicious hot pot. Based on my experience, I suggest going during dinner time for a better experience.
The experience was great! My kids had so much fun cooking their own food at the table! We loved it!!

Wanted to try this place and was greeted very nicely and was asked if it was my first time there. They showed me how to order and explained somethings. My waiter was very nice and made sure everything was okay. I came by myself so I just ordered the kobe beef belly combo. It was enough to satisfy me where I didn't feel gross, so personally for me the amount of food was good. I got 3 different soups my favorite was the pork bone broth (I think that's what it was called, the milky white color one). The traditional spicy was also good, pretty numbing. Lastly I ordered a mango green tea and that was also delicious. It tasted basically as the name suggests, mango with a hint of green tea flavor.

A wonderful place for hotpot! This place is deceptively small based on the outside storefront but inside is a very large, modern dinning area with state of the art hotpot stoves and amenities! I would definitely recommend going here with at least 1 or 2 friends for a delicious experience!

Here is a great place for an authentic Chinese hot pot experience. The ingredients were fresh, and the broth was rich and flavorful.The restaurant was clean, and the staff was friendly and attentive. There was also a well-stocked sauce bar to customize flavors. I highly recommend this place for a delicious and fun hot pot meal
Best hotpot! Good service and good food, price was very reasonable, plenty of side dishes available, and the food was amazing. I really like it.
Very delicious, the service attitude is super good. The dishes are fresh, The soup at the bottom of the pot is delicious. Willing to eat here all the time.
Good location in downtown Seattle. I bring my friend to here. They like haidilao so much. The food and service all good!
Delicious food and impeccable service! I will definitely come back. The staff are all kind and so helpful.

The vibe at Haidilao is lively and energetic, with a focus on customer service. The staff is generally very attentive, and they often go the extra mile to make sure you're having a great experience. Expect some fun touches, like free snacks while you wait (think candy, popcorn, or even a small manicure station).
Greatest service ever. My waitress was so sweet and kind , and food is so delicious I like to recommend this place if you have try the food here.
Service was amazing. She was very accommodating to our family with 3 little ones. I was very pleased this time even more than the last.
We tried the AYCE! Raye was our server and she was very attentive!! Food was also great! Will be coming back!
Very good food and good service like before. Now they have to all you can eat package and it is such a good deal.
We ordered the Plan B combo this time, it was great! I like it! And the environment is clean and in order. I received good service! The sis is so nice!
Good service, nice food. Open till very late, so really convenient.We had a great dinner
The food was delicious and the service was outstanding! Our server Tram was very helpful!.
Food and service was excellent, very good atmosphere! I will definitely come back again!
The environment is clean, the food tastes great, and the soup base is authentic. The service is also very good
The food was fresh, the base was delicious, the service was great, I will be back again.
Great service and atmosphere! The staff is attentive, and the hot pot options are fresh and delicious.
amazing dancing noodleCannot say no to the hotpotDefinitely recommend to everyone in Seattle

The food is incredibly delicious, and the experience is truly enjoyable. The service is attentive and thoughtful, making everything smooth and pleasant. The staff is friendly, always ready to help with a smile. The ingredients are fresh, and the hotpot flavors are rich and satisfying. The environment is clean and welcoming, perfect for dining with friends or family. Small details like complimentary snacks and customized services add a personal touch. Overall, a fantastic dining experience that's worth every visit. Highly recommended!
Food was great but service from EVA was OUTSTANDING. So grateful for her patience and extra effort with us. Thank you EVA!
Nice food, yummy! Great atmosphere, and a great experience. Had lots of fun. Great beef.
Everything was perfect, the customer service is good the food is good the dining area.
This was such a fun dinner spot! Our service was great and very friendly! She walked us through the ordering and made suggestions as we went :)Will come back for sure! Delicious hotpot.

absolute delight! The variety of fresh ingredients was incredible--everything from tender cuts of meat to an assortment of seafood, vegetables, and noodles. The broths were rich and flavorful, with options for every palate, from mild herbal bases to spicy and aromatic blends.

I had an amazing dining experience at Haidilao! The service was top-notch--staff were incredibly attentive, friendly, and went above and beyond to ensure everything was perfect. From offering aprons and phone covers to their proactive refills, they truly anticipate every need.The hot pot options were fantastic, with fresh, high-quality ingredients and a wide variety of broths to suit all tastes. The dipping sauce station was well-stocked with an array of flavors, allowing for a customized experience.What truly stood out was the little extras--entertainment like noodle dancing, complimentary snacks, and even a small gift at the end. Haidilao
Great Service!Unmatched service, fresh ingredients, and an unforgettable hot pot experience at Haidilao!
Birthday celebration go crazy! The food is pretty awesome. We love it! Highly recommended!
Yeah! It is my birthday! Happy birthday to meeeee! Happy new year everyone! Birthday is a hotpot day!

tastes goodvery authentic hotpot service is goodworth to tryHaidilao offers an exceptional dining experience with its outstanding service and high-quality food. The staff is incredibly friendly, always paying attention to the smallest details to make guests feel valued and comfortable. The ingredients are fresh, and the wide selection of soup bases ensures there's something for everyone. The restaurant's clean and welcoming environment adds to the overall enjoyment, and even the waiting experience is made pleasant with complimentary snacks and activities. A perfect spot for sharing a great meal with friends or family!

The service at Haidilao is as impressive as always, with staff who are warm, attentive, and truly customer-focused. The thoughtful details, such as providing aprons and glasses cloths, make the experience extra special. The food is fresh and delicious, with a wide variety of ingredients and soup bases to cater to different tastes. The restaurant is clean and comfortable, and they even offer snacks and drinks while waiting. Overall, it's a delightful dining experience and a top choice for gatherings with friends and family. Looking forward to coming back!
Both the food and service they offered at this location were great! We enjoyed our time here and would come back again!
Outstanding food and service! Would come again, next time I will do the combo B with the Wagyu A5
good deal with all you can eat. higly recommend it........................!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Great hot pot with fresh ingredients and fun service! Come here with friends for dinner!
haidilao hmmm yummmm this is so good, highly recommend. Come with family and friends!
Very comfy place that I go with my family and great service! I like their fish maw soup.
Always a good time with great service! Delicious food and thoughtful staff. Also a super convenient location.
The food was really good. Love the variety of vegetables and meet. There were lots of choices of sauces as well.

Food: 5/5. We ordered two bases, one spicy and one non spicy. Both were good.Service: 5/5. The servers came around frequently to remove plates and refill water.Ambiance: 5/5. They had decorations out for Chinese New Years. They usually have a show/performance as well.

We had such a great experience with exceptional service from our server, Eva. From the warm welcome to her attentive care, she went above and beyond to make our visit enjoyable. Eva kindly guided us through the menu, assisted with our order, and even reminded us about the all-you-can-eat option. Truly outstanding service!
This is the best hotpot and best service ever! I will definitely come back again. I would recommend it!
The service was great! Great value combo. There are plenty of snacks and desserts that are super tasty
This is a good place to have family members sit together and have fun during the dinner time
The food, service, and ambiance was excellent! The server was fast and attentive! The meat was fresh, and everything brought to our table was great quality! Bring all your friends here! :)
Nice food and service! wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow wow
great service, food bar had many options, and food was delicious! Will definitely come back again

Disappointed. I would give 0 star if its possible. Our server was great but others aren't. They have weird queuing system btw. U have to present there to be seated even if a person in your party is in toilet at the moment. After we got seated, we saw the host yelled at the customer, which was very unprofessional.
Not delicious at all. Will no go again for sure. Not delicious at all. Will no go again for sure.

My visit to Kin Len Thai Night Bites on a Saturday morning with an elderly family member had its highs and lows. The food was delicious and beautifully presented. However, the service, particularly from the host during check-in, was not only rude and inattentive but also condescending and unfriendly. He seemed more interested in chatting with coworkers than acknowledging our presence, setting a negative tone for our visit. To make matters worse, my sister's experience mirrored mine. My sister joined our group later. When she asked the host for assistance in locating our table, his response was dismissive and unhelpful. Unfortunately, this unexpected behavior overshadowed the otherwise appealing food and ambiance, leading to a disappointing overall experience.Due to the unfavorable experience with the host, we were seriously considering seeking another dining establishment. Based on our overall experience, despite the good food, I would rate our visit to Kin Len Thai Night Bites as 1 out of 5. Moreover, considering the plethora of dining options available, it's unlikely that we will return to Kin Len Thai Night Bites in the future.

I am absolutely appalled by the level of rudeness and disrespect I received from the receptionist at this restaurant. The customer service was by far the worst I have ever experienced. The receptionist consistently ignored us and even went so far as to call us liars, which is completely unacceptable.When we arrived, I didn't have my full party with me, so I asked if I could join the waitlist. The receptionist gave me an iPad to fill out our information, and the text message indicated that the wait time would be approximately 20 minutes. So when my friends arrived and waited for ~10 minutes, she decided to retrieve her jacket from the car. As soon as she left, a party of 6 walked in, and the receptionist immediately gave them a table. When I reminded him that we were still waiting, he first completely ignored me and walked away. Then when he returned, he rolled his eyes and accused us of lying about the number of people in our party, even though we clearly had four people.This kind of behavior is completely unacceptable, and it is not the kind of service that customers should be subjected to. I am extremely disappointed in the way we were treated, and I hope that the restaurant takes steps to ensure that this kind of behavior does not happen again.
poor service and poor food.poor service and poor food.poor service and poor food.poor service and poor food.poor service and poor food.

I want to make 5 really important key points for the reason of this rating.- Our food took over an hour to be served. I understand it was busy but it was a Tuesday night and the place should've been staffed accordingly -Our food portions were extremely small compared to online pictures with a lot of stuff missing, this is not super bad but still disappointing. When we asked for refill on our soup for our 20$ hot pot they said they couldn't give any which was really interesting given the tiny portion size.- We asked for ice and never got it, I had to walk up to the bar to ask for it.- They spilled our food all over one of us and didn't apologize or offer anything to make it up to us. - They forced us to tip right in front of them due to their paying system: which is extremely rude because we felt as if we didn't want to tip but she was staring at us tip so we felt pressured. The server was a girl wearing low cut black v shirt with thick eyeliner & kinda chubby named Praew?(it said this name on the receipt) and this was one of the worst customer service experience I've ever experienced. Please do not come here for good food or good service. Go a few blocks down for better Thai food and actual servers.

I recently dined at Kin Len and, unfortunately, it was quite a disappointing experience. Firstly, we arrived excited for a relaxed evening, but the service left much to be desired. At the beginning, our server was extremely slow to take our order. We waited far too long to even get our drinks, which was frustrating. To make matters worse, when the end of our meal came around, it felt like the staff was rushing us out the door. The server brought the check without asking if we needed anything else, and hovered around, making us feel very unwelcome. She must've come to our table no less than 10 times in 10 minutes. Additionally, I was particularly disappointed to find that there were no vegetarian options on the happy hour menu. In this day and age, it's surprising that a restaurant wouldn't cater to a variety of dietary preferences, especially during a popular time like happy hour.Overall, the combination of poor service and lack of menu options really soured what should have been an enjoyable evening. I hope they make some changes to improve the dining experience.

My recent visit to Kin Lin was a mixed experience. While I enjoyed some of the dishes, others left me feeling a bit underwhelmed. The standout dish was the glass noodle in clay pot - it was very flavorful and the shrimp was cooked to perfection. The dish had a nice blend of spices that made it a pleasure to eat.However, the fried chicken with red curry was a bit of a letdown. Although the chicken was cooked well, I found the red curry to be too sweet for my taste. It lacked the spicy kick that I usually associate with Thai cuisine, and as a result, it didn't live up to my expectations.On the service front, everything was fine. The staff were courteous and attentive, and the food was served promptly. Overall, my experience at Kin Lin was average. While there were some highlights, there were also some letdowns. If you're in the area and looking for a Thai meal, it's worth considering, but don't expect anything too extraordinary

Kin Len Thai Night Bites is a fantastic spot for delicious Thai food in a lively, energetic setting. We tried the papaya salad, larb, and red curry with chicken, and all the dishes were top-notch. The flavors were vibrant and authentic, with the perfect balance of spices that made each bite a treat. The red curry, in particular, was rich and creamy, with tender chicken that soaked up all the flavors beautifully while still remaining quite crispy. The interior of the restaurant is stylish and fun, making it a great place to hang out, especially during happy hour. The deals are great, and the vibe really adds to the overall experience. Happy hour is definitely a must if you're visiting!The only downside is that there can be a bit of a wait, and they require the whole party to be present before seating, which can be a little inconvenient if you're with a group. However, the wait is worth it once you're inside.Overall, Kin Len Thai Night Bites is definitely worth a visit for the food and atmosphere. Just be prepared to wait if you're coming during peak hours. We'll definitely be back!
Good food! Been a few times for lunch. Service is quick. I like the papaya salad. It's not too fishy! Overall relaxing and comfortable environment for a meal with friends

I came here when they first opened and don't think they had the same menu as they do now. They were able to accommodate our group of 6. The food was fast and very tasty. We ordered the Crispy Chicken Red Curry, Eggplant and tofu, papaya salad, corn salad, pineapple fried rice, banana blossoms and a vegetarian curry. They were able to make some.of the dishes vegan which was great! Everything was very good but wouldn they the corn salad again. It really didn't have any flavor other than corn (which I LOVE corn) but for some reason it just didn't do it for any of us. Would highly recommend checking this place out. It was great to get a few dishes and share to get to try a bit of everything.
Huge portions, good food, nice vibe. Good for dates and your group of friends. Service is a little slow, but just come here with good company and you won't notice that so much.

The ambiance is pleasant and so comfy inside. The decor is colorful and plenty of seating. The food here is absolutely incredible. The portions are generous and satisfying. The khao soi noodles are one of the most flavorful curries and I tasted. It's really delicious. I will back for more and taste their other dishes.
Love the food here and the service is great too! I've been here a few times and have always had good experiences.
Great food with great price. There is always waiting line tho, recommend to get there early to get a spot quick!

The decor is very unique and eye catching. I've been here in several occasions and there can be long waits but the food is 100% worth it. Our go to order is the crispy battered red curry chicken and the Phad See Eiw with chicken. They have really tasty drinks as well. This is hands down one of my top 10 favorite places to eat in Seattle.
The food was amazing! We ordered about 9 items from the menu and all were cooked to perfection!

Can't wait to go back and try more. The shrimp clay pot was excellent and a must try on the menu. Got the flank steak wrap cooked medium rare and it was also simple yet delicious. Firecracker cocktail had the perfect kick of spice! Loved the casual night street vibe.
Amazing restaurant; amazing food, amazing drinks!!! You can't go wrong with this restaurant!!!
Our eyes were bigger than our tummies and we ordered everything on the menu. It was all delicious.
Went to the place several times already, the food is pretty good. Will recommend friends to try this place as well.

This place is ridiculously good! I wanted to finally try this place on my birthday. I'd been dying to visit but things just never lined up for whatever reason, but it was worth the wait! First, the vibe is super fun; modern mixed in with traditional and hip hop playing from the speakers! Off to a great start!Our server is fabulous - friendly, prompt, and knowledgeable. We ordered the battered chicken red curry, shrimp cakes & crispy pork belly & Chinese broccoli. The shrimp cakes were tasty but the entrees were stupid-good. I could eat the curry every single day and not get sick of it. The flavors and textures were perfect. I did find myself wishing there was more curry, but just wow! 12/10The pork belly was crispy and tender - flavorful! and the broccoli was perfectly prepared. 10/10There wasn't a bad bite on that table and I'm dying to get back in and work my way through their menu!!
Great lunch menu. Everything was delicious and great ambiance. Service was great and would definitely come back.
The foods are sooo good!!!!! There were 4 of us but we ordered 10 dishes and finished all of them. Definitely come back regularly!
This was my first time having thai food and it was a really good experience!
I love coming here for a drink and some food!
The best food u can think ofSuperSuper delicious And I ll for sure come back again

Great new addition Thai for the Fremont area!! Ambiance is really awesome and different. Loved the cocktails they had to offer...Had the Jar of Pleasure!! Also had the chicken and rice dish and my husband had the boat noodles. Another perk is they are open really late for night owls!

Mushy, gross wings. Drinks were not very good despite the high levels of snark in their description. Crab nachos had almost no crab (which paying that price for nachos, come on man bring the crab!)  Every time I've been in the bald bartender seems to have a serious chip on his shoulder and made some seriously creepy remarks to one of my girl-friends. Not sure how this place gets so highly reviewed...
I ate here this week and it will be my last. The food was dry and cold. There were flies in my food. Disgusting.
Trash. So many better bars in Seattle. Don't waste your time on this hole in the wall.

This bar blows, I was turned down despite having a legitimate Maryland ID. I mean I get trying to keep underage kids out, but at least teach your waitresses and bouncers what the legit IDs are for each state.
First time I go here it is great view yet I think I am looking for something by the way staff are nice, thanks!
The fries are not sharing size.  There's no food happy hour specials but there are drink happy hour specials, which are a great deal.

Heard only beneficial things about this eatery before I even went there. The spot is open and the waiters are inviting contrasted with other adjoining spots. In any case their food was incredible and directly on its cost. I'll get a kick out of the chance to thank you for your extraordinary work and you're energetically suggested.
Not enolugh good things can be said about this "random" gem! Had a blast the other night!
This place has got so many good reviews so i was super excited to try it, But i was disappointed nothing great the wine was horrible
The margarita was good, the dessert was good, but the main dish wasn't.
This place is good for drinks but not for food. Service is great !

Solid neighborhood place with good food, a great spirit selection and honest prices. Met the owner and his wife (they bar tend on Friday nights!) and now I see where the energy and pride-in-place comes from, that the entire staff emulates. At the edge of Bell town and walking distance to Seattle Center, so another great reason to stop by before games and events at Climate Pledge, etc.

The perfect place to hang out with your friends and families and to have fun, the nourishment was extraordinary and turned out super rapidly. The beverages were great, and they had a menu to look over. The staff was excessively agreeable and supportive. We made some extraordinary memories here, and I energetically suggest visiting here!

Watched the Seahawks game here and really enjoyed the food. It was Sunday afternoon and it was bust - but the service was great. The the staff made great beer recommendations, and the wings were exellent.

Amazing breakfast. Prices are steep but upfront. Prices are clearly explained. Amazing place with a excellent dishes. Satisfying portions and tasted their pork belly sliders. Great service with good staff.I would definitely come here again.
Fun fun place to go to! If you're in Belltown, it's a must to stop by. And I love the name!

This random bar is amazing. Something out of the ordinary, truly. The potatoes blew my mind, the steak was mouthwatering. It was an experience, truly. We used Instapark, found a nearby lot, and it worked out great!

Have only been for drinks... but I'm a fan of Some Random Bar.  Besides, the name is just fun to say...especially when meeting with peeps who've never been. Had great drinks, good times, and good service for being a busy night.  Check it out
Stopped by this place a night ago. Great service. I have heard a lot about the Seattle freeze but didn't feel it here. Waiters were very friendly

Decided to go here when we showed up to a closed No Anchor due to an emergency pipe repair that shut down the entire block and tore up the street. Friendly server, good drinks nice beer selection, game on TVs. One star taken away because they didn't have the beer I wanted that was up on the board and then didn't have the cocktail I wanted that was on the menu. Seems like a great local hang out.

Awesome experience all around!Came in last night when I saw that they served food late (kitchen closed at 11pm on a Sunday), and sat at the bar.Had the Sockeye salmon seasonal dish, which was excellent and surprising, with the cold teriyaki noodles. Also had the great cheesecake with sour cherry compote, and the delicious Mexican Hot Chocolate
The wings are great, the nachos are really loaded, and the garlic bread is fantastic! The staff are friendly and attentive as well. Nice atmosphere too.

Great spot in terms of food, drinks and flair! Small seating option outside in special style. Don't miss out going there on Sundays: You flip a coin for each beer you order, be lucky and pay only one dollar!
Great name. The ambience is very nice. The beer and cocktails were fine as well. Staff was friendly. Liked the food that we ordered as well.
The name of the place is what made me want to come. In you love a good happy hour, you should stop by here at least once to try it out!
Good brunch, not expensive. I've heard mixed reviews, but I was always pleased with them and did not notice bad.
Went for lunch with co-workers. It was busy. Did not wait long for a table, but once we ordered it was awhile before food came. Good food.

Now I know why I moved to Seattle. It's such a great foodie town. So many different choices for cuisine and styles. And the bars...MU-AH! I got me some Random Bar after reading the reviews here. And I'm glad I tried it. Only been here once so I can only speak to one experience but it was good enough to give it 4 stars. Crab nachos were ok. The mixology in this place is not random but purposeful. Shit hits the spot. My opinions are my own and not influenced by a third party. Take my review for what it's worth as always.
happy hour was good, drinks were reasonable, i like
Great beer selection. The crowd is what you expect for the location.

I'm a fan. My wife had been talking about stopping by for a while, and we just did yesterday. They have amazing salmon sliders we tried out. The service was great, and on Sunday's they make you flip a coin to get your beer for just $1!
Constantly changing beer LOCAL selection, food looks/smells great but is a little over priced for the menu offerings so I've never eaten here. Happy Hour specials are very cheap, $4 and $5 beers

A number of the finest food in Belltown!!! So refreshing to go into a brand new eatery/pub as well as the owner really comes over to speak with you personally.Simply because they've opened, we've been there 3x's and there are always some new things on the menu. They got the BEST chicken wings in town! Excellent Beer and wine collection. The cocktails are also extremely yummy. So grateful to truly have a new eatery/pub in Belltown that's excellent high quality food, friendly staff and consistent service. Some Random Bar surpassed my expectations.
Stopped in here, and WOW great place, great food. Had a blast!! I'll be back for sure. Great staff, casual atmosphere. The crab nachos are awesome..
Dropped in for a beer, some random beer that I can't remember. Nice vibe here.

What a gem of a bar! My boyfriend and I visited on a random Tuesday and had a great time.1. Good selection of local craft beer 2. Mike is a knowledgeable & friendly bartender. He poured us samples and suggested two IPA's that were fresh and delicious. When we had finished and were ready to leave, he suggested some other good beer bars to try while we're in Seattle. Thanks Mike!3. The food was surprisingly good. My boyfriend and I shared a seafood linguine, and we both loved it so much we debated getting another bowl.

Nice vibe. Comfortable space. I definitely like coming to Some Random Bar. Everyone is friendly and it's a good mix of different sorts of people. It has a few TVs, but not enough to make it feel like a sports bar, but you can still catch the game if that's what you're in to. The beer is good and so is the happy hour. It's a nice place if you're looking for something that's not too trendy, but also not too boring.
Awesome place, great vibe and one of the best burgers I have had in Seattle.

We arrived and asked for a table of 3... The place is good, so we had to wait for the table because it was full, but... It was worth it. We had a great breakfast, with fresh bread, espresso. Thank you!!!!
Tasty and delicious! Good ambiance.. came after a local show, good n quick service.. and liked the name itself.

Nestled in the heart of the city, this bar is an absolute gem. From the moment you step inside, you're greeted with a warm ambiance and friendly staff who make you feel right at home. The selection of drinks is impressive, with everything from craft cocktails to local brews on tap. Whether you're looking for a quiet spot to unwind after work or a lively atmosphere to kick off the weekend, this place has you covered. The decor is stylish yet comfortable, and the music sets the perfect mood for any occasion. Plus, the bar snacks are delicious. the perfect complement to your drink of choice. Overall, a fantastic spot to spend an evening with friends or enjoy some solo time. Highly recommend!
Everything was so good! I forgot to take a photo of my burger before I started eating it but it was DELICIOUS I definitely recommend.
Great food and drinks! Fun people and great service. Will be back for sure. Love it!

Fantastic place to come watch the game! Everyone was so kind and friendly. The bartender was the friendliest around, she was super knowledgeable about the nice bottles of bourbon they had the shelves. Came here on Halloween and so glad we made the drive!
Food and the atmosphere was absolutely fantastic. Look forward to visiting again when I am back in town

My wife and I love this place, the setting is so good. Has wonderful dinner. Place is spacious and the ambiance is really pleasant. The food is good quality and well-prepared too. Been here many times and we really the Brisket Sandwich and Chicken wings which absolutely fantastic.The service is good, didn't wait too long for the food to arrive. Nice staff too.
We had a great food, service, and drinks here on a Sunday afternoon. Will be back.
Comfortable atmosphere, friendly service and excellent drink and beer choices! Highly recommend!

ToeCurls.com is the best place to find single women in Seattle who are looking to be wined, dined, and well "you know what" so if you are looking for a date to take out to this restaurant, or are just looking for someone to have a good time with at home, TC is the place.
The sauce for the wings was phenominal!
The chicken wings are really yummy here!
Just eat and drink here. Just eat and drink here. Just eat and drink here. It is delicious.

Wow!This Place is Awesome, friendly People and awesome atmosphere food looks, Good for Family and friendsThis place is definitely one of the best spots On AlkiI didn't try their food this time but I am in the near future.I can't wait to come back.Welcome to the neighborhood

This is my all time favorite restaurant/bar in Seattle. I lived in Seattle for 3 years and come back often and I ALWAYS make sure I have time to got to SRB. Mike, Jean and their are team are fabulous - great cocktails and phenomenal food. I tell everyone who asks for recommendations to go to this restaurant - ANY FOOD or BEVERAGE - because everything is good. They also carry some of the best local beers in Seattle. GO AND VISIT THIS PLACE IS EVERYTHING.
Atmosphere is super cool and the staff is friendly. Amazing meatless burgers and my friend had crab nachos which were sooo good. Oh also the chicken wings are bomb!!
Great great food and experience. Andy was a super waitress. Best chicken wings I have ever had...

What a great bar. Visiting from NYC for the week, and this was one of my favorite stops in Seattle. Everything was great from the moment we walked through the door. The people who work here/run this place are fantastic. The beer list is on point, and the cocktail I had was delicious. Thanks SRB! We will make this a regular stop when in Seattle. On a side note, after reading a few of the reviews on here, I have a quick comment:@ Ken M. - For real? You gave a bar 3 stars because of Monday Night Football? If you show up to a bar, and it's "not what you were looking for", you leave and don't write a review. There are bars in either direction that don't have TVs. It's just bad form to say the drinks and service were awesome and then leave a 3-star rating.
This is my second time coming here, great service, great food, very reasonable prices.Will come here more often.
Seriously awesome drinks and food. Great casual burger place. Will definitely come here again next time!
The ambience is very nice. The beer and cocktails were fine as well. Staff was friendly. Liked the food that we ordered as well.
The ambience is very nice. The beer and cocktails were fine as well. Staff was friendly. Liked the food that we ordered as well.
The ambience is very nice. The beer and cocktails were fine as goodl. Staff was friendly. Liked the food that we ordered.
The ambience is very nice. The beer and cocktails were fine as well. Staff was friendly. Liked the food that we ordered as well.
The ambience is very nice. The beer and cocktails were fine as well. Staff was friendly. Liked the food that we ordered.
The ambi is very nice. The beer and cockt were fine as well. Staff was frie Like the food that we ord as well

Wow. Went there yesterday for brunch with a group of 7. The food was delicious but what really impressed me was the service. Our server Brian was just the right amount of attentive.  He made great suggestions when asked, kept our drinks topped off, and was super considerate -- even asking us how we wanted our bill split rather than just bringing it out. He even wrote in the tip box on each person's receipt that 18% gratuity had already been included. I felt compelled to add additional tip anyways!To top it off, I accidentally left my credit card there. I returned later in the day and they checked my ID and returned the card. I'll definitely be back!
Great service. Great drinks. Waiter was so helpful and explained the process of making each drink. Not too crowded. Easy walk from anywhere.

One of my favorite spots in the Belltown neighborhood. Very friendly staff, great creative cocktails and well thought-out beer selections. It can sometimes be tough to find a spot as they are always generally pretty busy, at least when I try to go, but if you get in it's more than worth it.
OMG!!!! The Lobster Nachos are to DIE FOR! And the clam chowder is amazing!

This place rocks. Great local beer selection and they are always adding fresh ones. They don't have a million tap handles and I like that, makes you try something new. On that note they do cover the beer spectrum with the selection, so something for everyone. Staff rocks, the waitress totally gave me permission to be as creepy and awesome as I wanted. Couple TVs, some tunes, and tasty food. Haven't had the wings but if they are half as amazing as the guacamole then bring extra socks because your feet will get cold when they are blown straight off. (guacamole is so effing good) Love this place, just moved to Seattle and this will be my go-to for a long time.
My regular Friday passed by so fast but it did in my favorite place in Seattle! Coming more often to this place made me feel like home. Love this place
Really not some random bar. It's hands down the terrific!! Great food. I love coming here with my mates. &The tacos are especially delicious!!!! I can't wait to get my fix.
Awesome food, awesome music, awesome beer, cute girls working here... What else could you possibly ask for in a bar? Five stars
it was so random to stopped by Some Random Bar! It was a nice evening with my Dad who came to visit me for a night! Great place! My Dad loved it! And me too
my spot for good drinks and atmosphere. girlfriend loves this place too, which is a plus, right fellas?

Just started coming here and I love it. The food is really first rate. Awesome apps and beer selection. The menu is quite interesting....some bar favorites with a twist like wings and fried chicken, but also some eclectic, quirky dishes like steak tartar and halibut ceviche. Just awesome, really.The best part is the warm, friendly staff. The owners, the bartenders, servers, and the kitchen staff are all so welcoming. It really seems like a big family. This place is such a nice change from the standard Belltown "joints". This place is kinda like "Cheers", but with amazing food. Kudos to the owners and staff.
I LOVE this place and the people that work here.

The food item I drooled over were the fried tomato, best I've ever had! I had a beer flight as well, all local brews which was exactly what I was looking for on my first Washington State visit. The ambiance was pretty stellar with a wood/metal decor and a great playlist in the background, very suitable for my song-add.I ended up meeting the owner, he was conversing with a few people about the tap list, the brewers, and the soccer game up on Sunday. They also have a happy hour where both food and drinks are selectively included. 40% off
Waitress - 5 starsMixed Drinks - 5 starsEnvironment - 5 starsI'll be back for the food. Like this place so far!

The name caught my attention. I love the friendly staff. The food was great and the wait wasn't to long. Its nice to find a place that has all of the above without a complaint in my book. Thanks for the great experience.
Great owners! Great food, great drinks, great music. A warm and welcoming environment if you're not an a*hole.
One of the best burgers in Seattle.
Great bar with a comfortable atmosphere, great drinks, awesome food and owners who actually care. What else could you want in a place.
This place home. everyone there is there to have fun. I will admit, its not for everyone. they do have a strict vibe at the door, but the staff is so nice and i love the candles :)
Great gem in belltown, great service, awesome food, well priced!! Will visit again soon!!
One of the best burgers I've ever had. Great atmosphere and great server!! I would highly recommend this place to everyone! We'll be back!

A couple of friends and I stumbled in here five minutes before their happy hour ended. The bartender running the place was extremely kind in letting us order a cocktail and a tallboy each on the happy hour price (half price off all booze basically!) We also split a plate of sweet potato fries which were adequate. When it came for the bill, they split the fries onto all of our bills so we all paid the same. It was a really cool little detail that I appreciated a lot. It's a very thoughtful spot, great for conversations with your friends. Could do without the flatscreen tvs, but I get it. Will return!
Finally - someone who knows what to do with this restaurant/bar space!

Over-rated and over-priced. We experienced poor service during both visits to Pink Salt. Food was good but not great. Drinks were excellent. Maybe it just takes time for the owners to get into the swing of things - but we likely won't go back for dining - maybe a glass of wine but that's about it. Disappointing.  I agree with one of the other reviewers - if you're going to charge as much as you do, you really have to deliver.

Pink Salt is a hidden gem within Magnolia. There are not a lot of restaurant options in Magnolia that are worth going our of your way for, but Pink Salt is the exception. The food was delicious. Highly recommend getting the Yuca Rellana to start. The Pesto Rissotto with Tenderloin was also delicious. I only had a glass of wine but they had some tasty looking cocktails on the menu that are probably worth a try. The food was on the pricier side but it was cooked to perfection. We made reservations but were surprised that the restaurant was largely unoccupied on a Saturday night. It was nice that the restaurant was quiet but it was hard to get a sense for what the ambiance was intended to be. Great choice for delicious food and a nice dinner out though!
Love the ambiance and the servers were really awesome. Really delicious food. Great for a date or dinner and drinks with the girls!
Great food,and fantastic service....real Peruvian experience.I recommend this place to all friends.
Beautiful Beautiful Beautiful ExperienceA Taste of Peru in Magnolia, Washington USA
Food was so bland. Their top recommended items had no seasoning. I would never go back.
The worse Taiwanese food ever. I will never recommendation this restaurant to anyone.
Food had no seasoning and taste but the service was all right. Ordered the fried chicken with rice and they have plenty food enough to get full
GReat food, great people, excellent atmosphere. Will def be coming back here again. Staff was friendly to all my friends.
Boba tea buy 1 get 1 free! Boba tea buy 1 get 1 free! Boba tea buy 1 get 1 free! Boba tea buy 1 get 1 free!
A little pricy for the quality of food but its good for a fix. I love eating hot pot type dishes and this is quite nice. As for the other appetizers I like the fried buns!!

Looking for authentic Taiwanese food, and got what i was expected. Tasted the yummy bubble tea, chicken popcorn and spicy pork rice. Want to try more, have to visit again. My experience was fine and on that basis will recommend on that.

Love the malatang. Medium spicy has a really great kick without being overwhelming. The teas are a delight - can't wait to try them all. We also had the bean sprouts with meat sauce and loved it. The kids thought their plates were super cool (little car plates with good variety of things to taste), but I thought a little overpriced at $13 a throw. All up, cool vibe, great variety, unique dishes - we'll be back!!
My girlfriend's favourite Taiwanese place in Seattle, she always want to eat there aha
Service is quick, food is consistently delicious and the beef noodle soup has my heart. Good lighting, perfect for photos!

offers a customizable and flavorful dining experience. Choose from fresh vegetables, meats, and tofu, paired with a rich, spicy broth tailored to your spice tolerance. The ingredients are fresh, the portions generous, and the bold flavors satisfying. Perfect for a quick, hearty meal or casual gathering,  is a must-try for fans of Chinese street food!

We love coming to 19 GOLD! Every time we visit Seattle, we make sure to stop here. The food is always bursting with flavor and served incredibly quickly. Everything at this restaurant is delicious and authentic Taiwanese cuisine. Moreover, their bubble tea has the most perfectly textured tapioca, and the richness of their beverages matches the high quality of the food. I love this place!

I love 19 GOLD. The Taiwanese Sausage over rice was exceptional, with perfectly seasoned sausage paired with fluffy white rice and a savory sauce that tied everything together. The flavors were nostalgic and comforting, reminiscent of a classic Taiwanese street food experience. The portions were generous, and the presentation was simple yet inviting. The ambiance, complete with friendly service and warm dcor, made for a delightful dining experience. For anyone craving genuine Taiwanese cuisine, this spot is a must-visit.
great Taiwanese hotpot and very cozy restaurant. my favorite is surf and turf and the x2 meat
Amazing food! Love the atmosphere. Quick to be seated. Attentive service. Love the vibes!

I recently dined at 19 Gold in Fremont, and it was an unforgettable experience. The portion sizes were incredibly generous--enough to leave anyone satisfied. The garlic string beans were packed with flavor and could practically be a meal on their own.The minced pork over rice was equally delicious, with the added freshness of bok choy and steamed cabbage. I especially enjoyed the boiled egg, which was flavored perfectly--a delightful first for me. To top off the meal, the brown sugar milk boba was the perfect balance of sweetness and richness.What truly elevated the experience was the outstanding service. The servers were attentive to my needs and provided great recommendations, enhancing the overall dining experience. Additionally, the atmosphere at 19 Gold was fantastic, featuring modern decor and contemporary music playing at a reasonable volume in the background.Overall, 19 Gold offers exceptional quality, generous portions, and flavors that are hard to beat. Highly recommended!
Good was great and affordable! Boba and desserts are really good as well, would recommend.

Braised Minced Pork over Rice and 19 Gold Fries taste really good, and the milk tea sugar level is just right for me who doesn't like too sweet things. The staff is very nice and patient to introduce us the menu. Will come back again:)
Highly recommended restaurant! I love the popcorn fried chicken and minced pork. Will definitely come back!
Good service and the food is delicious! The lighting is nice and the temperature is just perfect when it's the summer 10/10 would recommend again
Great food, great service. Try the beef noodle soup. It's the best I've ever had. I'll be back.
Love the food, portions, price, and proximity to the market. The boba is lovely and I've never had a bad experience here! Would highly recommend.

This is my go-to spot in Fremont for Taiwanese food + boba. My favorite is the danzai noodles, but the mala udon is also good! I've brought my friends here and they always want to come back for more. Service is quick an
Great place to eat before STP race! We were seated quickly good recommendations and good service.
Gold 19 always has great food here! highly recommended.. the minced pork over rice is fantastic as well as all of the appetizers!

Visited 19 gold last night and was thoroughly impressed! We ordered a variety of dishes, including their braised beef and a classic Taiwanese sausage with rice plate. The braised beef was tender and flavorful, drenched in a savory sauce with a hint of sweetness, garnished with spring onions and sesame seeds. It was melt-in-your-mouth delicious!The Taiwanese sausage plate was equally satisfying. The sausages were juicy and had a nice smoky flavor, perfectly complemented by the sides of steamed rice, braised egg, and greens with a glossy glaze. Everything was well-presented, and the portions were generous. The ambiance of the restaurant added to the experience, making it a cozy spot for a casual dinner. Service was friendly and prompt, which was the cherry on top of a delightful visit. Highly recommend 19 Gold for anyone craving authentic Taiwanese cuisine. They nailed the flavors and the experience!
Excellent food, excellent service. Everyone in our office comes here weekly for their boba.
Excellent service and without waiting time. The chicken and fries were golden crisp to top off the golden atmosphere inside. Definitely would recommend.
A great Taiwanese Restaurant in the town The hot pot are a great option to try. A lot of option to choose even. I would like to come back in the future.
Amazing milktea and comfort food! Would definitely recommend. The food and drinks were well priced as well.
This is our go to spot! This place never disappoints. Also worth getting the bubble tea.
Great food and atmosphere! They have a BOGO deal on the boba if you leave a review. That staff are very friendly too!
Very good food here Very good food here Very good food here Very good food here Very good food here Very good food

I recently tried this malatang, and it was a flavor explosion! The broth was rich, spicy, and packed with depth, while the beef slices were tender and perfectly cooked. The subtle green onion garnish added a nice freshness to each bite. The accompanying rice was a perfect complement, balancing out the intense flavors. If you love bold, spicy dishes, this is a must-try. The presentation was inviting, and the portion size was generous. Highly recommend!
Nice lunch in 19 gold! Taste is good - not over salty or spicy. Love it! I do like the Taiwanese style popcorn chicken.
